Health benefit: Improves chest and triceps strength and enhances shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands on the wall at shoulder height and shoulder-width apart.
2. Step your feet back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows and lean your chest toward the wall while keeping your core tight.
4. Push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral while lowering with control

Health benefit: Builds pressing strength and supports daily upper body tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Bring your palms together in front of your chest with elbows out.
3. Press your palms firmly together and squeeze your chest.
Safety cue: Sit tall with shoulders down and press with a controlled tempo

Health benefit: Increases upper body strength with reduced load for progressive training
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands on the wall slightly below shoulder height and shoulder-width apart.
2. Step your feet back to create a straight angled line from head to heels.
3. Lower your chest toward the wall by bending your elbows while keeping a rigid core.
4. Push through your hands to extend your arms and return to the angled starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and descend slowly from the shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances chest muscle activation and improves muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Bring palms together in front of your chest with elbows pointing out.
3. Press your palms firmly together and engage your chest muscles.
4. Hold the squeeze for the chosen duration while keeping steady pressure.
Safety cue: Keep elbows level and ribs lowered while maintaining steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves shoulder stability and builds endurance in rotator cuff and deltoids
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall at an arm's length with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place palms flat on the wall at waist level and shoulder-width apart.
3. Slide your hands up the wall until they reach shoulder height with arms straight.
4. Hold the position with shoulders down and body aligned.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and shoulders down while holding the raise

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and increases joint circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Slightly bend your elbows and keep your hands relaxed with palms facing down.
3. Make small, controlled circular motions with both arms in one direction for the chosen time or reps.
Safety cue: Move from the shoulders with small controlled circles and avoid torso sway

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back muscles and supports improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, feet flat, and torso upright, arms extended forward at chest height.
2. Pull elbows back beside your ribs and squeeze your shoulder blades together as if rowing.
3. Hold the contracted position without leaning back and keep the core engaged.
4. Release slowly to the starting position or relax the hold if finished.
Safety cue: Sit tall, pull shoulder blades back and hold without shrugging

Health benefit: Engages core and shoulder stabilizers to enhance whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands on the wall at shoulder height and shoulder-width apart.
2. Step feet back into a straight plank line and keep your feet planted and hips level.
3. Lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder, then return it to the wall.
4. Repeat the opposite tap while avoiding any side-to-side rocking of the hips.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep hips level to minimize rotation while tapping

Health benefit: Boosts lower limb circulation and promotes basic aerobic activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift one knee a few inches forward without leaning the torso and place the foot back down.
3. Alternate lifting the other knee at a controlled, low height while swinging the opposite arm.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and lift knees with controlled, gentle motion

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and supports gentle cardiovascular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall near the front of a stable chair with feet flat and hands on your thighs.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while keeping your back straight.
3. Lower the right foot and lift your left knee in the same way.
4. Continue alternating knees in a steady marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Sit tall, engage the core and lift each knee with control

Health benefit: Improves balance and weight transfer control in standing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips or at your sides.
2. Shift your weight smoothly onto your right foot and lift your left heel slightly.
3. Shift your weight onto your left foot and repeat the weight shifts at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and shift weight over the standing foot

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and ankle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees soft, arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side and tap your right toe lightly on the floor.
3. Return the right foot to center and step your left foot out to the side, tapping the left toe.
4. Alternate toe taps side to side at a comfortable tempo.
Safety cue: Tap toes side-to-side with controlled movement

Health benefit: Promotes coordinated limb movement and light cardiovascular activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands at your sides.
2. Lift your right knee and raise your left arm forward simultaneously.
3. Lower them and lift your left knee while raising your right arm.
4. Continue alternating at a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Sit tall and lift arms and legs smoothly with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and gentle upper body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Swing both arms forward to shoulder height with a controlled motion.
3. Swing both arms backward past your hips while keeping your chest open.
4. Continue swinging smoothly and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Swing arms with control while maintaining a slight hip hinge

Health benefit: Improves upper body coordination and promotes light aerobic effort
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands near your chin.
2. Extend your right arm forward in a light punch with a straight wrist.
3. Retract the right hand to the starting position and extend the left arm.
4. Alternate punches at a comfortable, relaxed pace.
Safety cue: Punch lightly while keeping shoulders down

Health benefit: Encourages hip extension control and safe backward stepping practice
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Step one foot slowly backward and tap the heel lightly on the floor.
3. Push through the front foot to return to the starting position under control.
4. Repeat with the other leg, alternating slowly and maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Step back slowly and keep weight balanced over the front foot

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps activation and promotes knee joint stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Lift the opposite knee to about hip level and extend the lower leg forward to near straight.
3. Pulse the extended leg with small controlled movements, then lower and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep the standing leg stable and extend the knee in small controlled pulses

Health benefit: Maintains spinal mobility and improves trunk rotation awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a stable seat with feet flat and hands lightly on your chest.
2. Brace your core and rotate your torso a few degrees to one side using a small controlled movement.
3. Return to center and repeat to the other side, keeping movements small and steady.
Safety cue: Sit tall and twist only from the ribs within a small range

Health benefit: Enhances ankle range of motion and circulation around the foot
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one leg extended and the other foot flat for support.
2. Lift the extended foot slightly off the ground and point the toes.
3. Rotate the ankle slowly in full circles, then reverse direction.
Safety cue: Rotate the ankle slowly with relaxed toes

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexibility and eases movement into daily activities
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on the floor with knees bent and feet together.
2. Pull the feet toward the groin and let the knees fall outward.
3. Press gently on the inner thighs with your elbows to increase the opening.
4. Hold the position, then release and switch foot placement if desired.
Safety cue: Open the hip slowly while keeping the spine neutral

Health benefit: Improves posterior hip activation and standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or a support.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and keep the standing knee soft.
3. Lift the other leg straight back a few inches using the glute, keeping hips square.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and core braced as you extend the leg

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and upper back relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and relax your arms by your sides.
2. Inhale and lift both shoulders toward your ears, then exhale and roll them back and down in a smooth circle.
3. Repeat the circular motion three to five times in the same direction with controlled breathing.
4. Reverse the direction and perform the same smooth rolls three to five times.
Safety cue: Roll shoulders slowly with controlled range and upright posture

Health benefit: Enhances lateral neck mobility and segmental movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and keep your chin level.
2. Gently slide your right ear toward your right shoulder without lifting the opposite shoulder.
3. Return to center and repeat the glide to the left for the same count.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and glide the neck laterally with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves pelvic control and low back movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, knees soft, and place hands on your hips or lower abdomen.
2. Tuck your pelvis under by engaging your lower abdominal muscles and flattening your lower back.
3. Release the tilt by tilting your pelvis slightly forward to return to a neutral spine.
4. Repeat the controlled posterior-anterior tilts for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Engage lower abs and tilt the pelvis with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Encourages spinal mobility and controlled flexion extension sequencing
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Place hands behind your head or across your chest.
3. Exhale and round your spine, drawing your chin toward your chest to flex.
4. Inhale and arch your upper back, lifting your chest and gaze to extend.
Safety cue: Start from the thoracic spine and move with a long neutral neck

Health benefit: Increases wrist range of motion and forearm coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and place palms on the floor shoulder-width apart with fingers pointing forward.
2. Rock your hips back to feel wrist extension, then shift forward to load wrist flexion.
3. Turn fingers outward and inward while keeping palms grounded to change angles.
4. Make slow circular motions with each wrist through a comfortable range.
Safety cue: Keep elbows soft and move wrists through a full comfortable range with control

Health benefit: Enhances calf muscle activation and lower leg circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and weight evenly distributed.
2. Shift onto the balls of your feet and lift your heels as high as possible.
3. Pause briefly at the top and squeeze your calf muscles.
4. Slowly lower your heels back to the floor and repeat at a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Keep knees slightly bent and control heel rise and descent with steady tempo

Health benefit: Improves diaphragmatic breathing and ribcage expansion with overhead reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Inhale deeply and raise your arms smoothly overhead with palms facing each other.
3. Exhale slowly while lowering your arms back to your sides.
4. Repeat the movement in sync with your breath for several cycles.
Safety cue: Inhale to raise arms and exhale to lower while keeping ribs down and core engaged

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and posterior thigh extensibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and the other knee bent with the sole against the inner thigh.
2. Flex the extended foot and hinge forward from the hips while keeping your spine long.
3. Reach toward the toes without forcing the stretch and breathe steadily; then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes ankle dorsiflexion range and gastrocnemius flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the heel down and keep the back leg straight.
3. Lean forward, bend the front knee, and press the back heel into the floor; then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves chest flexibility and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place your palm and inner forearm flat on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and rotate your torso away from the wall.
3. Drop your shoulder blades and open your chest toward the room.
4. Hold the stretch for several breaths then return to neutral.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder blades gently retracted and avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Increases neck mobility and reduces stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Gently tuck your chin toward your chest to stretch the back of your neck.
3. Hold briefly and lift your head back to neutral.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin slightly and keep the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances lateral spine mobility and side torso flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and reach both arms straight overhead.
2. Clasp your hands or press your palms together.
3. Lean your torso slowly to one side while keeping your hips stable.
4. Hold briefly, return to center, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Lengthen through the side body and avoid shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Improves hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall at the edge of a chair with both feet flat and knees bent.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left knee and flex the right foot.
3. Lean forward slightly from the hips until you feel a gentle stretch in the right hip; hold and then repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and hinge from the hips without rounding

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle trunk lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or the floor with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Place your right hand behind you on the seat and your left hand on your right knee.
3. Rotate your torso to the right using your hands for gentle leverage; hold and then repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and hinge forward from the hips while keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall beside a wall or sturdy surface and place one hand on it for support.
2. Bend your right knee and reach back to grasp your right ankle or foot.
3. Keep your knees close together and your torso upright.
4. Tuck your hips slightly forward and press your foot gently into your hand; hold and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep knees aligned and pelvis neutral while gently pulling the heel toward the glute

Health benefit: Improves breath control and promotes relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back or sit upright with shoulders relaxed.
2. Place one hand on your chest and the other on your abdomen.
3. Inhale slowly through your nose and push the abdomen outward so the hand on your abdomen rises while the chest stays still.
4. Exhale slowly through pursed lips and feel the abdomen fall.
Safety cue: Breathe deeply into the belly with relaxed shoulders and minimal chest movement

Health benefit: Enhances overall flexibility and full body lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Reach both arms overhead, interlace fingers or keep palms facing up, and lengthen through the spine.
3. Hold the stretch while breathing calmly, then lower your arms back to your sides.
Safety cue: Reach overhead with core engaged and avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves balance and ankle stability with light support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall or sturdy chair and place one hand lightly on the support.
2. Shift your weight onto the foot nearest the support and lift the other foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Keep your hips level, spine tall, and gaze forward while balancing.
4. Lower the lifted foot with control and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Challenges balance and coordination through narrowed base of support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Place your arms at your sides or extend them out to the sides for balance.
3. Keep your gaze fixed on a point straight ahead and engage your core.
4. Hold this position for the chosen duration while keeping steady breathing.
Safety cue: Stack feet heel-to-toe, keep hips level, and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or at your sides.
2. Shift your weight onto the balls of your feet and lift your heels as high as possible.
3. Pause at the top and squeeze your calf muscles.
4. Lower your heels slowly back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and lift heels slowly with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic balance and lateral weight transfer
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift your weight onto your right foot and lift your left heel a few centimeters off the floor.
3. Reach your left arm forward and slightly across your body while keeping your torso stable.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Shift weight through the standing foot and reach without rotating the hips

Health benefit: Improves seated core control and arm reach coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a firm chair with feet flat and hands on thighs.
2. Shift weight onto one sit bone and lift the opposite foot off the floor.
3. Reach the opposite arm forward at shoulder height while keeping a tall spine.
4. Lower the foot and arm with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and reach while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Promotes single leg balance and lower limb endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place fingertips lightly on it for balance.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other knee to hip height.
3. Hold briefly with a tall posture and steady core.
4. Lower the leg and march on the opposite side while maintaining light fingertip contact.
Safety cue: Stand upright, march slowly with controlled knee lift and relaxed shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances postural control and shoulder mobility during balance tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and extend the opposite arm overhead.
3. Reach forward with the same-side arm while keeping the standing knee soft.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Engage your core and reach with controlled arm movement while maintaining balance

Health benefit: Builds functional leg strength and improves transitional movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a sturdy chair with feet flat and hip-width apart.
2. Lean slightly forward and push through your heels to lift hips halfway off the seat.
3. Squeeze your glutes and hold the halfway position.
4. Lower slowly back to the seat with control.
Safety cue: Drive through your heels, keep chest up, and pause with knees slightly bent

Health benefit: Challenges sensory integration to improve balance confidence
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart near a stable surface.
2. Lightly place fingertips on the surface and close your eyes.
3. Keep weight evenly distributed and maintain a steady breath.
4. Open your eyes, step slightly away from the surface, and reset your posture.
Safety cue: Distribute weight evenly, lightly touch the support, and breathe steadily with eyes closed

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width and arms extended, palms on the wall at chest height.
2. Bend your elbows and lean your chest toward the wall while keeping your body straight.
3. Stop just before contact and hold the halfway position, engaging your core.
4. Push back to the starting position with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and control the push with steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens chest and improves shoulder blade adduction control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Bring palms together in front of your chest with elbows out.
3. Press palms firmly into each other and contract your chest muscles.
4. Hold the squeeze with steady pressure and then slowly release.
Safety cue: Sit upright, gently squeeze shoulder blades together, and exhale as you contract

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and triceps endurance and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place palms on the wall at chest height with fingers pointing down.
3. Push your palms down into the wall as if trying to move it and engage your triceps.
4. Maintain steady downward pressure and then relax.
Safety cue: Brace your core and press down with controlled scapular movement

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability and postural alignment through isometric activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways close to a wall with the target shoulder aligned at shoulder height.
2. Place the palm of that hand flat on the wall and keep the elbow slightly bent.
3. Push the wall with your shoulder through your hand without moving your body and hold the tension.
Safety cue: Press your palm into the wall keeping shoulders down and spine neutral

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic extension and overhead range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or the floor with feet flat and knees at about 90 degrees.
2. Reach both arms straight overhead with palms facing each other and shoulders relaxed.
3. Engage the core and lengthen through the spine while holding the reach.
4. Lower the arms with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and reach overhead without arching your lower back

Health benefit: Builds elbow flexor endurance and increases upper arm muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Bend both elbows to about 90 degrees with palms facing up and tense the biceps.
3. Curl your forearms slowly toward your shoulders while maintaining strong internal tension.
4. Lower with control and reset to repeat.
Safety cue: Keep elbows by your sides and curl with slow controlled tension

Health benefit: Improves core stability and enhances balance during functional tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, knees slightly bent, and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Draw your navel toward your spine and brace the abdominal muscles firmly.
3. Maintain steady breathing while keeping the brace and tall posture.
4. Release the brace slowly and reset to repeat.
Safety cue: Draw your belly button to your spine and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens triceps and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Place hands behind hips with fingers pointing away and elbows close to sides.
3. Press through palms to lift hips a few inches, engaging triceps.
4. Lower hips under control to the floor while keeping elbows tucked.
Safety cue: Keep upper arm vertical and extend at the elbow with control

Health benefit: Increases core endurance and shoulder stability with reduced joint loading
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall at arm's length and place palms flat at shoulder height.
2. Step feet back until body forms a straight line from head to heels with arms extended.
3. Hold the straight-body position, brace core, and keep shoulders over wrists.
Safety cue: Hold a straight line from head to heels and avoid letting hips sag

Health benefit: Enhances upper back strength and promotes scapular retraction for better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hinge slightly at the hips.
2. Bend elbows to 90 degrees and pull hands toward ribs as if rowing.
3. Squeeze shoulder blades together and hold the contracted position.
4. Maintain upright posture and steady breathing while holding the pull.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and resist rotation in your torso

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and boosts circulation with low impact movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands on your thighs.
2. Lift your right knee a few inches toward your chest while keeping your ankle relaxed.
3. Lower your right foot to the floor and immediately lift your left knee the same way.
4. Continue alternating knees in a steady, low marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis still and lift each knee slowly without rocking

Health benefit: Improves lateral balance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift your weight to your left foot and extend your right foot outward to lightly tap the toes to the side.
3. Bring your right foot back under control to the starting position.
4. Repeat the same motion to the other side, alternating side toe taps.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you tap with a slight knee bend

Health benefit: Enhances upper body mobility and arm endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and shoulders relaxed.
2. Extend your right arm forward at shoulder height and reach your fingertips straight out.
3. Pull your right hand back to your chest and then extend your left arm forward in the same way.
4. Alternate punches with full arm extension and a steady, controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Sit tall with shoulders relaxed and extend punches with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Improves balance and controlled weight transfer
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Shift your weight smoothly onto your right foot and lift your left heel.
3. Move your weight back through center and shift onto your left foot while lifting your right heel.
4. Continue alternating sides in a controlled flowing rhythm.
Safety cue: Shift weight smoothly through the midfoot keeping knees soft and movements controlled

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands at your hips.
2. Rise onto the balls of both feet until your heels lift.
3. Pulse up and down lightly with small controlled movements.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Combines deep breathing with shoulder mobility to promote relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Inhale and sweep both arms up overhead with palms facing each other.
3. Exhale and lower your arms back to your sides with control.
4. Coordinate each arm movement with slow steady breathing.
Safety cue: Coordinate breath with the raise exhaling on the lift and keep shoulders down

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and improves trunk rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or the floor with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Cross your arms over your chest or place hands behind your head.
3. Rotate your torso to the right while keeping your hips facing forward.
4. Rotate to the left and repeat the movements in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Rotate from the upper spine with hips square and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic balance and forward reach confidence without stepping
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Reach both arms overhead and lengthen through your spine.
3. Take a small forward step and lower your arms back to your sides.
4. Alternate stepping and reaching as you move forward or march in place.
Safety cue: Reach forward with a tall neutral spine and control each movement without stepping

Health benefit: Improves ankle range of motion and proprioception through controlled movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair or the floor with one leg extended and the other foot flat.
2. Lift the extended foot slightly off the ground and point the toes.
3. Use your big toe to write each letter of the alphabet in the air with small, controlled motions.
4. Switch legs and repeat the alphabet on the other ankle.
Safety cue: Trace the alphabet with controlled ankle motion keeping the foot relaxed and supported

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and supports hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Seated Hip Extension: Sit upright on a sturdy chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Press your heels into the floor and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips slightly.
3. Hold the top position for two seconds while keeping your spine neutral.
4. Lower your hips with control back to the seat and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the pelvis level and drive the movement from the glutes with core engaged

Health benefit: Improves lower back and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Standing Pelvic Tilt: Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Pull your belly button toward your spine and tuck your tailbone under.
3. Hold the tucked position for two seconds while breathing normally.
4. Release to a neutral spine and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and tilt the pelvis using the low abdominals

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and loosens upper back muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Shoulder Roll Flow: Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift your shoulders toward your ears and roll them back and down in a smooth arc.
3. Reverse the motion by lifting and rolling the shoulders forward and down.
4. Coordinate the movement with steady breathing and repeat the flow.
Safety cue: Roll the shoulders slowly with control keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Promotes neck alignment and reduces forward head posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and eyes forward.
2. Gently pull your chin straight back, creating a double chin without tilting the head.
3. Hold the retracted position for 2-3 seconds while breathing normally.
4. Slowly release to neutral and repeat.
Safety cue: Retract the chin straight back keeping eyes level and spine neutral

Health benefit: Increases spinal flexibility and stretches the lower back
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and feet hip-width apart.
2. Exhale and slowly round your spine from the tailbone toward the head, sliding your hands toward your feet.
3. Hold briefly, then inhale and articulate the spine back upright.
Safety cue: Exhale as you round forward and hinge from the hips with the pelvis anchored

Health benefit: Maintains wrist range of motion and eases joint stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with arms extended in front and elbows soft.
2. Make loose fists or spread your fingers and slowly trace circular motions with both wrists while keeping forearms still.
3. Reverse direction after several circles and continue for desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Circle the wrists slowly with relaxed forearms and shoulders down

Health benefit: Enhances rib cage expansion and coordinates breath with movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Inhale deeply through the nose and sweep both arms out to the sides and overhead.
3. Pause briefly at the top with shoulders relaxed.
4. Exhale slowly through the mouth and lower your arms back to your sides.
Safety cue: Inhale to sweep the arms overhead and exhale as you lower with control

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with weight on one leg and hands on hips for balance.
2. Lift the other leg straight out to the side with toes pointing forward and torso still.
3. Lower the lifted leg with control and repeat with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift the leg from the outer hip without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Enhances lateral neck mobility and movement range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and spine neutral.
2. Place your right hand on the left side of your head and gently tilt the head toward the right shoulder until you feel a stretch.
3. Hold briefly, return to center, and repeat the same steps on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and thoracic extension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Raise one arm overhead and reach up and slightly to the opposite side.
3. Hold the reach for several slow breaths, lower the arm, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Engage your core and reach upward without overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Encourages upright posture and spinal alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs crossed and sit bones grounded.
2. Place hands on your knees and inhale to lift the chest and lengthen the spine.
3. Exhale and draw the navel slightly toward the spine while keeping the crown of the head lifted.
4. Hold the tall posture for several breaths, then relax the shoulders.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral chin and lengthen the spine as you inhale

Health benefit: Gently increases quadriceps flexibility and knee joint range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a wall and place one hand lightly on it for balance.
2. Bend the same-side knee and reach back with the free hand to gently cup your ankle.
3. Keep knees close and tilt the pelvis forward slightly to create a shallow quad stretch.
4. Hold for a few breaths, then release and repeat on the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets posterior shoulder and upper back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Extend your right arm straight across your chest at shoulder height.
3. Use your left hand to pull the right arm closer to your chest while keeping shoulders relaxed.
Safety cue: Keep the torso square and pull the arm across the chest with a straight spine

Health benefit: Enhances calf strength and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift your weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot slightly off the floor.
3. Press through the ball of the left foot and raise your left heel as high as comfortable.
4. Lower the heel slowly to the floor and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Lift heels slowly and keep weight centered over the midfoot

Health benefit: Improves upper body reach and postural control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift your weight onto your left leg and hinge forward at the hips while reaching both arms forward.
3. Keep the standing knee slightly bent and maintain a long spine as you reach toward a point in front of you.
4. Return to an upright position by driving the hips forward and lowering your arms, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and reach arms slowly without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Enhances proprioceptive awareness by challenging sensory reliance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and lightly touch a stable surface with one fingertip.
2. Close your eyes and relax your shoulders.
3. Keep weight evenly distributed and maintain a slight bend in the knees.
4. Hold the stance for the chosen duration, then open your eyes and release the touch.
Safety cue: Stand with light hand support and maintain steady breathing

Health benefit: Enhances overall balance and lower limb stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Raise your arms forward or out to the sides at shoulder height.
3. Shift weight slowly onto one leg while keeping hips level and core engaged.
4. Hold the position, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Stand tall with knees slightly bent and weight evenly distributed

Health benefit: Improves shoulder endurance and postural stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Slide your arms up the wall into a "W" shape with elbows bent and palms facing forward.
3. Press your forearms and palms into the wall while drawing shoulder blades down.
4. Hold the contraction, breathe steadily, then slide your arms back down.
Safety cue: Press your entire back into the wall and keep shoulders down and back

Health benefit: Develops upper back strength and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Extend both arms forward at chest height with palms facing each other.
3. Pull your elbows back toward your ribs and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
4. Hold the squeezed position for the desired time while maintaining steady breathing.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and hold without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances lateral balance and weight transfer coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and knees soft.
2. Shift your weight to the right by pushing your hips right and lifting the left heel.
3. Shift smoothly to the left by pushing your hips left and lifting the right heel and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Shift weight through the midfoot and keep the torso upright with hips level

Health benefit: Increases upper body coordination and light aerobic engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or the floor with feet planted and core engaged.
2. Bring your hands to chin level with elbows close to the body.
3. Extend the right arm forward in a quick, controlled punch while rotating your torso slightly.
4. Return the hand to chin and repeat the movement on the left side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Rotate from the torso and extend without locking the elbow while keeping shoulders down

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Shift weight onto the balls of your feet and lift both heels slowly.
3. Pause briefly at the top and feel your calves engage.
4. Lower your heels slowly back to the ground and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace your core and raise heels slowly, control the descent

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and balance through controlled full body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Reach both arms forward and then lift them overhead with a long spine.
3. Hold the fully extended reach for a beat with shoulders relaxed.
4. Lower your arms back to your sides with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Reach with a neutral spine and return under control

Health benefit: Improves shoulder range of motion and encourages deep breathing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and relax your shoulders.
2. Inhale and lift both arms out to the sides and overhead until your ears are near your arms.
3. Exhale and lower your arms slowly back to your sides.
4. Continue lifting and lowering while matching each movement to steady breaths.
Safety cue: Breathe rhythmically and raise arms with shoulder blades stable

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and promotes pelvic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Place hands on hips or thighs to feel pelvic movement.
3. Gently tuck your tailbone under to flatten the lower back.
4. Slowly arch the lower back and return to neutral; repeat.
Safety cue: Tilt from the pelvis with a neutral spine and steady breathing

Health benefit: Promotes proper pelvic alignment and supports postural stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Place hands on your hips to sense the pelvis.
3. Rock the pelvis forward to create a slight arch.
4. Rock the pelvis back to tuck and then find the neutral midpoint.
Safety cue: Stand tall, find neutral pelvis by engaging the core and avoiding sway

Health benefit: Improves neck posture and reduces forward head positioning
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Gently draw your head straight back, keeping the chin level.
3. Hold briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Retract chin straight back slowly keeping eyes level and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances diaphragmatic breathing while promoting shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Inhale deeply while sweeping both arms slowly up overhead with palms facing in.
3. Exhale fully while lowering the arms out to the sides and back down to your sides.
4. Repeat the inhale-up and exhale-down sequence with smooth, controlled motions.
Safety cue: Exhale as you sweep arms overhead and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Encourages hip joint stability and controlled weight transfer
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Shift your hips to the right by moving your right hip outward while keeping your torso facing forward.
3. Return to center and shift your hips to the left with the same controlled motion.
4. Repeat the side-to-side shifts using a small, comfortable range of motion.
Safety cue: Shift hips within a pain-free range keeping pelvis level and weight centered

Health benefit: Opens chest and enhances shoulder girdle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place your forearm against the wall at shoulder height with your elbow bent 90 degrees.
2. Step your feet slightly forward and rotate your torso away from the wall until you feel a gentle stretch in the front of the chest.
3. Maintain an upright posture and breathe steadily while holding the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and draw the shoulder blade back to avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor flexibility and supports comfortable hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with one foot forward and the other foot back.
2. Tuck your pelvis slightly and keep your torso upright.
3. Gently shift your hips forward until you feel a shallow stretch in the front of the back hip.
4. Place your hands on your front thigh for support and hold the position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral pelvis and upright torso to target the front of the hip

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and supports better postural stability during daily activities
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and soften your knees.
2. Pull your belly button toward your spine to brace your core.
3. Lift one foot a few centimeters off the ground or step one foot slightly back to challenge stability.
4. Maintain a tall spine and steady breathing while holding the position.
Safety cue: Brace the core and avoid arching the lower back while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder depressors and improves trunk stabilization during arm pressing tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and raise your arms overhead.
2. Keep elbows soft and press your palms downward as if pushing your hands toward your hips.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades down and back while keeping your core engaged.
4. Hold the pressing tension for the desired time while breathing normally.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and press down with control, exhaling on the effort

Health benefit: Improves lateral balance and weight transfer control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Shift your weight to your right foot and bend the right knee slightly.
3. Push through the right foot to return to center, then shift weight to your left foot and bend the left knee.
4. Continue alternating sides in a slow, controlled motion for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Shift weight smoothly while keeping hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves ankle range of motion and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a chair or wall and place fingertips lightly on it for balance.
2. Shift weight onto your left foot and lift your right foot slightly off the floor.
3. Rotate your right ankle slowly clockwise ten times, then counterclockwise ten times.
4. Switch support to lift the left foot and repeat the same clockwise and counterclockwise rotations.
Safety cue: Support weight evenly and rotate the ankle smoothly without jerking

Health benefit: Enhances calf blood circulation and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a sturdy chair with feet flat, knees at hip width, and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Exhale and round your spine, tucking the chin toward the chest and drawing the navel inward.
3. Inhale and arch your spine, lifting the chest and tilting the head slightly upward; repeat smoothly.
Safety cue: Keep weight centered on the midfoot and pump with controlled ankle motion

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and improves straight-leg reach
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and weight evenly distributed.
2. Shift your hips laterally to the right by moving your pelvis while keeping your torso facing forward.
3. Return to center with controlled movement.
4. Repeat the same shift to the left and continue alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and hinge from the hips to feel the stretch

Health benefit: Strengthens chest shoulders and improves scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Extend your right knee until the leg is straight and toes point forward.
3. Hold the extended position briefly.
4. Lower the foot back to the floor and repeat with the left leg.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to hips and lower into the push with control

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle core activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands crossed over your chest or lightly behind your head.
2. Rotate your torso to the right using your core while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Pause briefly at the end range while maintaining an upright posture.
4. Return to center and rotate to the left with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Move slowly with the breath while keeping the neck aligned with the spine

Health benefit: Activates hip flexors and improves leg coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Position yourself on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and drop your belly, lift your chest and tailbone, and look slightly forward.
3. Exhale and round your spine, tuck your chin, and draw your tailbone down.
4. Continue alternating slowly with each breath, keeping movements smooth.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and lift each knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic spine mobility and posterior shoulder activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, feet flat, and hands resting beside your hips.
2. Sit tall, engage your core, and lengthen through the spine.
3. Lift one foot a few inches off the floor while keeping the other foot grounded.
4. Hold the position steady, then lower the foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Lift your chest using the upper back and keep the neck long

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and hands resting beside your hips.
2. Press your hips into the floor, engage your glutes, and lift your chest using your upper back.
3. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your shoulder blades down and together at the top.
4. Lower slowly back to the floor and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back pressed to the floor and move slowly

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and arms extended toward the ceiling.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back gently toward the floor.
3. Slowly lower your right arm behind your head while extending your left leg toward the floor.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and avoid rounding the back

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and promotes spinal stability through loaded isometric hold
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on the edge of a chair with feet flat and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Raise your fists to chin level and tighten your core.
3. Extend your right arm forward in a controlled punch while rotating your torso slightly.
4. Retract your hand, alternate arms, and maintain an even rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and maintain a straight spine

Health benefit: Enhances cervical mobility and improves neck range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Start on your hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Step your knees back until your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes and tighten your core while keeping your spine neutral.
4. Hold the position while breathing steadily and avoid letting your hips sag.
Safety cue: Rotate slowly keeping the chest lifted and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and supports pelvic stability during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Drop your chin to your chest slowly.
3. Rotate your head to the right, then up, then to the left in a smooth circle.
4. Reverse the direction and repeat the same smooth circles.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift from the side of the hip without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and thoracic mobility while encouraging upright trunk posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported on your arm.
2. Align your hips and shoulders in a straight line.
3. Lift the top leg upward in a controlled motion to hip height.
4. Lower the leg slowly without letting it drop and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and reach without arching the lower back while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and improves contralateral coordination and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or the floor with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Inhale and raise both arms overhead with palms facing each other.
3. Reach your fingertips toward the ceiling while keeping a long spine.
4. Exhale and lower your arms back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Extend opposite arm and leg while keeping hips level and core stable

Health benefit: Strengthens lower body muscles and enhances sit to stand functional ability
Steps to perform:
1. Get on all fours with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg back until they form a straight line, keeping hips level.
3. Keep your core engaged and hold the position briefly.
4. Return to all fours and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit back into the chair keeping knees behind toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and supports comfortable knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a few inches in front of a chair with feet hip-width apart.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to sit lightly on the chair with chest upright.
3. Drive through your heels to stand back up fully.
4. Reset your posture and repeat the movement with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and pelvis neutral while gently pulling the foot toward the glute

Health benefit: Enhances upper back strength and promotes better shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees stacked and bend the top knee toward your glutes.
2. Reach back and grasp the top foot or ankle while keeping hips stacked.
3. Gently pull the foot toward your glutes until you feel a stretch, then release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and keep a tall spine while pulling through the elbows

Health benefit: Improves upper body endurance and hand eye coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with legs extended and arms straight in front for Seated Row (Motion).
2. Pull your elbows back toward your ribs and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
3. Keep your chest lifted and avoid rounding your back as you row.
4. Extend your arms forward with control and repeat the motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and supports upright posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and keep your feet planted for Shadow Boxing (No Footwork).
2. Raise your hands to guard at chin and rotate your torso slightly with each punch.
3. Throw controlled jabs, crosses, and hooks while maintaining balance and guard.
4. Return your hands to guard after each punch and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Keep lower back against the wall and move arms slowly with scapular control

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors to enhance lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and heels a few inches away for Wall Angels.
2. Press your lower back, upper back, and head into the wall and bring elbows to a "W" position.
3. Slide your arms upward into a "Y" while keeping forearms and hands in contact with the wall.
4. Lower your arms back to the "W" with control and repeat the movement.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and control the movement from the glutes without rotating the pelvis

Health benefit: Increases lateral trunk flexibility and engages core side muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips and knees bent and feet stacked.
2. Support your head with your bottom arm and keep hips square.
3. Lift the top knee toward the ceiling while keeping feet together.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat for reps.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates outer hip muscles and contributes to balance during single side stance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands resting at your sides.
2. Lift one arm overhead and lean your torso directly to the opposite side.
3. Return to center with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hold support lightly, keep torso upright, and lift from the outer hip without leaning

Health benefit: Builds posterior shoulder endurance and improves upper back alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall or sturdy support and hold it lightly with one hand.
2. Shift weight onto the supporting leg and engage your core.
3. Lift the outside leg straight out to the side with toes pointing forward.
4. Lower the leg slowly and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep neck long, lift the arms with scapular engagement, and avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances abdominal endurance and promotes coordinated trunk rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead in a Y and palms facing down.
2. Squeeze shoulder blades and lift your arms and chest a few inches off the floor.
3. Hold the top position briefly while keeping your neck neutral.
4. Lower slowly with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to the mat, move slowly, and breathe steadily through each twist

Health benefit: Improves hip external rotation and gluteal flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands lightly behind your head and knees bent.
2. Lift head and shoulders and bring right elbow toward left knee while slowly straightening the right leg.
3. Switch sides by bringing left elbow toward right knee while slowly extending the left leg.
4. Continue alternating with slow, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and hinge at the hips to avoid rounding

Health benefit: Opens the chest and enhances shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and bend the right knee, placing the right ankle over the left thigh.
2. Keep your back straight and hinge forward from the hips until you feel a stretch in the right glute.
3. Hold the stretch, then switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Anchor shoulder blades down and gently open the chest without shrugging

Health benefit: Raises heart rate gently while increasing shoulder and arm mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearm on the doorframe at shoulder height.
2. Step the opposite foot forward and keep your torso upright.
3. Lean your chest forward until you feel a stretch across the front of your shoulder and chest.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Control arm movement and keep shoulders relaxed away from ears

Health benefit: Gently lengthens the lower back and increases hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Raise both arms out to the sides and overhead in a smooth arc.
3. Lower the arms back to your sides and repeat at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lateral core strength and improves trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms at your sides.
2. Bend one knee and gently pull it toward your chest using both hands behind the thigh.
3. Hold briefly, then lower the leg and repeat with the other knee.
Safety cue: Stack hips over knees and shoulders and press through the supporting knee for alignment

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and leg movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and place your forearm under your shoulder.
2. Press through the forearm and lift your hips to form a straight line from head to knees.
3. Keep your core engaged and hold the position while breathing evenly.
4. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Engage your core and slide the leg slowly without letting the pelvis tilt

Health benefit: Increases shoulder range of motion and upper body circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and hands placed lightly behind your hips for support.
2. Engage your core and slide one foot forward until the leg is nearly straight while the other foot stays planted.
3. Pull the sliding foot back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and perform controlled small circles without flaring the ribs

Health benefit: Encourages spinal flexion and promotes relaxation of the back muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and extend your arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Make small, controlled circles forward using your shoulder joints.
3. Reverse the direction and make small, controlled circles backward.
Safety cue: Reach hips back toward heels and breathe deeply while keeping the spine long

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles and enhances back extensor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with big toes touching and sit back onto your heels.
2. Separate your knees to about hip-width and keep your torso between your thighs.
3. Reach your arms forward and lower your forehead to the floor.
4. Relax your chest toward your thighs and breathe slowly.
Safety cue: Lift chest and legs slightly while keeping the neck neutral and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and proprioceptive awareness through controlled movements
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Engage your glutes and lift your chest and legs a few inches off the floor.
3. Keep your neck neutral and gaze toward the floor.
4. Squeeze your glutes and shoulder blades and hold the position.
Safety cue: Stabilize the thigh and trace the alphabet with the ankle using slow steady breaths

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on the floor or a chair and extend one leg so the knee is slightly bent.
2. Point or flex your foot and use your big toe to trace the alphabet in the air.
3. Repeat the same tracing with the other ankle.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and rotate through the upper torso, not by swinging the arms

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, feet flat, and hands clasped in front of your chest.
2. Lean back slightly to engage the core and keep a tall spine.
3. Twist your torso to the right and tap the floor beside your hip with your hands.
4. Twist to the left and tap the floor, alternating sides in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds triceps and shoulder strength for upper body pushing movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and bring the soles of your feet together, holding your feet with your hands.
2. Draw your heels toward your groin and press your knees gently toward the floor with your elbows.
3. Keep a straight spine and relax into the stretch while breathing slowly.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back, lowering with controlled range of motion

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and scapular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair or the floor with hands beside your hips and fingers pointing forward.
2. Slide your hips off the edge and bend your elbows to lower your body until elbows are about 90 degrees.
3. Keep your shoulders down and elbows close to your sides throughout the movement.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your hips back up, repeating as needed.
Safety cue: Sit tall, draw shoulder blades down and move the arms with control

Health benefit: Activates glutes and enhances hip extension strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and back straight.
2. Extend both arms forward at chest level with palms facing each other.
3. Cross your right arm over your left, then open and cross your left over your right in a controlled scissoring motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves trunk rotational mobility and control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine.
3. Lift one knee off the floor and extend that leg back and up with the knee bent.
4. Squeeze the glute at the top, then lower the knee back down with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips facing forward, soften the knees and rotate from the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Combines upper body strength work with thoracic mobility and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Place hands on your hips or extend your arms in front of you.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, return to center, then rotate to the left in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move with control, breathing as you transition into child pose

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and improves lower abdominal control
Steps to perform:
1. Start in high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Bend elbows and lower chest toward the floor with control.
3. Push through palms to return to high plank, then sit back on heels with arms extended into childs pose.
4. Pause briefly in childs pose, then press hands into the mat and return to high plank.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and promotes posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg straight on the floor.
2. Engage your core and lift the straight leg to about hip height, keeping the knee straight.
3. Lower the leg slowly with control until it rests on the floor, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Articulate the spine slowly and coordinate each flexion and extension with your breath

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation mobility and improves upper back movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a mat or chair with feet flat or legs crossed and hands on your knees.
2. Arch your back, lift your chest, and lift your gaze to move into the cow position.
3. Round your spine, tuck your chin, and press your hands into your knees to move into the cat position.
4. Flow smoothly between the rounded and arched positions for repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and rotate through the thoracic spine while keeping the neck aligned

Health benefit: Enhances core and shoulder endurance while promoting coordinated lower body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on all fours with knees hip-width and hands under shoulders; keep a neutral spine.
2. Place your right hand behind your head and keep the left hand planted for support.
3. Rotate your chest and right elbow up toward the ceiling while keeping hips stable.
4. Return to neutral, repeat, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hips level while driving knees slowly toward chest
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, COPD, Metabolic Syndrome, Hyperthyroidism

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on a stable elevated surface and extend legs behind into a plank.
2. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels.
3. Slowly drive your right knee toward your chest while keeping hips level.
4. Return the right leg, then slowly drive the left knee in, alternating controlled repetitions.
Safety cue: Relax shoulders down away from the ears and breathe deeply into the ribcage

Health benefit: Improves single leg stability and balance with minimal joint stress
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and wrap your arms around your torso, crossing hands at your upper back.
2. Squeeze your elbows toward each other and round your upper back while tucking your chin slightly.
3. Hold the position and breathe steadily, then release and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and place one hand lightly on a stable support.
2. Take a small step forward with one foot and keep your torso upright.
3. Bend both knees slightly until the front knee is aligned over the ankle and the back knee lowers a few inches.
4. Press through the front heel to return to standing, then repeat and switch sides.
Safety cue: Use slow controlled movement and tuck the pelvis to lift with the lower abs

Health benefit: Enhances standing balance and proprioception using external support
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet off the floor, and hands by your sides for support.
2. Contract your lower abs to curl your hips and knees toward your chest, lifting the hips slightly off the floor.
3. Slowly lower your hips and legs back to the starting position with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and improves scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Place the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot to form a straight line.
3. Hold an upright posture, focus on a fixed point, and maintain the stance for the desired time.
4. Switch the leading foot and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases ankle dorsiflexion range and supports functional movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Brace your core and lift your hands near your chin.
3. Rotate your torso and extend your right arm in a controlled punch.
4. Return the hand and rotate to punch with the left arm in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Drive the knee toward the wall while keeping the heel down and the foot planted

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and promotes hip extension strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place one foot a few inches from the base.
2. Keep the heel down and bend the knee to move it toward the wall.
3. Adjust the foot distance to maintain a pain-free range.
4. Push the knee toward the wall and return in slow, controlled repetitions.
Safety cue: Press through the heels, lift by squeezing the glutes, and avoid overextending the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances balance and ankle stability through weight distribution practice
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot wide to the right while raising both arms overhead.
3. Step your right foot back to center while lowering your arms.
4. Repeat the movement to the left in a steady, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips level and lightly hold support for balance

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and promotes better spinal rotation patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a sturdy chair or wall and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Keep the standing knee soft and core engaged while holding balance.
4. Lower the lifted foot with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the upper back without shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Strengthens core muscles and supports improved posture and trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side with knees bent and stacked and rest your head on your lower arm.
2. Extend the top arm forward at chest height with the palm facing down.
3. Rotate the top arm up and back toward the floor behind you while keeping knees together.
4. Return the arm to the start position with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Brace the core and maintain a straight line from knees to head

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and enhances hip extension strength for daily activities
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Walk your hands slightly forward and lower your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Engage your core, keep a neutral neck, and breathe steadily while holding the position.
4. Lower your knees gently to the floor to rest or return to the start to repeat.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and squeeze the glute to lift without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Increases chest flexibility and reduces shoulder rounding from prolonged sitting
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a stable support and place both hands lightly on it for balance.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and hinge slightly at the hips.
3. Squeeze the glutes to lift the other leg straight back without bending the knee.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and press the chest forward gently without shrugging

Health benefit: Raises heart rate moderately while improving hip flexor control and gait pattern
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearms on the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and gently lean your chest through the doorway.
3. Keep your shoulders down and open your chest as you feel the stretch.
4. Step back to release and adjust arm height if needed.
Safety cue: Stand tall, lift knees with control and keep a steady breath

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thigh muscles and promotes pelvic stability during seated positions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift your right knee slowly toward your chest while driving your left arm forward.
3. Lower the right foot with control and then lift the left knee while switching arm positions.
4. Continue marching slowly with controlled, alternating knee lifts.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace the core and squeeze with the inner thighs

Health benefit: Enhances coordinated core stability and improves controlled limb movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and place a pillow between your knees.
2. Brace your core and press your knees together to squeeze the pillow.
3. Hold the squeeze for three to five seconds while breathing steadily.
4. Release slowly and repeat the next repetition.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and improves pushing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one hand lightly touching a wall or stable surface for support.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
3. Walk slowly forward in this heel-to-toe pattern while maintaining light contact with the wall and looking ahead.
Safety cue: Lower until elbows are about 90 degrees keeping shoulders down and chest open

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder mobility and increases circulation to the arms
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and extend both arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Keep palms facing down and begin making small, fast circles forward with both arms.
3. Maintain a quick, controlled pace and increase circle size only if comfortable.
4. Reverse direction and continue fast circles for the next interval.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and spine tall while controlling the arm circles

Health benefit: Activates core muscles while enhancing shoulder stability and body control
Steps to perform:
1. Get on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Lift your knees a few inches off the floor so your shins hover.
3. Pull your belly button toward your spine and keep your back flat.
4. Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and braced core avoiding sagging or piking hips

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability for better balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet hip-width apart and weight evenly distributed.
2. Shift your weight onto the balls of your feet and lift your heels as high as possible.
3. Pause at the top and squeeze your calves.
4. Lower your heels slowly back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Rise through the balls of the feet with controlled movement and a tall posture

Health benefit: Improves neck flexibility and reduces muscular tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head slowly to one side, bringing your ear toward your shoulder without raising the opposite shoulder.
3. Return to center and repeat on the other side with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Move the neck slowly within a pain-free range while keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Targets outer hip muscles and enhances lateral leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs extended and head supported by your arm.
2. Stack your hips and keep the top leg straight and toes pointing forward.
3. Lift the top leg upward in a controlled motion to about hip height.
4. Lower the leg slowly back to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged while lifting the top leg with control

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair and place one hand lightly on the back for support.
2. Shift your weight onto the standing foot and lift the other foot off the floor.
3. Keep a tall posture and engage your core while holding balance.
4. Return the lifted foot to the floor and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged while maintaining a steady gaze

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and chest mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and hands placed under your shoulders.
2. Press the tops of your feet and pelvis into the floor.
3. Straighten your arms slightly to lift your chest while keeping hips on the floor.
4. Hold the position for a few breaths, then lower your chest back down.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis grounded and lift chest using the midback while drawing shoulders down

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and shoulder stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on a mat with your forehead on the ground and arms extended straight overhead to form an "I".
2. Lift your chest and arms a few inches off the ground while squeezing your shoulder blades, then lower.
3. Move your arms into a "Y" shape at a 45-degree angle and lift your chest and arms, then lower.
4. Move your arms out to the sides to form a "T" and lift your chest and arms, then lower.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and lift through the scapula with slow controlled movements

Health benefit: Develops quadriceps endurance and lower body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back flat against a wall and feet hip-width apart about one foot forward.
2. Slide down into a shallow squat so knees bend slightly and thighs remain above parallel to the floor.
3. Press your lower back into the wall and hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lower back mobility and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor hip-width apart.
2. Tilt your pelvis to press your lower back into the floor by engaging your abdominal muscles and hold briefly.
3. Relax to a neutral spine and repeat the tilt rhythmically.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases triceps flexibility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one arm overhead and bend the elbow to reach toward the opposite upper back.
3. Use the opposite hand to gently press the bending elbow toward your head.
