4. Hold the stretch, then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and shoulders relaxed while gently drawing the elbow toward the head

Health benefit: Builds knee-friendly leg strength and functional standing control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy support and hold it lightly with one or both hands.
2. Step feet hip-width apart and shift weight to your heels.
3. Bend knees slightly and lower only about a quarter of a full squat by pushing hips back.
4. Press through heels to return to standing and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves core lateral stability and shoulder support capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your upper body on your forearm with elbow under shoulder.
2. Bend both knees and stack them so knees remain on the ground.
3. Lift hips until your body forms a straight line from knees to head.
4. Hold the position, then lower hips with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your heels, butt, upper back, and head against the wall.
2. Raise your arms to form a W with elbows bent and forearms touching the wall.
3. Slowly slide your arms upward into a Y while keeping forearms and hands on the wall.
4. Slowly lower back to the W while maintaining contact and control.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and draw shoulder blades together as you slide

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and trunk rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or mat with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Cross your arms over your chest or place hands lightly behind your head.
3. Rotate your torso to the right from the waist while keeping hips facing forward.
4. Return to center and rotate to the left with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and rotate from the mid back

Health benefit: Promotes hip and knee mobility during lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Slide one heel away along the floor until the leg straightens while keeping hips down.
3. Slide the heel back to the starting bent position and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder range of motion and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and bring both hands to chest height.
3. Reach one hand a short distance toward the target clock position while keeping your torso stable.
4. Return to center and repeat with the next small reach.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and reach from the shoulder without shrugging

Health benefit: Develops shoulder and upper chest strength with reduced shoulder loading compared to floor push-ups
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands shoulder-width on a wall or elevated surface and step back so hips lift into a pike.
2. Keep your legs straight or slightly bent and form an inverted V with your body.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your head toward the wall or surface in a controlled motion.
4. Push through your hands to straighten the arms and return to the starting pike position.
Safety cue: Keep head in line with the spine and lower with controlled shoulder strength

Health benefit: Improves aerobic conditioning coordination and timing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot slightly forward, hands guarding your face, and knees soft.
2. Throw short, controlled jabs, crosses, and hooks while keeping your feet planted.
3. Reset your guard between punches and maintain a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Maintain a stable stance and breathe steadily while controlling your punches

Health benefit: Increases hip internal rotation mobility and functional leg positioning
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Place hands behind you for support and keep one foot planted.
3. Slowly bring the other knee inward across the midline, rotating the thigh internally.
4. Return to neutral and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the thigh level and rotate from the hip while keeping the pelvis steady

Health benefit: Encourages hamstring lengthening and gentle spinal elongation with relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward with a long spine until hands reach shins or the floor.
3. Soften the neck and maintain a slight bend in the knees.
4. Slowly roll up vertebra by vertebra to stand.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lower body strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a wall or chair and place one hand lightly on it for balance.
2. Step one foot back and lower until the front thigh is roughly parallel to the floor.
3. Keep the torso tall and the front knee aligned over the ankle.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest up, core braced, and front knee aligned over the ankle

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and spinal alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tuck toes and sit hips back toward heels while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Rock forward until hips pass over your knees and shoulders move slightly past wrists.
4. Control the return to the starting position and repeat slowly.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move slowly from the hips

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on hips or at sides.
2. Shift weight onto the supporting leg and brace your core.
3. Lift the other leg straight out to the side with toes forward and knee soft.
4. Lower the leg slowly without touching the ground and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the standing hip stable and lift the leg with controlled motion

Health benefit: Develops core anti-rotation stability and torso control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width and press palms firmly together at chest.
2. Extend your arms forward while maintaining strong palm-to-palm pressure.
3. Keep your core braced and resist any rotation of the torso.
4. Hold the extended position for the chosen time and then return hands to the chest.
Safety cue: Brace your core and resist rotation as you press away from your body

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on the edge of a stable chair with feet flat and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Extend one leg forward until it is straight and parallel to the floor.
3. Squeeze the front thigh at the top for a two-count.
4. Lower the leg slowly back to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and extend the knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the heel down and keep the back leg straight.
3. Lean toward the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf, hold, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep the back heel down and spine long while leaning into the stretch

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and posterior chain for improved hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width apart, and arms at your sides.
2. Brace your core and press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze the glutes at the top for a two-count.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Press through the heels, squeeze the glutes, and avoid overextending the lower back

Health benefit: Increases hip rotational mobility and stretches lower back
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms out to the sides and legs extended.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the ground and keep them together.
3. Lower both legs to one side in a controlled motion toward the floor.
4. Return legs through center and lower to the opposite side with control.
Safety cue: Keep both shoulders on the floor and control the crossover with your obliques

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with hands behind your hips and knees bent.
2. Lean back slightly while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Pull your knees toward your chest by contracting your core.
4. Extend your legs forward without touching the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other, heel to toe, and hold a stable support.
2. Keep your hips level and shoulders relaxed while finding a steady balance.
3. Maintain the position for the desired time, then switch feet and repeat.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders while holding support and fix a steady gaze for balance

Health benefit: Targets calf soleus flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back and bend the back knee while keeping the back heel on the floor.
3. Shift hips forward until you feel a deep stretch in the lower calf of the bent leg.
4. Hold the position, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and functional sit to stand ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a chair with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Reach hips back and bend knees to lower toward the chair while keeping your chest upright.
3. Lightly touch the chair with your glutes without fully sitting and keep weight in your heels.
4. Drive hips forward to stand tall and repeat.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep knees tracking over toes, and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and enhances trunk rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on both knees with hips stacked over knees and place one hand behind your head.
2. Rotate your chest and elbow upward toward the ceiling while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Pause at the top of the rotation to feel movement through the upper back.
4. Return to center and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Square the hips, rotate through the mid back and keep the lower spine stable

Health benefit: Challenges core endurance and promotes neutral spine stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Tuck toes and lift knees an inch or two off the floor while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Brace your core and hold the hover with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core to prevent sagging or arching

Health benefit: Targets triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat near your hips.
2. Place hands on the floor beside your hips with fingers pointing forward.
3. Press into your hands and lift your hips off the floor to straighten your arms.
4. Bend your elbows to lower hips a few inches, then press back up to extend your arms.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core activation and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms by your sides and legs extended.
2. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs off the floor and bend both knees toward your chest.
3. Extend one leg straight while bringing the other knee toward your chest in a controlled motion.
4. Alternate legs in a steady cycling pattern while keeping your lower back on the floor.
Safety cue: Keep low back pressed into the mat while moving legs slowly

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall next to a support such as a wall or chair.
2. Place one hand lightly on the support and shift your weight onto the opposite leg.
3. Keeping the supporting leg slightly bent and toes forward, lift the other leg straight out to the side to hip height.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift your leg slowly without leaning your torso

Health benefit: Boosts light cardiovascular activity and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a sturdy chair or bench with feet together and knees bent.
2. Open your legs outward while simultaneously raising your arms out to the sides or overhead.
3. Bring your feet and arms back to the starting position with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength with reduced shoulder strain
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands shoulder-width on the edge of a stable table or counter and step back.
2. Align your body in a straight line from head to heels and engage your core.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the edge until elbows are about 90 degrees.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves ankle range of motion and promotes local circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright in a chair with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lift one foot a few inches off the floor and point your toes forward.
3. Rotate the ankle slowly in full circles clockwise, then reverse counterclockwise and switch sides.
Safety cue: Rotate the ankle slowly with control while keeping the thigh supported

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on the floor with legs extended and hands under hips.
2. Brace your core and press your hips down to keep a neutral spine.
3. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor keeping them straight.
4. Alternately kick the legs up and down in small, quick motions while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and improves hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and bring the soles of your feet together with knees bent outward.
2. Hold your feet with your hands and sit tall with a straight spine.
3. Gently press your knees toward the floor with your elbows and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and lower the knees gently while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular activity while improving upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat, knees bent, and hands up near your cheeks.
2. Rotate your torso and jab one hand forward while the other stays guarding.
3. Retract the jab quickly and alternate punches in a controlled rhythm.
4. Breathe steadily and keep light movement through your hips.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and rotate through the torso with controlled punches

Health benefit: Improves shoulder blade stability and contributes to better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and pull them down without shrugging.
3. Hold the squeeze for two seconds, then release slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades back and down without shrugging while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Lengthens hip flexors and reduces anterior hip tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and step one foot forward into a half-kneeling position with the back knee on the floor.
2. Keep your torso upright and place hands on the front thigh for balance.
3. Tuck your pelvis and shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the rear hip.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and promotes ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with your side or back lightly touching a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and place the sole of the other foot against your inner calf or ankle.
3. Bring hands to prayer at your chest or reach them overhead and use the wall for light balance.
4. Hold steady, then lower your foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal muscles and improves core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Engage your core and curl your hips upward, drawing your knees toward your chest.
3. Slowly lower your hips back down with control until your feet hover or touch the floor.
4. Repeat for the chosen number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Curl the pelvis upward using the lower abs and perform each rep slowly and controlled

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves foot stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright in a chair and place a towel flat under one foot with the heel on the floor.
2. Spread your toes then curl them to grab and scrunch the towel toward you.
3. Release the towel by spreading your toes and smooth it back with your foot while keeping the heel down.
4. Repeat several times then switch to the other foot.
Safety cue: Keep ankle stable and curl toes slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and postural endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on your forearms and knees with elbows under shoulders.
2. Lift hips until your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Brace your core and keep your neck neutral.
4. Hold the position and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to knees and brace the core

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and activates shoulder stabilizing muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms resting at your sides.
2. Raise both arms out to the sides to shoulder height with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Lower your arms slowly back to your sides.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and raise arms slowly to shoulder height

Health benefit: Improves functional lower body strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Lightly touch the chair with your glutes without fully sitting down.
4. Drive through your heels to stand back up and squeeze your glutes.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep chest up and control the descent without letting knees pass toes

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and promotes gentle cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands lightly on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step your right foot to the right about hip-width distance.
3. Bring your left foot to meet the right with a gentle touch and keep knees soft.
4. Step your left foot to the left and repeat the side-to-side touches at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and core braced while stepping with controlled movements

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand behind a sturdy chair and place both hands on the backrest for support.
2. Shift your weight onto your right foot and lift your left foot slightly off the floor.
3. Keep a tall posture and hold your balance while breathing steadily.
4. Lower your left foot, then shift weight and repeat the lift on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and weight centered over the standing foot

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and reduces upper back stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head or crossed over your chest.
2. Rotate your upper torso to the right while keeping your hips and pelvis facing forward.
3. Pause briefly at the end range and feel the rotation through your chest and upper back.
4. Return to center and rotate your upper torso to the left with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from the upper back while keeping the core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances calf flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back and keep that heel flat on the floor.
3. Bend the front knee and lean forward until you feel a stretch in the back calf.
4. Hold the position, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep front knee slightly bent and press the back heel into the floor

Health benefit: Improves calf strength and promotes ankle stability for walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a stable support and hold it lightly with one or both hands.
2. Place feet hip-width apart and distribute weight evenly.
3. Rise onto your toes by lifting both heels as high as possible while keeping knees soft.
4. Lower your heels back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Rise slowly through the balls of the feet and control the descent

Health benefit: Enhances core mobility and gentle rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on the floor with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Place hands behind your head or cross them over your chest.
3. Rotate your torso to the right while keeping your hips facing forward.
4. Return to center, rotate to the left, and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and rotate from the mid back without collapsing forward

Health benefit: Improves lower body stability and lateral weight distribution control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes pointing forward.
2. Shift your weight smoothly onto your left foot while keeping knees soft.
3. Transfer your weight to the right foot by pushing through the ball of the left foot.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled rhythm for several repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and shift smoothly without rotating the spine

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordination between limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until your body forms a straight line.
3. Hold briefly while keeping your torso steady and hips level.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the opposite side, alternating sides.
Safety cue: Brace the core and extend opposite arm and leg slowly while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioceptive awareness during slow gait practice
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and lightly touch it with one hand for balance.
2. Place your right heel directly in front of your left toes so the heel touches the toe.
3. Take slow, deliberate steps forward while using the wall lightly for support.
Safety cue: Stand tall, look forward, and place each heel directly in front of the toe

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate gently while challenging hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy support and place hands lightly on it.
2. Lift your right knee slowly to hip level while keeping your back straight.
3. Lower the right knee and lift the left knee with the same slow, controlled motion.
4. Continue alternating knees slowly while keeping light contact with the support.
Safety cue: Lift knees with control, keep the torso upright, and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps endurance and enhances lower body isometric strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Slide down until your thighs are parallel to the floor and knees align over ankles.
3. Hold the position and keep hands relaxed at your sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and improves unilateral shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend your right arm forward to shoulder height while keeping hips square.
3. Lower the right arm and then extend the left arm forward to shoulder height.
4. Alternate arms with controlled movements and keep a neutral spine.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and lift the arm without rotating the hips

Health benefit: Raises heart rate gently and improves coordination and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while sweeping both arms overhead until hands meet.
3. Step your right foot back to center while lowering both arms to your sides.
4. Repeat by stepping your left foot out and continue alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and promotes controlled hip joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place one hand on a stable surface for support.
2. Shift your weight onto the supporting leg and lift the opposite knee slightly.
3. Move the lifted knee in slow circular motions from the hip.
4. Reverse the circle direction and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and perform slow controlled circles without shifting the torso

Health benefit: Improves triceps flexibility and enhances shoulder overhead range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and raise one arm overhead, bending the elbow so the hand reaches toward the upper back.
2. Reach the opposite hand up to gently press the bent elbow downward.
3. Hold the stretch, then release and switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder blade down and back while reaching the elbow overhead

Health benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength with reduced joint load
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands on a stable elevated surface shoulder-width apart and extend your legs back.
2. Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the surface until your elbows are about 90 degrees.
4. Push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and lower with controlled descent

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and improves seated balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent, feet flat, and hands placed behind you on the floor for support.
2. Lean back slightly to engage your core and lift your feet a few inches or keep them on the floor if needed.
3. Use your core to rock your torso backward and forward in a controlled motion while keeping your spine neutral.
4. Continue rocking with steady, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move from the core without letting the ribs flare

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring activation and increases lower body dynamic flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a stable surface and lightly hold it with one or both hands for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and bend the opposite knee, bringing the heel toward your glutes.
3. Quickly alternate legs, driving each heel toward the glutes in a rhythmic motion.
4. Maintain an upright posture and steady breathing throughout.
Safety cue: Stand tall holding support and kick the heel toward the glute with controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular muscles and supports improved upper back posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with a neutral spine and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Draw your shoulder blades straight back and down as if pinching a pencil between them.
3. Hold the squeeze for two seconds while keeping your neck relaxed.
4. Slowly release to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Pull the shoulder blades down and together without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and outer thigh muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your hand.
2. Keep your hips stacked and lift the top leg upward to about 45 degrees with control.
3. Lower the leg slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Stack your hips and brace the core to prevent rolling

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and coordinated reach control while maintaining balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall or stable surface and place one hand on it at hip height for support.
2. Keep your torso upright and reach forward with the opposite hand to the 12 o'clock position.
3. Move the reaching hand in small controlled arcs to nearby clock positions while keeping the support hand steady.
4. Return the reaching hand to your side and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and reach with control from your supporting hand

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and core rotational stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Raise both hands in loose fists at chest height.
3. Rotate your torso and extend your right arm across the body, snapping the fist toward the opposite shoulder.
4. Return hands to guard and repeat the movement on the left with controlled, rhythmic punches.
Safety cue: Rotate through the torso and keep the core braced during each punch

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and improves torso flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with legs extended and hands beside your hips.
2. Bend your right knee and place your right foot outside your left thigh.
3. Inhale to lengthen the spine and exhale to twist your torso to the right, placing your left elbow outside your right knee.
Safety cue: Sit tall, lengthen the spine, and initiate the twist from the mid back

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle stability with supported alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and heels hovering a few inches off the ground.
2. Quickly alternate tapping each foot lightly to the floor while keeping the other heel lifted.
3. Maintain an upright posture and a fast, steady rhythm with your core engaged.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes pelvic mobility and encourages gentle core muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms by your sides.
2. Reach your right arm overhead and place your left hand on your hip.
3. Bend your torso to the right side, keeping hips facing forward.
4. Return to center, switch sides, and repeat.
Safety cue: Tilt from the pelvis with slow controlled breaths and avoid thrusting the hips

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and upper back muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and knees soft.
2. Engage your core and lift your right knee toward your chest while swinging your left arm.
3. Lower your right foot and lift your left knee while swinging your right arm.
4. Continue alternating at a steady pace while keeping an upright posture.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and lift through the shoulder blades with controlled motion

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps strength and enhances knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms by your sides.
2. Lift your head and shoulders slightly and reach your right hand toward your right heel.
3. Return to center and reach your left hand toward your left heel.
4. Continue alternating while keeping your lower back on the floor.
Safety cue: Extend the leg slowly keeping the knee soft and core braced

Health benefit: Activates core muscles and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. For Reverse Lunges (Assisted), stand tall with feet hip-width apart and place hands on hips for balance.
2. Step your right foot straight back and lower your back knee toward the floor until both knees are bent about 90 degrees.
3. Press through the left heel and engage your glutes to return to standing.
4. Repeat by stepping the left foot back and alternate sides with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep lower back grounded and hinge from the hips for slow controlled heel taps

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and balance with assisted support
Steps to perform:
1. For Low Impact Skaters, stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Step your right foot diagonally behind your left while sweeping your left foot to the side.
3. Shift your weight onto the left foot and push off to bring the right foot back to center.
4. Continue alternating sides with smooth, controlled lateral steps and maintain a soft knee.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral power and cardiovascular fitness with low joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. For the Open Book Stretch, lie on your side with knees bent and both arms extended in front of you.
2. Keep your hips steady and rotate your top arm across your chest, turning your head to follow the hand.
3. Return the arm to the start position and repeat before switching sides.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and drive lateral movement from the hips

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left thigh just above the knee.
3. Thread your hands behind your left thigh and pull the left knee gently toward your chest.
4. Hold the position, then release and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine with slow controlled breathing

Health benefit: Stretches hip external rotators and reduces glute tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on your left foot with core engaged and shoulders relaxed.
2. Place the sole of your right foot against your inner left calf or ankle, avoiding the knee.
3. Bring your hands to your chest or hips and press the foot into the leg to maintain balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both palms flat on the wall at chest height.
2. Step your feet back so your body forms a slight lean and your core is engaged.
3. Press your palms into the wall as hard as you can without allowing movement.
4. Maintain steady tension and keep breathing while holding the press.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and shoulder stability through isometric activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Lift your right knee and reach your left elbow toward it while keeping your torso tall.
3. Return to standing and lift your left knee while reaching your right elbow.
4. Continue alternating in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Brace core and press evenly through both palms keeping spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances cross-body coordination and motor pattern integration for improved balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Reach your right arm up toward the ceiling while keeping your hips square.
3. Slide your right arm under your left arm and lower your right shoulder and ear toward the floor.
4. Reverse the movement to return to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall and move opposite arm and leg with controlled rhythm

Health benefit: Promotes hip extension range of motion and quadriceps lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one foot directly in front of the other, heel touching toe on an imaginary line.
2. Shift weight onto the front foot and lift the back foot, placing its heel directly in front of the toes of the other foot.
3. Continue walking forward along the line with slow, controlled steps and a steady gaze.
Safety cue: Posteriorly tilt the pelvis and gently shift hips forward while keeping torso upright

Health benefit: Enhances ankle stability and dynamic balance during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the floor and arms bent so hands are near your ears forming a W shape.
2. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
3. Lift your hands, forearms, and upper chest a few inches off the floor while keeping the W shape.
4. Hold briefly then lower with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular retractors and improves shoulder posture and stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands up near your chest for balance.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the other knee slightly with the foot flexed.
3. Snap the elevated leg forward in a controlled low kick, then return the foot to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze shoulder blades down and together as you lift

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor power and dynamic balance while enhancing coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both palms flat at chest height with arms straight and shoulder-width apart.
2. Step back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels and keep your core engaged.
3. Without bending your elbows, pinch your shoulder blades together to move your chest slightly toward the wall.
4. Push through your palms to spread your shoulder blades and move your chest away, performing controlled repetitions.
Safety cue: Brace core and extend the kicking leg with control without leaning back

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder stability through controlled protraction and retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Walk your hands forward and lower your chest toward the floor while keeping your hips above your knees.
3. Rest your forehead on the mat and relax your shoulders while lengthening the spine.
4. Walk your hands back toward your knees to return to hands and knees.
Safety cue: Keep arms straight and move only through the scapula by protracting and retracting with control

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic extension and shoulder mobility while gently opening the chest
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a sturdy surface and place one hand on it for balance; shift weight to one leg.
2. Hinge at the hips and lift the free leg straight behind you while keeping a slight bend in the standing knee and a neutral spine.
3. Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in the standing hamstring, keeping hips square and the supporting hand light on the surface.
4. Drive through the standing heel to return upright and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked above knees and reach forward while maintaining a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops single leg posterior chain strength and balance with improved hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and place hands on a wall or chair for balance if needed.
2. Brace your core and lift one leg straight back by squeezing the glute, keeping the knee straight and toes pointed down.
3. Keep your hips level and avoid arching your lower back while lifting the leg.
4. Lower the leg with control to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and enhances posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Take a controlled step to the right and swing both arms across your chest.
3. Step back to center and swing your arms outward to shoulder height.
4. Repeat the side step to the left and continue alternating steps and arm swings.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and hinge from the glutes with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands clasped behind your head.
2. Pull your elbows back and lift your chest to create space across the upper back.
3. Gently arch your upper spine while keeping your lower back stable.
4. Return to upright and repeat the controlled extension movements.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and control the arm swing with your core

Health benefit: Enhances upper back mobility and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and raise your right arm overhead, bending the elbow so your hand reaches your upper back.
2. Use your left hand to grasp your right elbow and gently pull it toward your head.
3. Hold the stretch briefly, then switch arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and open the chest while initiating movement from the upper back

Health benefit: Increases elbow and triceps flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall about an arm's length away.
2. Place fingertips on the wall at shoulder height and shift weight onto one foot.
3. Hinge forward from the hips and lift the other leg back until your torso and lifted leg form a straight line.
4. Hold the position briefly, keep hips square, then lower the lifted leg and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep the neck long and pull the elbow gently toward the head without forcing
Physical limitation: Limited single-leg balance | Reduced core stability

Health benefit: Improves core engagement and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Raise your right arm overhead and reach toward the left side while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Return to center and lower the arm, then raise your left arm and reach toward the right side.
4. Continue alternating reaches smoothly.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep a straight line from knees to head

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder range of motion and spinal elongation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbows bent and forearms extended in front of you.
2. Make light fists and rotate both wrists clockwise for several slow circles.
3. Reverse direction and rotate wrists counterclockwise for several slow circles.
Safety cue: Exhale as you reach up and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances wrist mobility and joint lubrication
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet toward the ceiling.
2. Reach both hands behind your thighs or shins and hold firmly.
3. Gently pull your knees toward your armpits while keeping your lower back on the floor.
4. Hold the position, then lower your feet to the floor to release.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the full range and control the motion from the wrist

Health benefit: Opens hips and encourages gentle lower back relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest and wrap both hands around the shin or knee.
3. Pull the knee gently toward your chest while keeping the standing leg slightly bent.
4. Hold your balance, then lower the foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back gently grounded and move with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor control and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes turned out.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend your knees, lowering your hips toward the floor.
3. Keep your chest lifted and your knees tracking over your toes.
4. Press through your heels to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets inner thighs and glutes to strengthen lower body
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees soft.
2. Raise hands to chin level and keep elbows tucked.
3. Rotate wrists to push hands forward and tap an imaginary speed bag alternately with each fist in a quick rhythm.
4. Maintain a light wrist motion and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Drive hips back, keep chest tall and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances hand eye coordination and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and soles together.
2. Hold your feet or shins and draw your heels toward your groin.
3. Let your knees fall open and use gravity to gently press them toward the floor.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and control the circular motion from the wrists

Health benefit: Promotes hip and groin flexibility and relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift your toes off the floor so you balance on your heels.
2. Take controlled short steps forward while keeping toes elevated.
3. Maintain an upright posture and continue for the desired distance or time.
Safety cue: Draw the belly toward the spine and keep the lower back gently on the mat

Health benefit: Strengthens shin muscles and improves ankle dorsiflexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Step one foot diagonally back and behind the other foot while bending both knees slightly.
3. Lower your back knee a few inches toward the floor while keeping your torso upright.
4. Press through the front foot to return to standing and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep toes pointed up and maintain an upright posture

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip stability and glute engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a low step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one foot and tap the center of the step with your toes.
3. Lower that foot back to the floor with control.
4. Alternate feet at a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over the ankle and torso upright

Health benefit: Improves coordination and activates hip flexors and core
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with weight supported and feet flat on the floor.
2. Pull your toes and the top of your foot upward toward your shin using only your ankle muscles.
3. Hold the top position briefly, then slowly relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Control each tap with a steady tempo and keep hips level

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and neuromuscular control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and the other foot placed against the inner thigh.
2. Hinge forward at the hips and reach toward the toes of the extended leg with a long spine.
3. Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Pull toes toward the shin with controlled movement and keep the ankle steady

Health benefit: Lengthens hamstring muscles and improves posterior chain flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shoulders relaxed.
2. Rise onto the balls of your feet and take small, controlled steps forward.
3. Keep your core engaged and land softly on the toes each step.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and hinge at the hips to reach toward the shin

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances balance during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Brace your core and extend one arm straight forward to shoulder height.
3. Keep hips and shoulders square and avoid rotating your torso.
4. Lower the arm back with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Rise onto the balls of the feet with knees soft and maintain a tall chest

Health benefit: Enhances spinal stability and shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Place feet hip-width apart and hands behind your head.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite knee toward the same-side elbow while crunching your oblique.
3. Lower the leg and return to standing with control.
4. Repeat on the other side and alternate for desired reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you lift the arm

Health benefit: Improves lateral core strength and trunk flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hips and knees bent to 90 degrees and shins parallel to the floor.
2. Keep your shoulders on the ground and brace your core.
3. Lower both knees to one side until you feel a hip stretch, then return to center.
4. Lower both knees to the opposite side and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Brace your core, keep ribs down and crunch from the waist

Health benefit: Increases hip internal and external rotation mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Bend the opposite knee and reach back to grasp the ankle with the same-side hand.
3. Pull the ankle toward your glutes while keeping knees close and hips level.
4. Hold briefly, then release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Press lower back gently into the mat and rotate from the hips

Health benefit: Lengthens quadriceps and supports knee flexion range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step your right foot to the right and cross your left foot behind it.
3. Step your right foot to the right again and tap your left foot beside it.
4. Reverse the pattern by stepping left, crossing behind, and tapping back in rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep ribs down and pull heel toward glute without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and rhythmic movement patterning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides.
2. Take a shallow step to the right and bend the right knee while keeping the left leg straight.
3. Push through the right foot to return to center and repeat to the left side.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright chest and step with control while keeping weight even

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip strength and functional step stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Bend your right knee and lift your heel toward your glutes while keeping your thighs aligned.
3. Lower your right foot back down with control and repeat on the left leg.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep the stepping knee tracking over the foot and chest upright

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and improves knee joint control during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Step into a lunge with your right foot forward and keep the left knee lightly on the ground.
2. Place your left hand on the floor inside your right foot and inhale as you rotate your torso to lift your right arm toward the ceiling.
3. Hold the rotated position for a few breaths while keeping hips square and chest open.
4. Return to center, switch legs, and repeat the same sequence on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly at the hips and curl the heel toward the glute with control

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic mobility and multi joint movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and reach your right arm overhead, then bend the elbow to drop the hand between your shoulder blades.
2. Reach your left hand behind your back and try to grasp your right hand or fingertips.
3. Gently pull the hands together while keeping your chest lifted and shoulders relaxed.
4. Release and repeat the same steps on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases shoulder external rotation and upper back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your left foot with a slight bend in the standing knee.
2. Engage your core and lift your right leg straight out to the side to about hip height.
3. Hold briefly at the top while keeping your hips level and your torso upright.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat the same motion on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and draw shoulder blades down as you reach hands together

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and single leg balance capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press hips up into a strong bridge, keeping shoulders and head on the floor.
3. Place palms flat beside your chest and press through hands, extending elbows to lift the chest slightly.
4. Bend elbows to lower the chest while keeping hips elevated; repeat in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft, hips squared and lift the leg slowly with control

Health benefit: Builds chest strength while activating glutes and posterior chain
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and knees soft.
2. Lift the right knee toward your chest while swinging the left arm forward.
3. Place the right foot down and lift the left knee, maintaining a steady marching rhythm.
4. Keep an upright torso and core engaged while increasing pace as comfortable.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep a neutral spine while pressing the weight

Health benefit: Promotes balance and light cardiovascular activity through wide stepping movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Soften your knees and shift weight slightly to one side.
3. Move your hips in a slow circular motion: forward, out to the side, back, and in.
4. Reverse the circle direction after several rotations and maintain a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Walk with an upright torso and take controlled short steps

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and joint awareness through controlled circular motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and open your legs wide into a comfortable V.
2. Keep your spine tall and hinge forward from the hips with a flat back.
3. Reach your hands toward your feet or the floor and hold the stretch.
4. Slowly return to an upright position and bring your legs together.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and move the hip slowly with control

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and inner thigh flexibility and seated range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and place your hands behind your head.
2. Soften your knees and hinge at the hips while keeping a straight back.
3. Lower your torso until it's parallel to the floor or you feel a hamstring stretch.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and squeeze your glutes.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and avoid rounding
Physical limitation: Lower back pain (non-specific) | Reduced core stability

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and reinforces hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and bring the soles of your feet together with knees splayed outward.
2. Press your feet together and explosively lift your hips by squeezing your glutes.
3. Lower your hips with control and repeat for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a soft knee bend and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Targets glute activation and hip extension for improved posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Heel Digs: Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and extend the other leg slightly forward with the heel on the floor and toes lifted.
3. Press the extended heel firmly into the ground while pulling the toes up to engage the front lower leg.
4. Return the foot to neutral and repeat on the other side, alternating steadily.
Safety cue: Squeeze your glutes at the top and lower with control to avoid arching the back

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and activates lower leg muscles for functional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Adductor Rock-Back: Kneel on hands and knees with knees wider than hip-width.
2. Place hands under shoulders and lengthen the spine.
3. Sit your hips back toward your heels until you feel a gentle inner-thigh stretch.
4. Rock forward to return to the starting position and repeat slowly.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and perform each rep with control

Health benefit: Stretches adductor muscles and enhances hip mobility through controlled rocking
Steps to perform:
1. Sphinx Pose: Lie on your belly with legs extended and tops of your feet resting on the floor.
2. Place forearms on the ground with elbows under shoulders and palms facing down.
3. Press into the forearms and lift your chest while drawing shoulders away from ears.
4. Hold the posture with hips grounded and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Hinge back from the hips keeping hips level and controlled

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and anterior torso opening with low intensity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand a few inches from a wall and place one fingertip lightly on it for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto one foot and lift the opposite leg straight behind you.
3. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso until it is nearly parallel to the floor while keeping the lifted leg aligned with your body.
4. Push through the standing heel to return to upright and keep a slight bend in the knee.
Safety cue: Lengthen through the spine and breathe steadily while keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance while strengthening hamstrings and hip stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands at chest height with thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond.
2. Step your feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward your hands while keeping your elbows close to your sides.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances triceps strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with your arms extended out to the sides and your legs together.
2. Lift both legs to about a 45-degree angle and keep them straight.
3. Slowly lower both legs to one side in a controlled motion until they are near the floor, then return to center.
4. Lower both legs to the opposite side in the same controlled manner and return to center.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and elbows tracking close to the ribs

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair or on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly and engage your core.
3. Lift both feet a few inches off the ground with knees together.
4. Rotate your knees slowly to the right, then to the left like windshield wipers.
Safety cue: Control the swing with your core and hinge from the hips, not the lower back

Health benefit: Increases core rotational mobility and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit sideways on a sturdy chair and place one ankle on the opposite thigh above the knee.
2. Keep the supporting foot flat and lengthen your spine.
3. Fold forward from the hips and reach your hands toward the chair seat or floor.
4. Hold the position, then return upright and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders grounded and move knees slowly using core control

Health benefit: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the other leg back and up while keeping it straight.
3. Extend both arms out wide to form a star shape and keep hips level.
4. Hold the balance, then return to standing and switch sides.
Safety cue: Square the hips forward and maintain a long spine as you hinge from the hips

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and whole body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and arms at your sides, forehead on the mat.
2. Lift chest and arms slightly off the ground, keeping neck neutral.
3. Sweep arms out to the sides and overhead in a wide arc with thumbs leading.
4. Reverse the movement to return arms to your sides with control.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and focus on a fixed point to stabilize the stance

Health benefit: Promotes scapular mobility and posterior shoulder activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Engage your core and extend one arm upward in a strong punching motion toward the ceiling.
3. Lower that arm and immediately punch up with the opposite arm.
4. Maintain steady breathing and controlled shoulder position as you alternate.
Safety cue: Keep the forehead anchored and move the shoulders slowly, initiating from the scapulae

Health benefit: Supports thoracic extension and shoulder mobility during reaching movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing the wall with feet hip-width apart and forearms resting against the wall at shoulder height.
2. Press forearms into the wall and draw your shoulder blades down and together.
3. Slide your forearms upward along the wall as high as comfortable while keeping contact.
4. Return your forearms to the starting position with controlled scapular movement.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular upward rotation and shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and press your palm and inner forearm flat against it at shoulder height.
2. Keep the arm straight and slowly rotate your torso away from the wall.
3. Hold the stretch and then release.
Safety cue: Keep forearms and wrists contacting the wall and initiate movement from the scapulae

Health benefit: Enhances biceps and anterior shoulder flexibility for improved range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift your knees so your shins are parallel to the floor.
2. Brace your core and draw your knees toward your chest.
3. Hold the position with your lower back pressed into the floor.
Safety cue: Keep the chest open and avoid shrugging the shoulder as you lean into the stretch

Health benefit: Builds hip flexor endurance and core stability during isometric hold
Steps to perform:
1. Start on your knees in a high plank with hands under your shoulders.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips square to the floor.
3. Lift one hand and tap the opposite shoulder with control.
4. Repeat the taps alternately while minimizing hip movement.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral pelvis and engage the lower abs to prevent lumbar arching

Health benefit: Improves core stability and shoulder coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while sweeping both arms out and up to shoulder height.
3. Step the right foot back to center while returning arms to your sides, then step the left foot out and repeat.
4. Continue alternating sides at a steady, controlled pace with knees soft and chest lifted.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while tapping each shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and low impact cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with eyes forward and shoulders relaxed.
2. Retract the neck by pulling the chin straight back toward the spine.
3. Protract the neck by pushing the head forward so the chin moves away from the neck.
4. Alternate slowly between retraction and protraction with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the arm sweep through the full range

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and open your legs wide into a V with knees straight.
2. Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips while keeping the spine long.
3. Reach both hands toward your feet or shins without rounding the upper back.
4. Hold the position and adjust torso depth to increase or decrease the inner-thigh stretch.
Safety cue: Keep the chin slightly tucked and perform slow controlled neck protraction and retraction

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot slightly off the ground.
3. Extend arms out to the sides at shoulder height and engage your core.
4. Hold for 20-30 seconds, then lower the lifted foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a long spine and hinge forward from the hips

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat on the floor, and extend the other leg straight.
2. Press through the heel of the bent leg and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knee.
3. Squeeze the glute at the top and keep the extended leg in line with your torso.
4. Lower your hips with control to the floor and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, gaze steady, and engage the core to control balance

Health benefit: Builds unilateral glute strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift weight to one foot and push off to hop a small distance laterally to the other foot.
3. Land softly on the balls of your feet with knees bent to absorb the impact.
4. Continue short, controlled hops side to side at a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel, keep hips level, and squeeze the glute at the top

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with one leg extended and the ankle relaxed.
2. Point the toes away from the shin to plantarflex and hold for 2-3 seconds.
3. Pull the toes toward the shin to dorsiflex and hold for 2-3 seconds, then repeat.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and control each lateral hop

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and both feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross the right ankle over the left knee and flex the right foot.
3. Thread the left arm under the right thigh and place the right hand behind the back.
4. Pull the right knee toward the chest and rotate the torso toward the right, hold, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Control the motion and move the foot deliberately while keeping the lower leg stable

Health benefit: Enhances spinal rotation and hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall or sturdy surface and place one hand lightly on it for balance.
2. Keep the standing leg slightly bent and swing the other leg side to side from the hip in a controlled motion.
3. Maintain an upright posture and continue swinging for the desired reps, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and rotate from the thorax while avoiding lower back rounding

Health benefit: Promotes hip dynamic flexibility and movement preparation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and extend your arms forward for balance.
2. Step your right leg diagonally behind your left and lower into a curtsy by bending both knees.
3. Press through your left heel to rise back up and bring the right foot forward.
4. Repeat for desired reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and control the swing from the hip

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and improves single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Rapidly alternate lifting each foot a few inches and tapping the ground with quick, small steps.
3. Continue at a fast tempo while keeping a light bounce and upright posture.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and ensure the front knee tracks over the toes

Health benefit: Improves pelvic alignment and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and raise your right arm overhead.
2. Exhale and lean your torso to the left, sliding your left hand down your thigh while reaching the right arm over.
3. Hold briefly, return to center, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Engage lower abs and keep ribs stacked over hips

Health benefit: Increases lateral flexibility and trunk mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Imagine a straight line on the floor and place one foot directly in front of the other.
3. Extend arms out to the sides for balance and take slow, controlled steps along the line.
4. Keep eyes focused ahead and land heel-to-toe with each step.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and reach through the top arm to lengthen the side body

Health benefit: Enhances proprioception and walking balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Lift knees a few inches off the ground and straighten hips so your back stays flat.
3. Hold this position with core tight and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Fix your gaze ahead and walk with a tall, controlled posture

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips or raised for balance.
2. Drive one knee up toward your chest while keeping your core engaged.
3. Lower the foot back down with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders over wrists and maintain a neutral spine while hovering knees

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and running mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or on the floor with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Place both hands on the sides of your rib cage with fingers pointing down.
3. Exhale and slide your rib cage to the right without moving your hips.
4. Return to center and repeat the same movement to the left.
Safety cue: Drive the knee up with control while keeping the torso upright and core braced

Health benefit: Enhances rib cage mobility and postural alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel or sit and place one palm on the floor with fingers pointing toward you.
2. Keep your arm straight and slowly lean your hips backward to extend the wrist.
3. Hold briefly, then lift your hand and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stabilize the pelvis and shift the rib cage without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot while keeping the other foot off the ground.
2. Press through the ball of the standing foot and raise your heel until you balance on your toes.
3. Hold the top position steady and keep your posture tall.
4. Lower your heel slowly back to the floor and repeat on the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Support the forearm and gently extend the wrist with controlled pressure

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on the floor with legs straight and toes tucked under.
2. Extend arms out to the sides at shoulder level forming a "T" with palms facing down.
3. Squeeze shoulder blades together and lift your arms and chest a few inches off the ground.
4. Lower slowly to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the supporting knee slightly bent and raise the heel with ankle control

Health benefit: Improves posterior shoulder strength and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hinge slightly at the hips.
2. Clasp hands together and raise them overhead to one side.
3. Slowly rotate your torso and bring your hands diagonally down across your body toward the opposite hip.
4. Reverse the motion slowly to return overhead and repeat on the other side as needed.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and retract the shoulder blades as you raise the arms

Health benefit: Enhances trunk rotational control and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Swing both arms forward together until they cross in front of your chest while keeping them level and straight.
3. Open arms back out to the sides to the starting position with a controlled motion and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate from the hips and keep the core braced throughout the chop

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and upper body movement readiness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back about half a step and bend both knees slightly.
3. Press the back heel into the floor and lean hips toward the wall until you feel a lower calf stretch.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and control the swing with your shoulders and core

Health benefit: Improves ankle flexibility and calf muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place one hand on it for light support.
2. Shift weight onto the standing leg and hinge forward at the hips.
3. Lift the opposite leg straight back and keep hips level while balancing.
4. Hold the position, then return upright and switch sides.
Safety cue: Bend the back knee and press the heel down to feel the soleus stretch

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes facing forward.
2. Shift your weight to one leg and push your hips back while bending that knee.
3. Keep the other leg straight and both feet flat as you lower until the bent thigh is near parallel.
4. Push through the bent leg to return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, maintain a flat back and control your balance using the support

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral hip muscles and improves side to side mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Push hips back and step the left foot diagonally behind while swinging both arms across your body.
3. Drive through the front foot to return to center.
4. Repeat the movement to the opposite side with a steady, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves dynamic hip power and coordination during lateral movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with the soles of your feet together and knees dropped outward.
2. Hold your feet with your hands and draw your heels toward your groin.
3. Press your elbows gently against your inner thighs to pry the knees toward the floor.
4. Lean forward a little to increase the pry, then release and repeat with control.
Safety cue: Soften the knees, hinge from the hips and control each swing with deliberate tempo

Health benefit: Increases hip joint mobility and improves deep squat range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with feet hip-width and shoulders relaxed.
2. Interlace your fingers and place both hands at the base of your skull.
3. Gently nod your chin toward your chest while applying light pressure with your hands.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace the core and drive the knee outward with controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves posterior neck flexibility and reduces neck stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with weight centered over the foot.
2. Bend the opposite knee and place that foot against the inner calf or ankle.
3. Extend your arms forward or out to the sides to help balance.
4. Keep your core engaged and hold while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin slightly and gently lengthen the back of the neck without forcing

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with one foot forward and the other foot behind.
2. Place a hand lightly on a wall or stable surface for support.
3. Bend both knees and lower your hips straight down until the front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
4. Push through the front heel to return to start and repeat.
Safety cue: Find a fixed gaze, keep hips level and engage the standing leg for steady balance

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step one foot straight back while simultaneously raising your arms overhead or out to the sides.
3. Step the foot forward to return to feet together while lowering your arms.
4. Continue by alternating the step-back side at a steady tempo.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and torso upright during the descent

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular fitness and coordination while promoting hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the floor and the other foot flat ahead.
2. Tuck your pelvis and lengthen your spine.
3. Shift your hips forward until you feel a front-hip stretch.
4. Hold the position, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and maintain a tall spine

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Gently draw your chin straight back toward your throat.
3. Hold the tucked position briefly while keeping shoulders relaxed.
4. Release and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate through the thoracic spine while keeping hips and pelvis still

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor and quadriceps flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keep one knee bent and lift that foot up toward the ceiling.
3. Squeeze the glute at the top without arching the lower back.
4. Lower with control and repeat, then change sides.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis and hinge from the hips to control the stretch

Health benefit: Strengthens deep neck flexors and improves neck posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the right while sweeping your arms outward and up to shoulder height.
3. Return your right foot to center and bring your arms back to your sides.
4. Repeat by stepping the left foot out and continue alternating in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Retract the chin slowly while keeping the head on the floor

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and enhances hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head to the right and use your right hand to gently guide your head toward your right shoulder.
3. Drop your left shoulder down and hold the position briefly, then repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hip and drive the heel up while maintaining a neutral spine

Health benefit: Increases cardiovascular endurance while improving shoulder mobility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toe of the back foot.
2. Shift your weight onto the back foot and take a small backward step with the front foot, placing it heel-to-toe behind the other.
3. Continue stepping backward in a straight line while keeping an upright posture and steady balance.
4. Change which foot leads after several steps to work both sides evenly.
Safety cue: Step with control and keep your chest lifted to avoid spinal rotation

Health benefit: Relieves neck and shoulder tension and improves range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with a neutral spine and relaxed shoulders.
2. Place your palm or fingers on the back of your head for resistance.
3. Press your head back into your hand without allowing your neck to move.
4. Hold the press for a few seconds then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder down and tilt the head away to lengthen the upper neck

Health benefit: Challenges balance and proprioception while enhancing ankle and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keeping the knee bent, lift one leg out to the side until your thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Lower with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Take slow controlled steps with hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior neck muscles and enhances neck endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Bend one knee and bring your heel up toward your glutes in a controlled motion.
