3. Lower and alternate legs in a steady marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and press gently into resistance without moving the head

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and back straight.
2. Turn your head about 45 degrees toward the armpit of the side to be stretched.
3. Tuck your chin slightly and place the same-side hand on the back of your head.
4. Gently guide your head downward and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and pelvis stable as you lift the leg

Health benefit: Activates hamstrings while improving lower limb coordination and rhythmic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the opposite foot to rest against the inner calf or knee.
3. Keep eyes open and fix your gaze on a stationary point ahead.
4. Engage your core and hold the position before switching sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep core engaged, and control each knee drive to avoid bouncing

Health benefit: Increases neck lateral flexibility and relieves upper shoulder tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and knees soft.
2. Clasp your hands together and extend your arms straight out at chest height.
3. Brace your core and press your hands forward while resisting any torso rotation.
4. Maintain a stable spine and hold the anti-rotation contraction.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, knees slightly bent, and chest up.
2. Shift weight onto the balls of your feet and take a small side step to the right.
3. Bring the left foot to meet the right with controlled, quiet steps and maintain a low stance.
4. Repeat slowly for several steps, then reverse to the left while keeping smooth, deliberate movements.
Safety cue: Stand on one leg with hips level, a soft standing knee, and a steady gaze

Health benefit: Builds anti rotation core strength and improves trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and place the upper back against the top of the chair back.
2. Interlace fingers behind your head and open your elbows to create space across the chest.
3. Gently lean back over the chair back, extending through the upper spine without forcing the neck.
4. Return to upright and repeat for the desired number of repetitions with slow control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and strengthens hip abductors with low impact conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a low step and place one heel on the surface with toes pointing up.
2. Keep both knees soft and hinge at the hips to fold forward over the raised leg with a long spine.
3. Hold the stretch for the chosen duration, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases upper back mobility and promotes improved thoracic posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and imagine a clock on the floor around you.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the other foot, extend it to tap your toe at the chosen clock "hour."
3. Return the foot to the floor under control and repeat for other clock positions and the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and improves posterior chain lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and arms resting alongside your body, palms down.
2. Draw shoulder blades down and together and lift your chest and upper thighs a few inches off the floor.
3. Keep a neutral neck and squeeze glutes while holding briefly.
4. Lower with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves multidirectional single leg balance and movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a low step with feet hip-width and weight evenly distributed.
2. Drive through the heel of one foot and step up, bringing the other foot onto the step.
3. Stand tall with hips extended, then step down with the trailing foot first under control.
4. Repeat leading with the same leg and alternate legs each set.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and back muscles to support improved spinal alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways with your outside foot beside a low step or sturdy platform and feet hip-width apart.
2. Push through the outside foot to lift your body and place that foot on the platform, straightening the hip and knee.
3. Step the inside foot up to meet the outside foot on the platform.
4. Step the inside foot down first, then lower the outside foot to return to the start.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and functional stair climbing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and eyes facing forward.
2. Slowly tilt your head toward one shoulder by contracting the neck muscles on the opposite side.
3. Return the head to center with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel of the foot on the step and keep hips level

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and lateral stability during side-to-side movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and place the same-side hand lightly on your clavicle to anchor it.
2. Gently tilt your head away from that shoulder while slightly rotating your face toward the opposite side.
3. Use the free hand to apply light pressure to the side of the head to deepen the stretch if desired.
4. Hold briefly, return the head to center, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and ensure the stepping knee tracks over the toes

Health benefit: Enhances neck lateral mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shoulders relaxed.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the other knee to hip level.
3. Hold the lifted knee, engage your core, and keep the standing leg slightly bent.
4. Maintain steady breaths and switch sides after the hold.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core engagement and hip flexor endurance during balance tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall about an arm's length away at chest height.
2. Place palms on the wall shoulder-width apart with elbows slightly bent.
3. Press into the wall as if trying to move it and hold steady tension.
4. Keep a straight spine and breathe evenly during the hold.
Safety cue: Brace your core and lift the knee to hip height while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Increases hip joint mobility and coordination through controlled circular motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a slight squat with feet hip-width and knees soft.
2. Step sideways to one side and transfer weight onto the lead foot.
3. Bring the trailing foot behind the lead foot and tap lightly without jumping.
4. Repeat to the other side while keeping your chest up.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and move the hip slowly with controlled range

Health benefit: Builds chest isometric strength and shoulder stability without joint movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with legs extended straight ahead.
2. Bend your right knee and place your right ankle over your left thigh near the knee.
3. Flex the right foot and hinge forward from the hips while keeping a long spine.
4. Deepen the fold, then release and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Press evenly into the wall with both hands and keep shoulders down and back

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and balance with low impact stepping
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Shift your weight back onto your heels and lift your toes off the ground.
3. Shift your weight forward onto your toes and lift your heels off the ground.
4. Rock smoothly between heels and toes with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Step laterally with control and land softly with knees slightly bent

Health benefit: Stretches outer hip and gluteal muscles to enhance hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hips and knees bent at 90 degrees and feet off the floor.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and engage your core.
3. Slowly extend one leg straight toward the floor without touching it, then return to start.
4. Repeat the movement with the other leg and continue alternating with control.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips while keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and foot proprioception for improved balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart to begin Standing Leg Curls.
2. Shift weight onto your left leg and bend your right knee to lift the heel toward your glutes.
3. Squeeze the right hamstring at the top and hold briefly.
4. Lower the right foot with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Rock slowly between heel and toe while keeping the ankle aligned under the knee

Health benefit: Builds core coordination and control for safer movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart to begin Karaoke Step (Slow).
2. Step your right foot to the right and cross your left foot behind the right.
3. Step your right foot to the right again and bring your left foot to meet it.
4. Move slowly with controlled steps and repeat to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed into the floor and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and improves single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Extend your right arm straight in front with the palm facing up to begin Wrist Flexor Stretch.
2. Use your left hand to gently pull the right fingers and palm down toward you until you feel a stretch.
3. Hold the stretch, then switch arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Control the knee bend and avoid swinging the hip

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip mobility and coordination for improved movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and soften your knees.
2. Lift arms diagonally overhead and slightly away from the body.
3. Keep the movement small and brace your core.
4. Lower arms with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and place each step with control

Health benefit: Increases wrist and forearm flexibility for better range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Relax your neck and pull your shoulder blades downward toward your hips.
3. Hold the depressed position briefly while keeping the spine tall.
4. Release shoulders and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep forearm aligned with the wrist and avoid shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Improves standing balance and shoulder mobility within a controlled range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg while hinging slightly at the hips.
2. Keep the support knee soft and extend the other heel straight back.
3. Squeeze the glute at the top without arching the lower back.
4. Lower the leg with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and contributes to improved shoulder positioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a low, stable box or step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step up with the nearest foot and place it fully on the box.
3. Transfer your weight and bring the trailing foot over the box to the other side.
4. Step down with the leading foot, then bring the other foot down to return to the start.
Safety cue: Sit tall and actively pull the shoulder blades down

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and supports hip extension strength during standing movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a firm surface with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place your hands on your hips and sense a neutral sitting position.
3. Tilt your pelvis forward and backward slowly as if moving a clock hand.
4. Rotate your pelvis in small controlled circles clockwise and then counterclockwise.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and hinge from the hip while squeezing the glute

Health benefit: Challenges dynamic balance and agility while improving hip mobility and stepping coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a corner with forearms resting on each wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean gently into the corner.
3. Keep your chest lifted and maintain a stable shoulder position.
4. Adjust your forward foot to increase or decrease the stretch while holding the position.
Safety cue: Step fully onto the box and keep a controlled upright torso

Health benefit: Improves pelvic mobility and movement awareness to enhance core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with the knee slightly bent and the other foot hovering behind.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach both hands toward the floor while keeping your back flat.
3. Lower until you feel tension in the standing hamstring or your hands reach mid-shin.
4. Drive the hips forward and squeeze the glute to return to standing; switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and move the pelvis slowly with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Stretches the chest and anterior shoulder to increase upper body flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent, feet flat, and hands placed shoulder-width behind your hips.
2. Press into hands and feet and lift your hips until torso and thighs form a straight line.
3. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your glutes while holding the position.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and gently retract the shoulder blades

Health benefit: Builds hamstring and glute strength and enhances single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with hands under shoulders and feet hip-width apart.
2. Reach your right hand forward one step and then bring your left foot forward to follow.
3. Alternate hand and opposite foot in a controlled stepping pattern to move forward.
4. Reverse the sequence to move back to the start while keeping core tight and hips level.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and keep a neutral spine throughout the movement

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and supports core and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Inhale and lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Pause briefly at the top without rolling the shoulders forward.
4. Exhale and lower the shoulders slowly back to the start.
Safety cue: Press through hands and heels to keep hips aligned with shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and provides low-impact full-body movement practice
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and cross your right leg behind your left leg.
2. Keep your hips square and lean your torso toward the left until you feel a stretch along the outer right hip.
3. Hold the position, then repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move arms and legs deliberately without twisting

Health benefit: Increases trapezius endurance and promotes neck and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and support your upper body on your elbow.
2. Lift the top leg to hip height with the leg straight and toes pointing forward.
3. Squeeze the outer thigh and hold the leg steady without movement.
4. Lower the leg slowly and switch sides.
Safety cue: Raise and lower your shoulders slowly while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Lengthens lateral thigh tissue and improves hip joint flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width about 6-12 inches from the wall.
2. Keep your heels planted and shoulders touching the wall for support.
3. Lift your toes and the fronts of your feet up toward your shins as high as possible.
4. Lower your toes slowly back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Square your hips and hinge forward from the hips without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Enhances hip abductor strength and lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and bend your elbows to 90 degrees so upper arms are parallel to the floor.
2. Keep forearms steady and make slow controlled small circles with your elbows forward for several rotations.
3. Reverse the direction and perform slow circles backward for the same number.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced to prevent pelvic drop

Health benefit: Strengthens anterior lower leg muscles and supports ankle dorsiflexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright and bring your hands behind your back to press your palms together with fingers pointing down if possible.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and gently lift your hands upward toward your mid-back to open the chest.
3. Keep your neck long and hold the position without forcing the movement.
4. Release your hands slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Anchor the heel and lift the toes with controlled dorsiflexion while staying upright

Health benefit: Increases shoulder joint mobility and warms surrounding musculature
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite knee toward your chest until the hip is about 90 degrees.
3. Hold the lifted knee steady while keeping your torso upright for the desired time.
4. Lower the leg under control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and perform small controlled circles from the elbows

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and challenges balance and core stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands at your sides or behind your head.
2. Take a small side step to the right and bend your torso slightly toward that side.
3. Step the left foot toward the right while returning to an upright position.
4. Continue alternating sides with controlled, waddling steps.
Safety cue: Stand tall, brace the core, and lift the knee without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Builds hamstring and glute strength and improves unilateral leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands lightly on your waist.
2. Anchor your pelvis and slide your rib cage slowly to the right using only your upper torso.
3. Return the rib cage to center with control.
4. Repeat the slide to the left while keeping your hips still.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis level and core braced as you lift

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and oblique activation for functional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot forward with toes on the floor and heel lifted.
2. Bend the front knee and shift hips back while keeping toes anchored.
3. Hold the stretch, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and move from the rib cage with control

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and segmental spinal control during rotational movements
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your right side with legs stacked and knees slightly bent.
2. Extend your left arm up and your right hand on the floor for support.
3. Sweep the left arm in an arc across your body while rotating your torso and rolling onto your back.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the side, repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stabilize the pelvis and slide the rib cage smoothly without rotating the hips

Health benefit: Increases anterior lower leg flexibility and eases ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and a chair directly behind you.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend your knees to lower until your glutes lightly touch the chair.
3. Pause briefly with weight in your heels and chest lifted.
4. Press through your heels to stand fully and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a long spine and hinge from the hips without rounding the back

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and scapular coordination in a supported rotational pattern
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the right while raising both arms overhead.
3. Step your right foot back to center while lowering your arms to your sides.
4. Repeat the same step and arm pattern to the left side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked and move the top arm with control

Health benefit: Trains safe squat mechanics and builds lower body strength for daily sitting and standing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on near a wall and place the far hand on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step your feet away from the wall and hinge forward at the hips while keeping the arm straight.
3. Lean into the stretch until you feel it along the side of your torso, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep chest up and sit lightly onto the chair

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular activity and coordination with low impact lower body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your right leg while lifting the left foot slightly off the ground.
2. Hold your arms out to the sides or place them on your hips to help balance.
3. Slowly turn your head to look over your right shoulder and then return to center.
4. Repeat the head turns several times, then switch to balance on the other leg.
Safety cue: Step deliberately with a neutral spine and steady breathing

Health benefit: Promotes latissimus flexibility and improves shoulder girdle reach and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Tuck your chin slightly and lift your chest as you arch your upper back over the chair back.
3. Hold the extended position for a few seconds while breathing smoothly.
4. Return to upright and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and reach through the arm while maintaining a neutral pelvis

Health benefit: Challenges proprioception and vestibular integration to improve balance under dynamic conditions
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width and arms at your sides.
2. Drive your hips up into a full bridge, squeezing your glutes.
3. Lift one knee toward your chest without dropping your hips, then lower it.
4. Alternate legs in a controlled marching rhythm while keeping hips level.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, soften the standing knee and turn your head slowly

Health benefit: Enhances glute and hip stability while engaging the core
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearm against the doorframe with elbow at shoulder height.
2. Step forward with the same-side foot to create a gentle stretch in the front of the chest.
3. Keep your torso upright and rotate slightly away from the arm until you feel the stretch.
4. Hold the position, then switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you alternately lift each knee

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and cardiovascular fitness without high joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Close your eyes and keep your hands relaxed at your sides while maintaining an upright posture.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then open your eyes and switch the lead foot.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips back to control lateral motion

Health benefit: Increases anterior shoulder and chest mobility to support better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms at your sides with elbows bent.
2. Press your lower back and wrists gently into the floor and keep that contact throughout the movement.
3. Slowly slide your arms overhead until they are nearly straight while keeping your shoulders down.
4. Reverse the motion with control to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep ribcage down and shoulders relaxed while leaning into the doorframe stretch

Health benefit: Challenges balance and proprioception to enhance stability in single limb tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended or knees bent and place hands on the floor behind your hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through your hands and feet and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees or heels.
3. Squeeze your glutes and keep your chest open while maintaining a neutral neck.
4. Lower your hips with control back down to the floor.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and soft knees while breathing steadily with eyes closed

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic mobility and scapular control for improved upper back movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest to about 90 degrees while keeping the other foot planted.
3. Lower the lifted foot back to the floor and immediately lift it again for repetitions.
4. Switch legs and repeat the same motion on the other side.
Safety cue: Press the lower back gently to the floor and move the shoulders slowly and deliberately

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles while improving shoulder and core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels with knees apart and chest over thighs.
2. Extend both arms forward, then slide them to one side to reach along the outer edge of that arm.
3. Hold the side reach, then return hands to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips lifted in line with shoulders and engage glutes to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Encourages lumbar mobility and core coordination during controlled lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and arms out to the sides.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the opposite arm forward while lifting the free leg back into a straight line.
3. Keep hips square and pause at the furthest reach to challenge balance.
4. Return to upright standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Stabilize the pelvis with the core and control each knee motion without jerking

Health benefit: Stretches lateral torso and hip muscles while promoting relaxation and spinal lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Quadruped Thoracic Rotation: Get on all fours with knees under hips and hands under shoulders.
2. Place your right hand behind your head and keep your left hand planted on the floor.
3. Rotate your upper back to lift your right elbow toward the ceiling while looking up.
4. Return to the start and repeat for desired reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops single leg stability and dynamic reach control for improved balance
Steps to perform:
1. Lateral Squat Walk: Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Drop into a low squat with chest up and weight on your heels.
3. Step your right foot to the side, then bring your left foot to return to the squat stance.
4. Continue stepping sideways for the desired distance while maintaining squat depth.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and hinge from the hips while reaching forward with control

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility for better upper body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Shadow Boxing (Uppercuts): Stand in a light athletic stance with feet shoulder-width and one foot slightly back.
2. Bend knees slightly and drive your right fist upward from your hip toward chin level while rotating your torso.
3. Return your hand to guard, then repeat the uppercut on the left in a steady, rhythmic motion.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and rotate through the upper back slowly while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Standing Crescent Moon: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms overhead, palms touching.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and engage the standing leg.
3. Lean slowly to the opposite side from the waist, reaching the top arm over your head and lengthening the side body.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and weight in the heels as you step

Health benefit: Enhances upper body coordination and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Single Leg RDL (Bodyweight): Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg with a slight knee bend.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach your chest forward while extending the free leg straight behind you.
3. Keep your back flat and hips level as you lower until your torso and rear leg form a straight line.
4. Drive the standing hip forward to return to upright and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips and keep elbows tight to maintain control

Health benefit: Increases lateral spinal mobility and side body flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Wall Windmill: Stand facing a wall and place one hand on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step your feet wider than hip-width and hinge at the hips while rotating your torso away from the wall.
3. Slide the free hand down the outside of the front leg toward the ankle while keeping the other hand on the wall.
4. Reach the top arm up and along the wall, then return to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep a long spine and engage the core to avoid lower back collapse

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single leg balance through hip hinge
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, feet hip-width and a few inches from the wall.
2. Press your lower back into the wall and tuck your chin slightly.
3. Raise your arms to a goalpost position with elbows bent 90 and the backs of your hands touching the wall.
4. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and hold the position for the chosen duration.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while swinging your left heel back to lightly tap under your glute; land softly.
3. Return to center with a small hop or step and then step your left foot out while swinging your right heel back.
4. Continue alternating sides at a steady rhythm for the desired reps or time.
Safety cue: Keep the moving arm long and rotate from the upper back while keeping hips stacked

Health benefit: Builds scapular control and supports improved shoulder alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or the floor with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Interlace your fingers behind your back and straighten your arms with palms facing away.
3. Lift your chest and gently squeeze your shoulder blades together while keeping your neck neutral.
4. Hold the opened position for the chosen duration then release.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Elevates cardiovascular activation and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Tightrope Walk: stand tall with feet together and imagine a straight line on the floor.
2. Step forward placing one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toes.
3. Extend your arms out to the sides and keep your gaze forward for balance.
4. Walk slowly along the line with controlled steps for the desired distance.
Safety cue: Land softly on the balls of your feet and absorb impact with bent knees

Health benefit: Opens the chest and counteracts forward shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Rib Grab Rotation (Side Lying): lie on your side with knees bent and stack your shoulders and hips.
2. Reach your top hand to the side of your rib cage and keep the elbow lifted.
3. Rotate your torso upward toward the ceiling while keeping the lower ribs anchored.
4. Lower back to the start with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit tall with ribs down and draw shoulder blades together to open the chest

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor activation and coordination during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stork Stance (Calf Raise): stand tall and lift one foot so you balance on the other leg.
2. Soften the standing knee and keep your torso upright.
3. Rise onto the ball of your foot by lifting your heel as high as comfortable.
4. Lower your heel back slowly and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and step with controlled cadence

Health benefit: Increases hip extension range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Place both hands lightly at the back of your neck with elbows wide.
3. Inhale to lengthen the spine, then exhale and slowly extend your upper back while opening the chest.
4. Return to a neutral spine with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis and maintain an upright torso during the stretch

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and calf muscle strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hips and knees bent at 90 and arms straight up over your chest.
2. Brace your core and press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Lower your right arm and left leg slowly toward the floor while keeping the opposite arm and leg steady.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the other side in a controlled alternating pattern.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee slightly bent and rise with ankle control

Health benefit: Strengthens thoracic extensors and promotes upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Raise both hands to chest level in a loose guard position.
3. Rotate your torso and extend one arm across your body in a punching motion while keeping the opposite hand guarding.
4. Retract the punching hand to guard and repeat, alternating sides.
Safety cue: Hinge from the thoracic spine with core engaged and avoid lower back collapse

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordinated limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees soft.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach your right hand diagonally back toward your right heel as if pointing to a clock.
3. Return to center and reset your posture.
4. Repeat the reach on the left side and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Press the low back into the floor and move slowly with controlled breathing

Health benefit: Improves rotational power and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Reach both arms overhead and lift your chest as you look up.
3. Hinge at the hips and roll slowly down through your spine toward your toes.
4. Roll up vertebra by vertebra and lower your arms back to your sides.
Safety cue: Rotate through the torso while keeping hips stable and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and posterior shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift your knees a few inches off the floor with hips over shoulders.
2. Spread your fingers and press your palms into the ground while keeping a flat back and neutral neck.
3. Brace your core and hold the position, breathing steadily without letting hips sag or rise.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and reach posteriorly with control

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and coordinated full body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a wide stance with knees slightly bent.
2. Bend one knee and kick the heel toward the glutes quickly.
3. Alternate legs rapidly with an upright torso and light bounce.
4. Maintain controlled motion for the desired repetitions or time.
Safety cue: Articulate the spine sequentially from chest to hips while maintaining soft knees

Health benefit: Enhances full body core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Place one knee on the ground and extend the other leg out to the side with the foot flat.
2. Square your hips and hinge forward over the extended leg with a long spine.
3. Hold the position to feel a stretch along the inner thigh.
4. Return to center and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and spine neutral while bracing the core

Health benefit: Improves hamstring activation and hip mobility during dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with the core engaged and the other leg relaxed.
2. Swing the free leg forward in a smooth, controlled arc while keeping the torso upright.
3. Allow the leg to return to the starting position with control.
4. Repeat for the chosen reps, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Drive heels toward glutes with an upright chest and soft knees

Health benefit: Develops hip flexor control and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with your forearm under your shoulder and your bottom knee bent.
2. Press your forearm into the floor and lift your hips to align shoulder to knee.
3. Hold steady with core engaged and hips elevated.
4. Lower your hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lateral core strength and shoulder stability with reduced load
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel facing a bench or chair and place your palms on the seat with arms extended.
2. Sit back toward your heels while keeping your arms straight and chest lowered.
3. Press your palms into the seat and maintain length through your spine.
4. Breathe deeply while holding the stretch.
Safety cue: Stack the shoulder over the forearm and keep hips lifted in a straight line

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and low impact cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Take a wide step to the side and bend the lead knee while pushing your hips back and keeping the other leg straight.
3. Drive through the lead foot to return upright and bring the trailing leg under your body.
4. Lift the trailing knee up in front of you and pause briefly to balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and eases upper back muscle tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Extend both arms forward at shoulder height with palms facing down.
3. Move hands in a smooth horizontal figure-eight path, crossing one hand over the other.
4. Keep core engaged and alternate which hand crosses on each loop.
Safety cue: Sit tall, draw the shoulder blades down, and breathe into the chest

Health benefit: Enhances lateral strength and balance through controlled single leg loading
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended.
2. Slide your hands under your lower back to feel the lumbar support.
3. Lift only your head and shoulders a few inches while keeping your spine stable.
4. Hold briefly, lower slowly, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and coordination through smooth circular movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Raise hands to chest level with palms facing each other and elbows slightly bent.
3. Clap your palms together sharply, then open your arms wide to shoulder height.
4. Continue clapping rhythmically while maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and move the arms through a controlled full range of motion

Health benefit: Builds core endurance while minimizing lumbar strain
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and soften your knees.
2. Hinge at the hips and slowly roll your spine forward one vertebra at a time.
3. Let your head and arms hang and keep your shoulders relaxed.
4. Tuck your chin and roll the spine up vertebra by vertebra to stand tall.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep a neutral spine as you lift from the chest

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and reduces shoulder tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Draw one knee toward your chest and hug it with both hands, then return it to the floor.
3. Repeat on the other side and continue alternating in a steady walking rhythm.
Safety cue: Retract the shoulder blades and keep the chest lifted during the claps

Health benefit: Enhances spinal flexibility and gently stretches posterior chain
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Slightly bend the standing knee and swing the free leg forward and backward like a pendulum.
3. Control the motion from the hips and keep your torso upright.
4. Switch legs and repeat the same swinging motion.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and roll down vertebra by vertebra with soft knees

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and coordination through controlled leg movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes turned slightly outward.
2. Brace your core and push your hips back as you bend your knees to lower into a squat.
3. Keep your chest lifted and knees tracking over your toes until thighs are parallel or comfortably lower.
4. Press through your heels to return to standing and squeeze your glutes at the top.
Safety cue: Engage the core and keep shoulders relaxed as you draw each knee to the chest

Health benefit: Increases joint mobility and encourages gentle momentum control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands resting at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the right while keeping your left foot planted.
3. Bring your right foot back to center and immediately step your left foot out to the left.
4. Continue alternating side steps at a brisk, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Control the swing with your core and avoid using momentum from the torso

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and adductors while improving hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and raise one arm to shoulder height.
2. Bring the raised arm across your chest and use the opposite hand to gently pull it closer to your torso.
3. Hold the stretch and then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes and maintain an upright chest

Health benefit: Improves coordination and elevates heart rate with minimal joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot with eyes open.
2. Lift the opposite foot a few inches off the floor and keep hips level.
3. Engage your core and fix your gaze on a point to maintain balance.
4. Lower the lifted foot back down and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Land softly with a slight bend in the knees to absorb impact

Health benefit: Increases shoulder range of motion and relieves posterior tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and bend your elbow to 90 degrees with your forearm against the wall.
2. Press the back of your hand outward into the wall without moving your elbow.
3. Hold the isometric contraction for the chosen time, then relax and switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder down and avoid twisting the torso as you pull across

Health benefit: Builds rotator cuff strength and supports shoulder stability during activities
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Step one foot to the side and shift your weight onto that foot.
3. Bring the other foot to meet the lead foot and lightly touch it.
4. Repeat the lateral steps back and forth, alternating the leading foot.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow tucked at your side and avoid shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and hip stability while challenging core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Keep your spine neutral and look straight ahead.
3. Gently tilt your right ear toward your right shoulder until you feel a mild stretch on the left side of your neck.
4. Hold for a comfortable count, return to center, and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes and keep hips level as you alternate legs

Health benefit: Improves lateral mobility and coordination with low impact cardiovascular engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one foot directly in front of the other, heel touching toe.
2. Keep your gaze forward and arms relaxed at your sides.
3. Take slow, controlled steps by placing each heel directly in front of the opposite toe while maintaining balance.
4. Continue forward for several steps, then turn and repeat leading with the other foot.
Safety cue: Keep a slight knee bend and lead each step with hips and chest facing forward

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and soft tissue flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Draw your shoulder blades straight back and down without shrugging.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blades together and hold the contraction for a brief count.
4. Release slowly and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep the spine long and gently guide the head with the opposite hand

Health benefit: Challenges dynamic balance and gait stability through narrow base walking
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms crossed over your chest.
2. Draw your navel toward your spine, press your lower back to the floor, and lift both knees to tabletop.
3. Slowly extend one leg toward the floor until it is just above the ground while keeping arms crossed and the other knee bent.
4. Return the extended leg to tabletop, then repeat the same controlled motion with the other leg.
Safety cue: Place each foot heel to toe and control each step with steady posture

Health benefit: Improves core stability and coordination while minimizing spinal loading
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs straight and feet flexed, and sit tall through the spine.
2. Hinge forward from your hips and reach your hands toward your feet while keeping the spine long.
3. Hold the position where you feel a stretch, relax your shoulders, and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move limbs slowly without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Activates anterior lower leg muscles and supports controlled gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall, place your hands lightly on it for support, and shift weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the other foot and press its sole against the standing leg's inner calf or inner thigh.
3. Engage your core, keep hips level, and maintain an upright chest while using the wall for balance.
4. Hold the stance steadily, then switch legs and repeat the same steps.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and hinge slightly from the hips as you press the heel down

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and lower back flexibility and promotes relaxed breathing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your mid and upper back against a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Interlace your fingers behind your head and draw your chin slightly toward your chest.
3. Anchor your lower ribs and gently press your upper back into the wall as you lift your chest and squeeze your shoulder blades.
4. Hold the lifted position briefly, then return to neutral and repeat.
Safety cue: Lengthen the spine on the inhale and hinge from the hips as you fold

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and ankle proprioception with wall assistance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your hips.
2. Take a wide step to the right and bend the right knee while keeping the left leg straight.
3. Push your hips back and keep your chest upright as you lower until the right thigh is parallel or comfortable.
4. Press through the right heel to return to center and repeat on the left side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves upper back mobility and encourages better thoracic posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift your right knee toward hip height while swinging the opposite arm naturally, then lower.
3. Alternate knees at a steady pace and maintain an upright posture.
Safety cue: Open through the chest and extend the upper spine while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place hands behind your head.
2. Hinge at the hips by pushing your butt back while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Lower your torso until it is near parallel to the floor or you feel a hamstring stretch.
4. Drive your hips forward and squeeze your glutes to return to standing.
Safety cue: Sit hips back and keep chest tall with knee aligned over the foot

Health benefit: Improves low impact cardiovascular fitness and hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with knees slightly apart and elbows bent by your sides.
2. Pull your shoulder blades together and squeeze your elbows toward each other.
3. Hold the squeeze briefly while keeping your neck neutral and chest slightly lifted.
4. Slowly relax your shoulder blades and return your elbows to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and engage core while landing softly on each foot

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Brace your core and extend one leg straight back until the hip aligns with the torso.
3. Keep your hips level and hold the extended position briefly.
4. Lower the leg back under your body and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and a soft knee bend

Health benefit: Enhances upper back muscle activation and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step or low bench with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Place your entire right foot on the step and press through the heel to lift your body up.
3. Bring your left foot up to meet the right without using your arms or swinging them.
4. Step down leading with the left foot then the right and repeat, switching the lead leg.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together without shrugging and keep the neck long

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and balance for functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and feet flat, then lean back and lift your feet off the floor while holding your shins.
2. Balance on your sit bones and keep a straight spine.
3. Rock backward slightly then forward to return to the starting balance.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel and keep torso upright while controlling the descent

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and chin level.
2. Slowly turn your head to the right until you feel a gentle stretch, then return to center.
3. Slowly turn your head to the left until you feel a gentle stretch, then return to center.
Safety cue: Stand tall and pull heel toward glute with knee pointing down and hips square

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and dynamic balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Position yourself for a wall sit by leaning your back against a wall and crossing your arms over your chest.
2. Slide down until your thighs are parallel to the floor and your knees sit above your ankles.
3. Engage your core and keep your weight through your heels while holding the position.
4. Maintain steady effort and press your feet into the floor for the desired duration.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral, brace your core, and rock slowly from the hips

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands on your hips.
2. Step your right foot diagonally forward and outward to form a wide V, then return it to center.
3. Repeat the movement on the left side in a controlled rhythm, keeping your torso upright.
Safety cue: Rotate slowly within a comfortable range and keep the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Builds isometric strength in quadriceps and improves lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Position yourself at a corner and place your forearms on each wall at about shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the corner until you feel a gentle stretch across the chest.
3. Keep your shoulders down and draw your shoulder blades slightly together to deepen the opener.
4. Hold the posture with steady balance for the chosen time.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and press weight into heels with knees tracking over ankles
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis

Health benefit: Improves chest mobility and posture through gentle anterior shoulder stretch
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Shrug both shoulders up toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Pull your shoulders down and back, moving the shoulder blades toward your hips.
4. Repeat the lift and slow depression with steady breaths.
Safety cue: Draw shoulder blades down and together while keeping the chest open and breathing steadily

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place forearms on the wall at shoulder height with elbows under shoulders.
2. Step back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels while keeping forearms pressed to the wall.
3. Squeeze your glutes and draw your ribs in to maintain a straight line.
4. Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Center weight over the standing foot with a soft knee and upright torso

Health benefit: Improves shoulder girdle control and neck muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees slightly bent, hips low, and arms held low near your hips.
2. Push off one foot and quickly step the trailing foot laterally to shuffle in the chosen direction.
3. Keep a low stance and maintain feet about shoulder-width apart during steps.
4. Continue shuffling for the set distance or time, then change direction.
Safety cue: Pull your shoulders down away from your ears while maintaining a long neck

Health benefit: Improves lateral movement speed and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite knee toward hip height.
3. Hold the lifted knee steady and keep an upright torso.
4. Lower the leg with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Stay low with hips back and chest up while shuffling with controlled quick steps

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation flexibility and reduces muscle tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and hands resting at your hips.
2. Engage your glutes and lower back and lift your chest and thighs a few inches off the ground.
3. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your shoulder blades together while holding the lift.
4. Lower back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor endurance and core stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and weight evenly distributed.
2. Rise up onto both toes by lifting your heels as high as comfortable.
3. Lower your heels back down slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the pelvis level and core engaged to prevent leaning or rotating the torso

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves spinal extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift weight onto the balls of your feet and keep a soft knee.
3. Quickly march in place with small steps, keeping contact with the floor.
4. Maintain a steady rhythm and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place hands on your thighs.
2. Inhale and arch your spine, lift your chest, and tilt your pelvis forward.
3. Exhale and round your spine, tuck your chin, and tilt your pelvis backward.
4. Move smoothly between the two positions with steady breaths.
Safety cue: Press evenly through both feet and keep a tall spine

Health benefit: Improves quickness and foot coordination with low impact cardiovascular engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Bring one knee toward your chest and clasp it with both hands behind the shin.
3. Pull the knee gently toward your chest and breathe deeply.
Safety cue: Stay light on your toes and keep a soft knee bend

Health benefit: Gently stretches lower back and gluteal muscles while promoting relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to a wall with your elbow bent 90 and upper arm against your side.
2. Place the inside of your forearm against the wall at waist height.
3. Press the forearm inward into the wall using shoulder rotation and hold the contraction.
4. Release the pressure and relax your arm.
Safety cue: Keep lower back grounded and draw knees toward chest with control

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and posterior chain strength with support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Lower into a shallow squat by pushing hips back and bending knees.
3. Pulse up and down in small movements while staying low and controlled.
4. Keep chest up and weight through your heels.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and tap support lightly for balance

Health benefit: Builds shoulder internal rotator endurance and improves neuromuscular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Bend the free knee and curl your heel toward your glutes.
3. Squeeze the back of the thigh at the top of the movement.
4. Lower the foot under control and keep the standing knee soft.
Safety cue: Anchor the elbow at your side and press inward without letting the shoulder lift

Health benefit: Increases lower body muscular endurance and maintains squat position stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head to the right bringing your ear toward the right shoulder and keep the left shoulder down.
3. Hold, return to center, and repeat on the left side.
Safety cue: Keep knees tracking over toes and pulse from the hips without collapsing the chest

Health benefit: Increases lateral neck flexibility and reduces muscle tension around the neck
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and extend arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height with palms down.
2. Keep elbows soft and make small controlled forward circles from the shoulders.
3. Reverse the direction and make small controlled backward circles.
4. Maintain a steady pace and keep your torso still.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and gently tilt from the neck without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and improves core and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and fingertips lightly supporting the base of your skull.
2. Exhale and curl your shoulders off the floor by drawing the ribs toward the hips.
3. Pause briefly at the top without pulling on the neck, then inhale and lower with control.
4. Repeat for desired reps while keeping the chin slightly tucked.
Safety cue: Root the standing foot and engage the core to keep the hips level

Health benefit: Strengthens abdominal muscles and supports trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Step your right foot wide to the right.
3. Cross your left foot behind the right and step the right foot wide again.
4. Cross your left foot in front of the right and bring both feet together.
Safety cue: Tuck chin slightly and lift using the core rather than pulling with the neck

Health benefit: Increases lower body muscular endurance and quadriceps activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands on your thighs.
2. Pull your shoulder blades straight back toward the spine without lifting the shoulders.
3. Squeeze gently, hold briefly, and then relax to the starting position.
Safety cue: Press your low back into the wall and keep knees aligned over ankles

Health benefit: Promotes light cardiovascular activity and improves gait rhythm
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and spine neutral.
2. Tilt your head toward your right shoulder while keeping the chin level and not rotating the head.
3. Hold briefly, return to center, and repeat toward the left shoulder.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright spine and lift knees with slow, controlled marches

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back muscles and improves posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Keep your gaze forward and your eyes open.
3. Distribute weight evenly and engage your core.
4. Hold the position without stepping.
Safety cue: Retract and depress the shoulder blades while keeping the chest open

Health benefit: Increases lateral neck flexibility and eases muscle tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart and hands placed on the wall at waist level.
2. Press your palms into the wall as if trying to move it without allowing your body to shift.
3. Keep your elbows slightly bent and your core engaged.
4. Maintain steady pressure for the chosen duration.
Safety cue: Keep the chin level and bend the neck slowly within a comfortable range

Health benefit: Challenges static balance and improves proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands resting on your hips.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while shifting your weight onto that foot.
3. Bring your left foot to tap next to your right foot without crossing or lifting your hands.
4. Repeat the movement to the opposite side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Place feet heel-to-toe and maintain an upright posture over the midline

Health benefit: Engages chest and shoulder stabilizers while promoting upper body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders toward your ears, then draw them back and down.
3. Continue the motion by rolling the shoulders in a smooth backward circle.
4. Breathe steadily and repeat the rolls for several controlled repetitions.
Safety cue: Brace the core and press evenly through the palms without shrugging shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances lateral lower body coordination and light calorie expenditure
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in an open doorway and place forearms on the door frame at low (elbow) height.
2. Step one foot forward and keep your torso upright to create a gentle chest stretch.
3. Breathe evenly and allow the chest to open while keeping shoulders down.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch the leading foot or step back to release.
Safety cue: Keep knees slightly bent and land softly through the midfoot

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable counter and place one hand lightly on it for balance.
2. Shift weight onto the supporting foot and lift the other foot off the floor, bending the knee slightly.
3. Keep your spine tall and core engaged, hold briefly, then lower the lifted foot back down.
Safety cue: Roll shoulders slowly with scapular control and avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and promotes hip extension activation
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and tilt the pelvis slightly, lifting the chest and tailbone a few inches.
3. Exhale and draw the belly slightly toward the spine, rounding the upper back a few inches and tucking the chin.
4. Alternate slowly through a small range with controlled breaths.
Safety cue: Drive through the heels and maintain a neutral pelvis without overextending the lower back

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite foot to rest on the inner calf or ankle.
3. Keep the standing knee soft and lengthen the spine while focusing on a fixed point.
4. Hold for the desired time, then lower the foot and switch sides.
Safety cue: Move with the breath and control each small spinal segment through the range

Health benefit: Enhances core coordination and lower trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and chin level.
2. Slowly drop the chin toward the chest and gently rotate the head in a smooth circle to one side.
3. Complete slow, controlled circles for the set number, then reverse direction.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves balance and lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands at sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side while bending both knees slightly and keep arms at your sides.
3. Step your right foot back to center and immediately step your left foot out to the side in the same manner.
4. Continue alternating sides at a steady, controlled, low-impact pace.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and take slow narrow steps with an upright posture

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Place hands on your hips and draw your bellybutton gently toward your spine.
3. Tilt your pelvis under to flatten the lower back while keeping the upper body relaxed.
4. Release to a neutral pelvis and repeat the controlled tilting motion.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades and lift the chest while avoiding excess lower back arch

Health benefit: Helps improve pelvic control and lower back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your left foot.
2. Bend your right knee and place the sole of your right foot low against your left inner calf or ankle, avoiding the knee.
3. Bring your hands to prayer at your chest or rest them on your hips for balance.
4. Hold the position with a steady breath, then lower your right foot and switch sides.
Safety cue: Tuck the tailbone and flatten the lower back while keeping ribs relaxed

Health benefit: Teaches safe sit to stand mechanics and leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the back heel on the floor and toes pointing forward.
3. Bend the front knee and press hips forward until you feel a stretch in the back calf.
4. Hold, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Sit back into the chair by pushing hips back and keep knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and place forearms on the floor with elbows under shoulders.
2. Walk feet back and lift hips so your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
4. Hold and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Circle wrists slowly with controlled motion and soft elbows

Health benefit: Increases calf muscle flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift one knee toward a comfortable height while swinging the opposite arm forward.
3. Lower the leg and repeat on the other side in a controlled marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Press the back heel down and keep the spine long

Health benefit: Raises heart rate gently and strengthens hip flexors
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with big toes touching and knees hip-width apart.
2. Sit back toward your heels and fold your torso forward over your thighs.
3. Reach both arms back along your sides toward your heels with palms facing up.
4. Lower your forehead to the mat and relax your neck and shoulders.
Safety cue: Lift knees with control, keep hips level and avoid leaning back

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and spinal rotation range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall beside a stable surface and place one hand lightly on it.
2. Shift your weight onto one foot and engage the standing leg.
3. Bend the free knee and lift the foot toward your butt while keeping hips square.
4. Keep an upright torso and use your hand on the surface for light support.
Safety cue: Rotate from the upper spine with hips grounded and spine tall

Health benefit: Stretches the back and shoulders while encouraging gentle relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side in a straight line with your head supported by your lower arm.
2. Stack your hips and place your top hand on the floor in front for balance.
3. Keep the top leg straight and lift it upward without rotating your hips.
4. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Sink hips toward your heels while lengthening the spine and breathing deeply

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Take a slow lateral step to the right, pushing off with your left foot.
3. Bring your left foot to meet your right while staying low and balanced.
4. Repeat the movement to the left in a controlled, smooth motion.
Safety cue: Stand tall, engage your core, and keep the supporting knee slightly soft

Health benefit: Improves lateral movement control and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Bend your torso slowly to the right while sliding your right hand down the right thigh.
3. Return to center and repeat the bend to the left with shoulders level.
Safety cue: Keep chest up, hips level, and take controlled lateral steps

Health benefit: Increases lateral trunk flexibility and side body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both heels off the ground slowly, rising onto the balls of your feet.
3. Lower your heels back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged as you hinge laterally

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and start stepping forward at a brisk walking pace.
2. Lift one heel toward your glutes as you step and keep the knee pointing down.
3. Swing the opposite arm naturally and land on the ball of the foot.
4. Alternate legs smoothly and maintain light, quick steps.
Safety cue: Maintain a level pelvis and extend the leg slowly without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle plantarflexion strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and place hands on your hips.
2. Shift your weight slightly and push your hips forward.
3. Rotate your hips in a smooth circular motion clockwise with control.
4. Reverse the rotation by circling your hips counterclockwise with the same control.
Safety cue: Rise through the balls of your feet with knees soft and control the descent

Health benefit: Improves hip joint mobility and movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one supporting leg.
2. Lift the free leg and extend it toward a chosen clock position with toes pointed.
3. Reach the leg outward while keeping your torso upright and pause briefly.
4. Return the leg under control and repeat for other clock positions or switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move the hips smoothly without forcing the range

Health benefit: Increases groin flexibility and inner thigh range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms at your sides.
2. Exhale and draw your belly button gently toward your spine without tilting the pelvis.
3. Hold the hollow for 5-10 seconds while breathing normally, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and hinge from the hips to lean forward gently

Health benefit: Improves deep core activation and spinal support awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides and feet hip-width apart.
2. Exhale and press your shoulders down toward your hips, pulling the shoulder blades away from your ears without bending the elbows.
3. Hold the depressed position for 3-5 seconds, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a low wall or countertop and place the palm of the arm to be stretched on the surface with the fingers pointing backward.
2. Straighten the elbow slightly and keep the shoulder down and back.
3. Rotate your torso away from the arm until you feel a gentle stretch along the biceps and front of the shoulder.
4. Hold for 20-30 seconds while breathing steadily, then release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged throughout the pattern

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways next to a doorframe with your elbow bent to 90 and your upper arm against your ribcage.
2. Place your forearm or palm against the frame at waist or chest height and keep your shoulder down.
3. Attempt to rotate your forearm inward toward your stomach without moving your elbow, pressing into the frame.
4. Hold steady pressure, maintain tension, then release.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move slowly to maintain balance

Health benefit: Builds external rotator strength to enhance shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart and hands placed flat on the wall at chest height.
2. Tuck your elbows close to your sides and straighten your body from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows and lean your chest toward the wall until elbows are at about 45.
4. Push through your hands to return to the start while keeping elbows tucked and body straight.
Safety cue: Keep your elbow pinned to your side and rotate from the shoulder with control

Health benefit: Builds core endurance while reducing joint stress compared with standard plank
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together, knees soft, and hands resting lightly at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the side and bring your left foot to touch next to it without swinging your arms.
3. Repeat to the left, keeping movements controlled and your hands stationary at your sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to knees and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Increases lower body circulation and gently raises heart rate
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and keep your arms fixed by your sides.
2. Lift your right knee up toward shoulder height while keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower the right foot and immediately lift the left knee to the same height.
4. Continue alternating knees in a steady marching rhythm while keeping arms still.
Safety cue: Stand tall, engage your core, and lift each knee with control

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and promotes balance through wider base stepping
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place both hands firmly on your hips.
2. Bend your knees slightly and lower into a light athletic stance.
3. Push off with your left foot and shuffle quickly laterally to the right using small steps.
4. Reverse direction and shuffle to the left while maintaining the low stance and hands on hips.
Safety cue: Keep your chest up and hips level while stepping wide with deliberate control

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and builds lower body muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and soften your knees into a slight bend.
2. Lift your right knee a few inches toward your chest, then tap the right foot back down gently.
3. Repeat the same low knee lift several times, then switch and repeat on the left side.
Safety cue: Stay low with hips back, chest forward, and shuffle with quick controlled steps

Health benefit: Improves knee joint mobility and increases blood circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Lift your right knee and reach your left elbow across your body toward the knee.
3. Return to neutral and repeat on the opposite side in a controlled marching pattern.
4. Keep a steady pace and avoid bouncing.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral as you lift each knee

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring activation and elevates heart rate moderately
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Step forward a short distance and lower your front knee slightly into a shallow bend.
3. Push through the front foot to return to standing and alternate legs.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and land softly on each stride

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and promotes gentle joint lubrication
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your right side with knees bent and left arm extended in front of you at chest level.
2. Keep your hips stable and slowly sweep the left arm up and back, rotating your upper spine.
3. Pause where you feel a gentle opening in the chest, then reverse the motion to return to start.
4. Repeat the movement and switch sides.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips and control the swing without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and relieves muscular stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Arch your back, drop your belly, and lift your chest and tailbone.
3. Round your spine, draw your belly toward your spine, and tuck your chin and tailbone.
4. Move slowly between the two positions for each rep.
Safety cue: Rotate slowly with a slight chin tuck and avoid forcing the range

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms at your sides.
2. Tilt your pelvis posteriorly, flattening your lower back into the floor and drawing your belly toward your spine.
3. Release to a neutral spine and repeat with slow, controlled motions.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and initiate rotation from the upper back not the lower spine

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and joint awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift your shoulders slightly toward your ears, then actively pull your shoulders down away from your ears by depressing the shoulder blades.
3. Hold the depressed position for two to three seconds while keeping your neck long.
4. Release and repeat with slow, controlled repetitions.
Safety cue: Rotate the foot slowly from the ankle with controlled motion and keep the shin stable

Health benefit: Promotes posterior shoulder flexibility and improves range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearms on the doorframe with elbows slightly below shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your torso through the doorway until you feel a stretch across the lower chest.
3. Keep your spine neutral and draw your shoulder blades down and back.
4. Maintain the position and breathe steadily for the desired time.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout
