Health benefit: Stretches the back and shoulders while promoting relaxation and breathing control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your left foot.
2. Bend your right knee and reach back with your right hand to grasp your right ankle.
3. Pull your heel gently toward your glute while keeping knees close together.
4. Keep your torso upright and hold the stretch for the chosen duration.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips, reach the arms back, and lengthen the spine while breathing smoothly

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and supports balanced lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright and bring the soles of your feet together with knees dropped out to the sides.
2. Grip your feet or ankles and draw them toward your pelvis.
3. Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips until you feel a stretch in the inner thighs.
4. Keep a straight back and breathe steadily while holding the position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with your forehead on the floor and hands under your shoulders.
2. Press your pelvis into the floor and lift your chest using your lower back with elbows slightly bent.
3. Draw your shoulder blades down and keep your neck neutral.
4. Lower slowly back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Keep back heel down and spine long

Health benefit: Improves forearm flexibility and wrist mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Keep your hips level and arms relaxed at your sides or extended for balance.
3. Fix your gaze on a steady point and maintain even breathing.
4. Return to a shoulder-width stance and repeat with the opposite foot forward.
Safety cue: Extend arm and gently pull fingers back while keeping wrist aligned with forearm

Health benefit: Builds single leg stability and hip strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift your weight backward onto your heels and lift your toes off the floor.
3. Shift your weight forward onto your toes and lift your heels off the floor.
4. Continue rocking slowly and with control for several repetitions.
Safety cue: Root standing foot, place sole on inner calf not the knee, and square the hips

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and forward weight transfer coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Keep a neutral spine and engage your core.
3. Extend one leg straight back to hip level while keeping hips square.
4. Hold briefly with controlled breathing, then lower the leg with control.
Safety cue: Rock smoothly from heel to toe keeping weight centered over the midfoot and spine neutral

Health benefit: Develops dynamic single leg control and reach awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at sides.
2. Lift one knee slowly toward your chest while keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower that foot with control and immediately lift the opposite knee.
4. Continue alternating knees in a steady, deliberate pace.
Safety cue: Keep your chest lifted and control the leg movement from the hip

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps endurance and lower body muscular stamina
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and chin level.
2. Gently tilt your right ear toward your right shoulder until you feel a light stretch.
3. Return to center and repeat the tilt to the left in the same controlled manner.
Safety cue: Drive through your heels and press your lower back into the wall

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor mobility and controlled cardiovascular effort
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm straight in front of you at shoulder height with the palm facing up.
2. Use your other hand to gently pull the fingers and palm back toward you until you feel a stretch in the forearm.
3. Keep the elbow straight and avoid twisting the wrist.
4. Release and repeat on the opposite arm.
Safety cue: Land softly and maintain upright posture with your core engaged

Health benefit: Increases lateral neck mobility and muscular awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Cross your arms over your chest and relax your shoulders.
3. Distribute your weight evenly and engage your core to maintain balance.
4. Switch which foot is in front and repeat.
Safety cue: Move slowly with relaxed shoulders while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Refines balance and postural control in narrow base of support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms crossed over your chest.
2. Step sideways to the right with your right foot while keeping your torso upright.
3. Bring your left foot to meet your right foot while maintaining the arm cross.
4. Repeat the side steps in the opposite direction with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Stack hips over shoulders and breathe steadily to stay balanced

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway with feet hip-width apart.
2. Raise your arms to shoulder height and place your forearms on the door frame.
3. Step one foot forward and gently lean through the doorway to open the chest.
4. Keep shoulders down and hold the stretch while breathing evenly.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced as you step laterally

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot.
2. Let your arms hang relaxed by your sides and lift the other foot a few inches off the ground.
3. Focus on a fixed point and maintain steady breathing to hold your balance.
Safety cue: Control the circular motion from the hips and keep the spine neutral

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step or stair with hands on your hips.
2. Step up onto the platform with one foot, driving through the heel.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to meet the lead foot on the step.
4. Step back down with the same foot and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft and hips level while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and hamstrings while promoting pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms loose at your sides.
2. Rotate your torso to the right, letting your arms swing naturally.
3. Return to center in a controlled motion.
4. Rotate your torso to the left with the same controlled movement.
Safety cue: Press through the heels, lift with the glutes and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and eases posterior leg tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms crossed over your chest.
2. Brace your core and press your lower back gently toward the floor.
3. Slowly lower one foot toward the floor while keeping the opposite knee bent.
4. Return that foot to start and repeat the motion with the other leg.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and breathe into the stretch

Health benefit: Develops core control and improves coordinated limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Inhale and lift your shoulders straight up toward your ears.
3. Hold briefly at the top.
4. Exhale and lower your shoulders back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back pressed to the floor and move limbs slowly with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and gentle lower leg activation
Steps to perform:
1. Extend your right arm forward at shoulder height with elbow straight and palm facing down.
2. Use your left hand to gently bend the right wrist so the fingers point down toward your forearm.
3. Keep the elbow straight and feel a stretch across the top of the forearm.
4. Release slowly and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine tall while controlling each heel dig

Health benefit: Strengthens upper trapezius and relieves neck tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Step forward placing the heel of the front foot directly in front of the toes of the back foot.
3. Continue walking in a straight line heel-to-toe while keeping arms down and gaze forward.
4. Move slowly and control each step to maintain balance.
Safety cue: Lift and lower shoulders with slow control while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and reduces forearm muscle tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and hands resting by your hips.
2. Squeeze your glutes and lift your chest off the floor while keeping hands by your hips and neck neutral.
3. Lower with control and prepare for the next repetition.
Safety cue: Extend the arm and gently pull back the fingers to create a controlled stretch

Health benefit: Improves balance and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands at your hips.
2. Step your right foot out to the side and gently shift weight onto it.
3. Step your left foot out to meet the right, landing softly.
4. Step both feet back together by reversing the movement and repeat, alternating the leading foot.
Safety cue: Take slow controlled steps with hips level and a steady gaze
is_not_suitable_for: Sarcopenia, Depression / Anxiety, Cognitive Decline / Dementia

Health benefit: Enhances spinal extension capacity and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel facing a sturdy chair and place forearms on the seat with elbows under shoulders.
2. Inhale and arch your back, drop your belly, and lift your chest and tailbone.
3. Exhale and round your spine, tuck your tailbone, and drop your head toward your chest.
4. Continue to alternate the two positions slowly with each breath.
Safety cue: Lift the chest using controlled spinal extension while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your left foot.
2. Bend your right knee and place the sole of your right foot on your inner left calf or thigh, not on the knee.
3. Bring your palms together at the center of your chest in a prayer position.
4. Fix a steady gaze and hold the pose, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Move through flexion and extension slowly while keeping forearms steady on the chair

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and knee joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes turned out, hands on hips.
2. Push hips back and bend knees to lower into a squat until thighs are near parallel to the floor.
3. Keep chest lifted, knees tracking over toes, and weight in your heels.
4. Drive through heels to return to standing and squeeze glutes at the top.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep knees aligned, and pull the heel toward the glute with control

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands on hips.
2. Step diagonally forward and outward with your right foot to form one leg of a V.
3. Step the right foot back to center, then repeat the same diagonal step with your left foot.
4. Keep your chest upright and place each step softly on the midfoot.
Safety cue: Balance on one foot with hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and lower body balance
Steps to perform:
1. Face a wall and place both palms flat on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back with the heel down and the back knee straight while bending the front knee slightly.
3. Lean into the wall until you feel a calf stretch, hold briefly, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hips level as you step

Health benefit: Enhances balance and gait stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and place hands on your waist.
2. Drive one knee upward toward your waist while keeping your spine upright.
3. Lower that foot back to the floor and repeat on the other side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Rock slowly and keep weight centered over the foot

Health benefit: Boosts hip flexor strength and walking mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with knees together or slightly apart and place your arms by your sides.
2. Sit back toward your heels and fold forward from the hips.
3. Rest your forehead on the floor and relax your shoulders while holding the position.
Safety cue: Engage your core and lift the knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Challenges single leg balance and proprioception control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and place hands on your hips.
2. Push off with one foot and take a quick lateral step to the side.
3. Bring the other foot to meet it and continue shuffling side to side in a low athletic stance.
Safety cue: Stand tall with a soft supporting knee and focus on a fixed point

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Place your hands on your hips and inhale to prepare.
3. Exhale and tuck your tailbone under to flatten your lower back.
4. Hold briefly, then inhale and return your pelvis to a neutral position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift the top leg with controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and hip coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Inhale and prepare your posture with a tall spine.
3. Exhale and bend your torso to the right, sliding your right hand down your right thigh.
4. Inhale and return to center, then repeat the same movement to the left.
Safety cue: Keep hips low, chest lifted, and step with control

Health benefit: Increases lateral trunk flexibility and side body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Position feet hip-width apart with toes pointing forward.
3. Rise onto the balls of your feet by lifting your heels as high as comfortable.
4. Pause briefly at the top, then lower your heels slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and bend from the waist with a long spine

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and ankle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Pull one knee toward your chest and wrap your hands around the shin.
3. Hold briefly, then release and switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Rise through the balls of the feet with ankles aligned and spine tall

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring mobility and light cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms resting at your sides.
2. Engage your core and lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the floor while keeping your lower back pressed to the ground.
3. Hold the hollow position with steady breathing, then lower back down.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and pull the heel toward the glute with controlled cadence

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and lower body agility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and a neutral spine.
2. Tilt your head backward to look up toward the ceiling while lifting your chin slightly.
3. Hold the position for a few breaths, then return your head to a neutral position.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and step with control keeping hips level

Health benefit: Increases neck extension range and supports head alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Place forearms on the floor shoulder-width apart with elbows under shoulders.
2. Tuck toes and lift hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze your core and glutes and keep your neck neutral.
4. Breathe evenly and hold the position for the desired time.
Safety cue: Keep the spine neutral and extend the neck slowly without forcing the movement

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and improves shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in an athletic stance with knees slightly bent and feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Push off one foot and shuffle quickly sideways for several steps while staying low.
3. Reverse direction by driving off the opposite foot and continue shuffling back.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades and lift with control while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rhythmic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and spine neutral.
2. Drop your chin to your chest and slowly roll your head toward your right shoulder, then backward and toward your left shoulder in a smooth arc.
3. Repeat the circles in the opposite direction for balanced mobility.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture and lift knees with controlled hip flexion and steady breathing

Health benefit: Promotes neck mobility and gentle muscular relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both legs extended on the floor.
2. Bend one knee and clasp your hands behind the thigh or calf.
3. Straighten the bent leg by gently pulling it toward you with the foot flexed.
4. Hold the position, then lower the leg slowly and switch sides.
Safety cue: Move the neck slowly in a controlled circle while keeping the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and releases upper back tension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with forearm on the floor and elbow under your shoulder.
2. Stack your feet and press your forearm into the floor to lift your hips.
3. Keep your body in a straight line and hold with core engaged.
4. Lower your hips with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and roll shoulders in slow controlled circles

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and promotes hip extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the opposite foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Keep an upright posture and a steady gaze while balancing.
4. Lower the lifted foot with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep lower back grounded and hinge from the hip to stretch the hamstring

Health benefit: Strengthens glute muscles and supports hip extension during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shoulders relaxed.
2. Lift your right knee toward hip level while swinging your left arm forward and land softly.
3. Alternate knees and arms in a steady marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Drive through the heels and squeeze glutes at the top while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Improves core stability and coordination with controlled limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees soft.
2. Step your right foot to the side and bring your left foot to touch beside it while slightly bending both knees.
3. Repeat to the left in a rhythmic side-to-side motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and joint lubrication
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your right forearm against the doorframe with elbow at shoulder height.
2. Step forward with your left foot until you feel a gentle stretch across the front of your right shoulder and chest.
3. Hold the stretch for 20 to 30 seconds while breathing steadily.
4. Switch sides and repeat with the left forearm against the frame.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move the hips in slow controlled circles

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and postural stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and weight evenly distributed.
2. Rise onto the balls of your feet by lifting both heels as high as possible.
3. Pause and squeeze your calf muscles at the top.
4. Lower your heels slowly back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances balance and core engagement while promoting body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Pull your shoulder blades together and down without shrugging.
3. Hold the squeeze briefly then relax back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Ground the standing foot, engage your core, and keep hips level with hands at heart

Health benefit: Boosts lateral coordination and lower body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat, hands on your knees, and shoulders relaxed.
2. Arch your lower back, lift your chest, and look slightly upward.
3. Round your spine, tuck your chin, and draw your navel toward your spine.
4. Move slowly between extension and flexion, coordinating with your breath.
Safety cue: Step in a controlled V pattern keeping hips level and hands on hips for stability

Health benefit: Enhances groin and inner thigh flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Heel-to-Toe Walk: Stand tall with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Fix your gaze on a point ahead and keep your shoulders relaxed.
3. Take slow, controlled steps, placing each heel directly in front of the opposite toes.
4. Continue walking in a straight line with steady, even steps.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge from the hips while gently pressing knees toward the floor

Health benefit: Develops single-leg balance and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Superman (Arms Back): Lie face down with legs straight and arms extended backward alongside your hips.
2. Engage your glutes and lift your chest, arms, and legs a few inches off the floor.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and hold the raised position.
4. Lower with control back to the floor.
Safety cue: Balance on one leg with a soft knee and hips level

Health benefit: Improves walking stability and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Static Lunge (Shallow): Stand tall and step one foot slightly back into a small staggered stance.
2. Bend both knees just enough that the front knee tracks over the ankle without dropping deep.
3. Keep your torso upright and hips square while holding the shallow lunge.
4. Press through the front heel to return to standing or switch legs to repeat.
Safety cue: Step heel to toe with eyes forward and core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and spinal extensor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross your arms over your chest and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Exhale and lift your shoulders toward your knees using your abdominal muscles.
4. Inhale and lower your shoulders back down with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Lift chest and legs using glutes while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Targets abdominal endurance and trunk flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Begin marching quickly in place, lifting your knees to mid-height.
3. Pump your arms briskly and land on the balls of your feet.
4. Maintain a steady, quick pace and keep your torso upright.
Safety cue: Exhale as you curl using your abs and keep the lower back grounded

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and forehead resting on the floor.
2. Place your hands lightly by your hips with palms down.
3. Squeeze your glutes and shoulder blades and lift your chest and hands slightly off the ground.
4. Hold briefly with a long neck and then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft, hips level, and maintain a steady gaze for balance

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and dynamic balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs straight and stacked.
2. Rest your head on your lower arm and keep hips stacked.
3. Lift the top leg up to hip height with control.
4. Lower the leg slowly without touching the bottom leg.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the rocking motion from your core

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and upper back muscles to support posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step or platform.
2. Place one foot fully on the step and shift your weight onto that leg.
3. Push through the front foot to lift your body until the stepping leg is straight.
4. Step back down with control and repeat leading with the same leg.
Safety cue: Retract the shoulder blades to lift the chest and avoid overarching the lower back
Physical limitation: Knee pain (general / chronic) | Limited single-leg balance

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and functional stair climbing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended.
2. Bend one knee and draw it toward your chest using both hands.
3. Hold briefly, then lower the leg back to the start and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and promotes spinal flexion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms resting alongside your body.
2. Tighten your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the ground while keeping arms by your sides.
4. Hold the hollow position and breathe steadily for the desired time.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and lead the movement from your chest

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Draw your chin gently toward your chest without lifting your head off the floor.
3. Hold the tuck briefly, then relax and repeat with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens deep neck flexors and promotes better head and neck alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms extended in front at chest height.
2. Step one foot out to the side while sweeping your arms out and apart.
3. Step the other foot out to meet it while clapping or touching your palms in front of your chest.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the start and continue alternating at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Gently tuck your chin and lengthen the back of the neck without lifting the head

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular endurance and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shoulders relaxed.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Draw shoulder blades down and back and open the chest by reaching arms slightly out to the sides.
4. Hold the balance, keep a steady gaze, then lower the lifted foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Move with control and land softly while keeping your chest lifted and hips stable

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet a few inches away.
2. Place arms against the wall with elbows bent and palms facing forward in a W position.
3. Slide your arms upward along the wall to extend overhead while keeping contact with the wall.
4. Lower your arms back to the starting position and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves coordination and encourages upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Clasp your hands behind your back with palms together or fingers interlaced.
3. Straighten your arms and gently lift your hands away from your lower back while drawing shoulder blades together.
4. Hold the chest opener briefly, then release the clasp and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep tall posture and squeeze shoulder blades as you lift each knee

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and encourages gentle movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other, heel touching toe.
2. Square hips forward and draw shoulders back and down.
3. Hold a slight bend in the knees and engage your core to maintain balance.
4. Keep your gaze forward and breathe steadily while holding the position.
Safety cue: Coordinate slow breaths with spinal flexion and extension, moving with control

Health benefit: Enhances balance and reinforces proper shoulder alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step up with your right foot and press through the heel to lift your body.
3. Bring the left foot up to meet the right and stand tall with shoulders back.
4. Step down under control and repeat leading with the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders, lift the chest and keep shoulders down and back

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and strengthens posterior chain stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shoulders relaxed back.
2. Jog in place while driving each heel up toward the glutes.
3. Keep your torso upright, engage your core, and pump your arms lightly.
4. Maintain a quick, controlled rhythm and land softly on each foot.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine mobility and rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and eyes forward.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the opposite foot so the toes hover or touch the inner calf.
3. Retract and depress your shoulder blades by squeezing them gently down and together.
4. Hold the stance while balancing, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and promotes thoracic extension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Step laterally to the right with your right foot and bring your left foot to meet it while keeping arms open.
3. Step laterally to the left and bring your right foot to meet it in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back lightly on the floor and move arms slowly

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and supports hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and place your right hand on the back of your head.
2. Rotate your head slightly to the right and tilt your chin down toward your chest and left armpit.
3. Apply gentle pressure with your hand to increase the stretch along the back and side of the neck.
4. Hold the stretch, then repeat the steps on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Drive through your heels and lift by squeezing the glutes while keeping ribs down

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and light aerobic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and head up.
2. Place the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other foot.
3. Walk forward slowly in a straight line, placing heel to toe with each step.
4. Keep your gaze forward and continue for the desired distance.
Safety cue: Step with control and maintain an upright posture with core engaged

Health benefit: Relieves neck tension and increases upper neck mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and down as if pinching a pencil.
3. Hold the contraction without shrugging for the chosen time.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and tuck the chin slightly to lengthen the side of the neck

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioception during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands at hips or by your sides.
2. Lift one knee slowly toward your hip to approximately waist height while keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower that foot and lift the opposite knee in a controlled, alternating march.
4. Maintain a tall posture without leaning forward or crunching and continue at a slow steady tempo.
Safety cue: Keep head up, shoulders relaxed, and take controlled heel-to-toe steps

Health benefit: Improves scapular stability and shoulder posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Place your right hand behind your head and rotate your chest to bring your right elbow toward the ceiling while keeping hips square.
3. Return your right elbow down toward the supporting hand and rotate back to center.
4. Repeat for desired reps then switch sides.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades together without shrugging and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and soften your knees.
2. Shift weight onto your right foot and step your left foot diagonally behind and across while swinging your arms to follow the motion.
3. Push through the supporting foot to return to center and shift weight onto the opposite foot.
4. Continue alternating sides with controlled, low-impact steps.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and lower back endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat, spine neutral, and shoulders relaxed.
2. Gently draw your chin straight back, keeping the head level and creating a gentle double chin.
3. Hold briefly, then relax and repeat for desired reps.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and latissimus flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and place hands slightly behind hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press into your hands and heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Keep shoulders down and squeeze your glutes to maintain the straight line.
4. Lower your hips back down with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down, reach through the arm and avoid shrugging the shoulder toward the ear

Health benefit: Engages posterior chain and improves core and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and extend both arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Rotate both arms backward in small, controlled circles using the shoulders.
3. Maintain steady breathing and continue the backward circles for the chosen count or time.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and low impact aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright with shoulders relaxed and back straight.
2. Place one hand on the collarbone or shoulder to stabilize that side.
3. Tilt your head away from the stabilized shoulder and slightly rotate the chin upward until you feel a gentle stretch along the side of the neck.
4. Hold the stretch, then slowly return your head to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral while stepping with soft knees

Health benefit: Increases neck flexibility and relieves muscular tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart and hands placed on the wall wider than shoulder-width.
2. Step back slightly and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows outward and lower your chest toward the wall until elbows reach about 90 degrees.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and gently guide your head without forcing the stretch

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and raise both arms overhead.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite knee up to hip height.
3. Simultaneously pull your arms down and back beside your ribs while squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Lower the lifted knee and raise your arms back overhead in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves core activation and coordination between upper and lower body
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with big toes touching and knees hip-width apart.
2. Sit back on your heels and hinge forward at the hips, reaching both arms straight ahead on the floor.
3. Rest your forehead on the floor and actively lengthen your spine by reaching through your fingertips.
Safety cue: Brace your core and exhale as you lift the knee while controlling the arm pull

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle trunk rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands under shoulders and knees under hips with a neutral spine.
2. Brace your core and slowly lift both knees a few inches off the ground.
3. Keep hips level and shoulders stable while holding the hover.
4. Breathe steadily and lower the knees back to the mat to rest.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from your thoracic spine while keeping both hips grounded

Health benefit: Builds core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms extended out wide at shoulder height.
2. Step your right foot out diagonally to the right and open your arms wider into a V.
3. Return your right foot to center, then step your left foot out and repeat the arm motion.
4. Continue alternating steps in a controlled, rhythmic pattern.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and light cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your right foot.
2. Bend your left knee and grab it with both hands, pulling it toward your chest.
3. Squeeze the standing leg and engage your core to maintain balance.
4. Hold for the desired time, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and step deliberately with arms wide for balance

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on a stable counter and step feet back into a straight line.
2. Brace your core and keep your body straight from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the counter until elbows are about 90 degrees.
4. Push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the start.
Safety cue: Stand tall with ribs down and sweep arms slowly to maintain shoulder control

Health benefit: Improves static balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Step your right foot to the side and lightly touch your left foot beside it.
3. Step your left foot to the side and lightly touch your right foot beside it, keeping a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Stack heel to toe with hips level and gaze forward for balance

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and light cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a sturdy chair or wall and place one hand on it for light support.
2. Shift your weight into the standing leg and lift the other foot slightly off the ground with a soft knee.
3. Hold the position while keeping hips level and breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Step deliberately with soft knees and an upright chest

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and improves postural control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Place your hands behind your head and keep elbows wide.
3. Rotate your torso to the right while keeping your hips facing forward.
4. Return to center, rotate to the left, and repeat in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips aligned with shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and boosts lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Clasp your hands behind your back and straighten your arms gently.
3. Lift your hands slightly and pull your shoulders back to open the chest.
4. Hold briefly, release, and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep weight in your heels and knees tracking over ankles

Health benefit: Opens chest and increases shoulder extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy box or step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step onto the box with your right foot and press through the heel to lift your body.
3. Bring your left foot onto the box and stand tall with hips extended.
4. Step down carefully one foot at a time and repeat leading with the other leg.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep your neck long

Health benefit: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and calf muscle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. March in place, bringing one heel gently toward your glutes with controlled motion.
3. Alternate legs at a steady, low-impact pace and swing your arms naturally for balance.
4. Maintain an upright torso and soft knees throughout.
Safety cue: Keep back leg straight with heel down and maintain a tall posture

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and supports pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and back straight.
2. Slowly turn your chin to one shoulder until you feel a gentle stretch.
3. Rotate back through center and turn to the other shoulder with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift with control avoiding torso rotation

Health benefit: Enhances cervical range of motion and relieves neck tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor hip-width apart, and arms by your sides.
2. Lift your head and shoulders slightly off the floor to engage your core.
3. Extend one leg a few inches off the ground and lightly tap the heel to the floor beside your other foot.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled rhythm while keeping your lower back pressed into the floor.
Safety cue: Rotate head slowly within comfort keeping shoulders down and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic core stability and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, lead foot slightly forward, and hands up by your cheeks.
2. Shift weight to the back foot and snap the lead hand straight out in a quick jab.
3. Rotate the lead knuckles at the end of the jab and keep your other hand guarding.
4. Retract the jab to guard and repeat with controlled foot and hip movement.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move slowly to control each rocking motion

Health benefit: Improves hip extension strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a doorway and place your forearm or palm low on the doorframe near waist height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean gently through the doorway until you feel a stretch across the lower chest.
3. Keep your torso upright and square while maintaining the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and extend the leg with slow, controlled motion

Health benefit: Boosts upper body muscular endurance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one supporting foot.
2. Place the other foots toes on the floor with the heel resting against the inner calf or ankle.
3. Bring your palms to your chest or overhead and hold with steady balance.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin, rotate through the torso and snap each jab with a controlled exhale

Health benefit: Improves pelvic mobility and lower back control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and hands placed behind hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Press into your palms and lift hips a few inches off the floor while keeping shoulders down.
3. Bend elbows to lower hips toward the floor until elbows are approximately 90 degrees.
4. Push through palms to extend elbows and lift hips back to the starting raised position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and reduces forearm tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands held low at your sides.
2. Step your right foot outward into a slight squat while sweeping both hands outward low.
3. Step feet together and return hands to the sides; repeat by stepping left on the next rep.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic spine mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
2. Lean back slightly to engage the core and clasp hands together in front of the chest.
3. Rotate the torso to the right and touch the floor beside the right hip with your hands.
4. Rotate back through center to the left and touch the floor beside the left hip; repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the upper back

Health benefit: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Extend one leg straight forward with the foot flexed and toes pointing up.
3. Hinge at the hips and reach both hands toward the extended toes while keeping the back flat.
4. Step forward and repeat the movement with the opposite leg, alternating as you walk.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips to avoid rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned outward.
2. Keep your chest lifted and core engaged.
3. Bend your knees and lower your hips straight down until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
4. Press through your heels to return to standing.
Safety cue: Shift slowly from heel to toe with controlled movement and upright posture

Health benefit: Improves rotational core stability and oblique activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Cross one arm in front of the other, alternating which arm crosses on top.
3. Open your arms wide back to the sides to the starting position.
4. Continue crossing and opening your arms smoothly and rhythmically.
Safety cue: Brace the core and rotate from the ribs while keeping the feet grounded

Health benefit: Builds hip mobility and inner thigh strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and turn your right foot 90 degrees and left foot slightly inward.
2. Bend your right knee until the thigh is parallel to the floor and keep the left leg straight.
3. Extend both arms parallel to the floor at shoulder height and look over your right fingertips.
4. Press through both feet, keep the torso upright, and hold the pose while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Push knees out over toes and keep weight in the heels with a straight spine

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your chest slightly and sweep arms out to the sides and then down toward your hips.
3. Simultaneously lift your legs a few inches and pulse them toward each other.
4. Lower arms and legs to the start and repeat with smooth, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Move the arms with control and keep shoulders down away from the ears

Health benefit: Enhances multi joint mobility and movement integration
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Shift weight to the left foot and step or lightly hop to the right, landing softly.
3. Shift weight to the right foot and step or lightly hop to the left, landing softly.
4. Keep knees bent slightly and use your arms for balance as you continue side to side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move slowly through each reach and rotation

Health benefit: Improves shoulder blade mobility and thoracic spine extension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with a straight spine.
2. Cross your right arm under your left at the elbows and wrap your forearms so your palms touch.
3. Lift your elbows and draw them forward while reaching your fingertips away from your face.
4. Keep your shoulders down and hold the position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place your right foot directly behind your left with the heel touching the left toes.
2. Look over your left shoulder and engage your core.
3. Shift weight onto the front foot and step the back foot straight backward, placing its heel behind the toes of the other foot.
4. Continue taking small, controlled backward steps while maintaining balance.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Improves upper back mobility and shoulder girdle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands behind your head.
2. Drive your right knee up toward your chest while squeezing your core, then return the foot to the floor.
3. Repeat by driving your left knee up and continue alternating at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Pull shoulders down away from ears and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioceptive control during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stack your shoulders.
2. Extend the top arm toward the ceiling and rest the bottom hand on the ground for support.
3. Rotate your thoracic spine and sweep the top arm across your body toward the floor behind you while following with your eyes.
4. Reverse the movement to return the arm to the ceiling with control.
Safety cue: Take slow controlled backward steps and keep the torso upright

Health benefit: Builds core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the ground and extend the other leg straight out to the side with the foot flexed.
2. Reach the arm on the kneeling side up and lengthen through the opposite side body.
3. Hinge at the hip and lean the torso toward the extended leg while keeping the spine long.
4. Return upright and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core with shoulders over wrists

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexor activation and dynamic leg coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg while keeping a slight bend in the knee and fingertips lightly touching the floor for balance.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower your torso while extending the non-weight leg straight back until your torso and raised leg form a straight line.
3. Drive through the standing heel to return to upright and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and drive the knee with controlled hip flexion

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation and scapular mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the bottom leg straight and the top leg bent in front for balance.
2. Lift the bottom leg upward using your inner thigh until you feel the muscle engage.
3. Pause briefly at the top and lower the leg slowly with control.
4. Complete the set, then switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate from the thoracic spine and keep the hips stacked

Health benefit: Improves hip opening and lower body stability in single leg stance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with hands guarding your chin and elbows tucked.
2. Rotate your hips and shoulders, pivot the foot, and drive a horizontal hook toward mid-chest.
3. Retract the arm quickly back to guard and reset your stance.
4. Alternate hooks from each side in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Safety cue: Lengthen the spine and hinge from the hips with the supporting knee soft

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with arms extended in front at shoulder height and elbows slightly bent.
2. Create a smooth wave with each wrist by flexing, ulnar deviating, extending, and radial deviating in sequence.
3. Perform the motion slowly for several repetitions to produce a continuous wave.
4. Switch emphasis to the other wrist or perform alternating waves with both hands.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thigh muscles and improves medial hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and keep knees soft.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward, letting your arms hang toward the floor.
3. Hold opposite elbows and let your head and neck relax.
4. Slightly bend the knees and gently sway or lengthen the spine.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and perform slow controlled lifts without twisting the torso

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out to a T and forehead on the surface.
2. Bend one knee and lift that foot toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate the lifted leg across the body, aiming the foot toward the opposite hand.
4. Keep hips down and slowly return the leg before switching sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and reach through the lifted leg while maintaining a tall spine

Health benefit: Improves lateral core activation and hip rotational mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and imagine a clock around you.
2. Step shallowly to 12 o'clock into a partial lunge with a small bend in both knees.
3. Push through the front foot to return to center and repeat shallow steps to 3, 6, and 9 o'clock.
4. Maintain an upright torso and control each shallow lunge.
Safety cue: Drive the movement from the hips, keep chest up and maintain soft knees

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Get into a high plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Step your right foot out to the right, then bring it back to center.
3. Step your left foot out to the left, then bring it back to center.
4. Continue alternating controlled steps while keeping your core engaged.
Safety cue: Anchor the pelvis and rotate the leg with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and upper back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hold your hands near your hips as if gripping rope handles.
2. Rotate your wrists forward and begin small hops on the balls of your feet.
3. Keep elbows close to your sides and maintain a steady, rhythmic motion.
4. Land softly and continue alternating wrist rotations and hops.
Safety cue: Lift the chest and draw the shoulder blades together to maintain alignment

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and shift your weight onto your left foot.
2. Cross your right thigh over the left and hook your right foot behind the left calf or ankle.
3. Bend the standing knee and use the wall or fingertips for balance as needed.
4. Square your hips and hold the leg wrap while maintaining an upright torso.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and core engaged

Health benefit: Increases thoracic spine mobility and shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees softly bent.
2. Step right with your right foot and shift weight onto it.
3. Cross your left foot behind the right, then step right again.
4. Repeat slowly with rhythmic arm swing, then change lead side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and hip external rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to a T and legs straight.
2. Lift your right leg and slowly lower it across your body toward the left while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Return the right leg to center and repeat on the left side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, squeeze knees together, and maintain an upright spine

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with your right knee down and extend your left leg forward with the heel on the floor and toes up.
2. Square your hips forward and keep your spine long.
3. Hinge at the hips and shift back until you feel a stretch in the back of the left leg.
4. Hold briefly, return to kneeling, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and step your right foot back about three feet.
2. Turn the back foot out slightly and bend the front knee until it stacks above the ankle.
3. Square your hips toward the front and raise both arms overhead with palms facing each other.
4. Press evenly through both feet and lengthen the spine.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso, rotate hips and shoulders together, and step with control

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and chest mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and point toes slightly outward.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the knees to lower your torso while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Reach your hands toward mid-shin and keep your back flat.
4. Drive through the heels and extend the hips to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders anchored to the floor and move arms with slow controlled range of motion

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and enhances standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with one foot slightly off the ground and the knee bent.
2. Rotate the sole of the foot inward in a slow, controlled motion (inversion).
3. Rotate the sole of the foot outward in a slow, controlled motion (eversion).
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops hip strength and improves squat and hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and turn the front foot forward and the back foot slightly in.
2. Extend both arms out at shoulder height and square your hips toward the front.
3. Reach the front arm forward, hinge at the hip, and lower the front hand to the shin or ankle while lifting the top arm.
4. Press through both feet, straighten the legs, and gaze up toward the top hand.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg.
2. Hinge forward at the hips and lift the opposite leg back until your torso and lifted leg form a T.
3. Place one or both fingertips on the standing thigh or the floor for light support.
4. Keep the standing leg slightly bent and maintain a long spine as you balance.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and core braced as you punch upward

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Step into a staggered stance with one foot forward and the other foot back on the toes.
2. Lower straight down by bending both knees until the front thigh is about parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the bottom position with your torso upright and weight centered over the front foot.
Safety cue: Move the ankle slowly with control and keep the foot aligned under the shin

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push hips back and lower into a deep squat while keeping your chest upright.
3. Place palms on the ground or press elbows into inner knees for support.
4. Hold the position and breathe evenly while keeping weight through the heels.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft and hinge from the hips with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your left foot.
2. Lift your right foot and cross the right ankle over the left thigh above the knee.
3. Bend the standing knee and sit back slightly while keeping your chest up.
4. Hold the stretch and place hands on hips or the standing thigh for balance.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee tracking over the toes and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves running coordination and hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your left foot.
2. Lift your right knee to your chest and wrap both arms around the shin.
3. Hold balance and keep the standing knee slightly bent.
Safety cue: Maintain tall posture, drive the knee up, and control each landing

Health benefit: Promotes hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Jump feet out wider than hips while swinging arms out and up to clap in front of your chest.
3. Jump feet back together while opening arms to your sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft and chest lifted while hinging from the hips

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and hip flexor engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips and place your hands on the floor in front of your feet.
3. Walk your hands forward until your body forms a straight high plank.
4. Walk your hands back toward your feet, lift your chest, and return to standing.
Safety cue: Engage the core and maintain a straight spine while balancing on one leg

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes pointing forward.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward, reaching your hands toward the floor or shins while keeping a long spine.
3. Relax your neck and shoulders, then engage your core and roll up to standing.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbow and lift hips into a straight line from knees to shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and full body dynamic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways about an arm's length from a wall and place the nearest hand on it at shoulder height.
2. Shift weight onto the front foot and lift the back leg straight out while rotating your torso upward.
3. Extend the free arm toward the ceiling and keep the gaze on that hand.
4. Hold the position briefly, then lower the raised leg and arm to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and core engaged throughout the movement

Health benefit: Builds core engagement while improving hamstring flexibility and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with knees slightly bent and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step laterally to the right into a wide stance while keeping a low center of gravity.
3. Pull your elbows back and squeeze your shoulder blades together as if performing a row.
4. Step the left foot to meet the right and repeat the movement to the left.
Safety cue: Hinge from your hips and maintain a braced core with a flat back

Health benefit: Improves balance and lateral stability while strengthening glutes and obliques
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms by your sides with palms facing up.
2. Bend the elbows and curl the hands toward the shoulders to activate the biceps.
3. Tap your right heel outward away from the body and return it to the floor while holding the curl.
4. Repeat the curl and then tap the left heel outward in a controlled, alternating rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases heart rate while engaging upper back muscles.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and soft knees.
2. Bring hands up near your chin with elbows close to your ribs.
3. Rotate your torso and extend your right fist across the body toward the left.
4. Retract the hand to guard and repeat the punch on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep chest up; do not shrug shoulders.

Health benefit: Improves hip coordination and burns calories gently.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on your hips.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips with a soft standing knee.
3. Extend your right leg straight back low to the floor, keeping the foot flexed.
4. Return the foot under your body and repeat on the left leg.
Safety cue: Land softly on balls of feet.

Health benefit: Coordinates upper and lower body movement.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands at chest level.
2. Lift your right knee to a comfortable height while rotating your torso left.
3. Lower the right foot and lift your left knee while rotating your torso right.
4. Continue alternating knees and gentle twists at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep elbows pinned to ribs.

Health benefit: Engages oblique muscles and elevates heart rate.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Shift weight to the right foot and slide the left foot slightly toward the right.
3. Return to center, then shift weight to the left and slide the right foot slightly toward the left.
4. Continue alternating with a soft knee bend and steady tempo.
Safety cue: Pivot the foot to protect the knee.

Health benefit: Activates hamstrings without impact.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees soft.
2. Lift the right foot and tap the toe a short distance in front, keeping the heel off the ground.
3. Return the right foot and immediately lift the left foot to tap forward.
4. Repeat alternating taps at a controlled, rhythmic pace.
Safety cue: Keep knees pointing down, not forward.

Health benefit: Mobilizes the thoracic spine during cardio.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a light staggered stance with hands up near your face.
2. Throw small, rhythmic punches with alternating hands, keeping elbows close to the body.
3. Relax the wrists and snap the punches quickly to mimic a speed bag rhythm.
4. Keep light foot movement and maintain a fast, controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Twist from ribs, not the lower back.

Health benefit: Very low intensity movement for blood flow.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at sides.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite knee to just below hip height.
3. Lower the knee back down and repeat on the other side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep knees soft, never locked.

Health benefit: Low impact ankle mobilization and cardio.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and knees slightly soft.
2. Step sideways with one foot, keeping your torso upright and hips level.
3. Bring the other foot to meet the lead foot without bending deeply at the hips.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso.

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and core.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and gaze forward.
2. Take a small controlled step forward with one foot and bring the other foot to meet it.
3. Take a small controlled step backward with the same foot and bring the other foot to meet it.
4. Continue alternating forward and backward small steps with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Avoid rounding the back.

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors gently.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart with knees soft.
2. Shift weight onto your right leg and hinge slightly at the hips.
3. Reach your left hand down along the left outer thigh toward the ankle.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep toes pointing forward.

Health benefit: Corrects posture while walking in place.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and cross your arms at chest level.
2. Step your right foot out to the right about shoulder-width.
3. Tap your left foot next to the right without shifting full weight.
4. Step your left foot back to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together.

Health benefit: Improves spatial awareness and agility.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees soft.
2. Step diagonally forward to the right with your right foot.
3. Step diagonally forward to the left with your left foot to form a zig-zag.
4. Continue alternating diagonals while maintaining a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Look ahead, not at feet.

Health benefit: Stretches lateral line and works core.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand hip-width with knees slightly bent and arms relaxed.
2. Hinge forward and reach your right hand toward the floor while shifting weight onto your left leg.
3. Step your right foot forward a short distance and bring your left hand toward the floor.
4. Continue alternating hands and feet in a smooth crawling rhythm.
Safety cue: Avoid arching the lower back.

Health benefit: Basic rhythmic movement for warm-up.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and weight evenly distributed.
2. Shift weight onto your left leg and lift your right foot, flexing the ankle so the heel points forward.
3. Extend the right leg slightly forward to present the heel while keeping hips square.
4. Lower the right foot and repeat on the left side, alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Keep weight in the heels.

Health benefit: Challenges multidirectional hip stability.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and knees soft, clasp hands at chest.
2. Rotate your torso to the right from the waist while keeping feet planted and hips stable.
3. Return to center and rotate to the left, repeating at a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep hips facing forward.

Health benefit: Engages cross-body coordination brain/body.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and reach both arms straight overhead.
2. Engage your lats and bend elbows to pull hands down toward your shoulders while squeezing shoulder blades.
3. Pause briefly at the bottom with elbows by your sides.
4. Slowly extend arms back overhead to the starting position.
Safety cue: Focus on stability over speed.

Health benefit: Safe mobilization for knees and hips.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands on hips or out for balance.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the opposite leg sideways with a slight bend in the raised knee.
3. Lightly tap the ground with the outside of the foot while keeping the torso upright.
4. Return the foot to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee soft.

Health benefit: Activates rotators without torque on knees.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet staggered, knees soft, and hands guarding near the chin.
2. Rotate your torso and drive one fist upward in a rising arc toward an imaginary target.
3. Retract the fist quickly back to the guard while returning your torso to center.
4. Alternate sides in a slow, controlled rhythm while keeping elbows tucked.
Safety cue: Lift heel to protect knee joint.

Health benefit: Works outer hips minimally.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest and reach your left hand toward the right knee.
3. Crunch your torso to try to touch the left hand to the right knee.
4. Lower and repeat on the other side, alternating sides each rep.
Safety cue: Keep hips level.

Health benefit: Tones arms and core.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Step quickly to the right with your right foot.
3. Bring your left foot to meet your right foot, then step to the left with your left foot.
4. Continue stepping side to side with a steady, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Don't punch yourself; control stop.

Health benefit: Full body cardiovascular engagement.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands at chest height.
2. Step forward with your right foot into a lunge and lower until the front knee is bent.
3. Extend both arms forward at chest height and press your palms away from your body.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Opposing arm and leg move together.

Health benefit: Core flexion without lying down.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift your weight quickly onto your right foot while pushing hips to the right.
3. Explosively shift your weight to the left while pushing hips to the left.
4. Continue alternating sides at a fast, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Don't pull on the neck.

Health benefit: Lateral agility and coordination.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift weight onto the balls of your feet and lift heels back to tap together behind you.
3. Land softly with knees bent and maintain a low posture.
4. Repeat the heel taps at a steady, low intensity.
Safety cue: Stay light on feet.

Health benefit: Pushing strength and lunging mechanics.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, knees soft, and hands by your chin.
2. Rotate your torso to the right and extend your left fist forward in a punch.
3. Roll your hips and shoulders through the punch and retract the fist to your chin.
4. Repeat the roll and punch sequence on the opposite side in a smooth rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep core braced.

Health benefit: Dynamic adductor/inner thigh work.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands at your sides.
2. Jump or step the feet outward to about shoulder-width.
3. Land softly with knees slightly bent.
4. Jump or step the feet back together with control.
Safety cue: Push hips back, don't bend fwd.

Health benefit: Inner thigh activation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on hips or at your sides.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and step the other foot backward to lightly tap the toes on the floor.
3. Squeeze the rear glute and keep your torso upright.
4. Return the foot to start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep knees straight but not locked.

Health benefit: Continuous upper body cardio.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and bend your elbows slightly as if running.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest while reaching the opposite elbow toward the lifted knee.
3. Lower and switch sides, lifting the other knee and reaching with the opposite arm.
4. Continue alternating in a controlled, marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep elbows active, not drooping.

Health benefit: Cardio without overhead arm impact.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift weight onto the balls of both feet and prepare to rotate.
3. Pivot slowly on the balls of your feet, rotating your torso and hips together.
4. Reverse the pivot with control to return to the start and repeat in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Keep upper body still.

Health benefit: Glute activation and balance.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips facing forward.
3. Lean your torso slowly to one side, sliding the ribcage toward the hip without moving your feet.
4. Return to center with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Don't arch lower back.

Health benefit: Spatial orientation and hip rotation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hinge slightly at the hips with a flat back.
2. Bend your elbows slightly and let your arms hang toward the floor.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms out to the sides until they reach shoulder level.
4. Lower your arms slowly with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift heels to pivot safely.

Health benefit: Lateral spine mobility.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step forward with your right foot about two to three feet.
3. Bend both knees until the front thigh is parallel to the floor and the back knee hovers above the floor.
4. Push through the front heel to return to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Imagine sliding between two panes of glass.

Health benefit: Calf strengthening and cardio.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands behind your head.
2. Lift your right knee toward your right elbow while bringing the right elbow down toward the hip.
3. Lower to the start position and repeat on the left side.
Safety cue: Maintain posture, look forward.

Health benefit: Upper back endurance.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees soft.
2. Step your right foot diagonally forward-right and tap the left foot beside it while reaching your left hand toward the right foot.
3. Return to center and repeat the movement to the opposite diagonal.
Safety cue: Do not flare ribs.

Health benefit: Leg strength and deceleration.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a boxing stance with feet shoulder-width, knees slightly bent, and hands up by your cheeks.
2. Rotate your lead hip and pivot the lead foot while driving your elbow horizontally to throw a lead hook.
3. Return hands to guard, rotate your rear hip and pivot the rear foot to throw a rear hook.
4. Keep a light bounce and controlled rhythm as you alternate hooks.
Safety cue: Do not let knee pass toe.

Health benefit: Oblique strength.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees soft, and squeeze your glutes.
2. Step forward with one foot while keeping the glutes squeezed and pelvis neutral.
3. Continue walking forward one step at a time while maintaining constant glute contraction.
Safety cue: Don't pull neck forward.

Health benefit: Multi-planar movement.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and bring your elbows in close to your sides.
2. Brace your core and rotate your torso to the right while keeping elbows tucked in.
3. Rotate back through center and twist to the left with elbows remaining tight to the ribs.
4. Control each twist and maintain steady breathing as you repeat.
Safety cue: Keep core engaged.

Health benefit: Core rotation and power.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and bend your knees slightly.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other to tap the ground just outside the standing foot.
3. Step back to the wide stance and prepare the opposite side.
4. Alternate taps side to side in a controlled, rhythmic motion.
Safety cue: Pivot the foot with the punch.

Health benefit: Mental connection to glutes.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and extend arms straight in front at shoulder height.
2. Pull your hands apart by squeezing your shoulder blades and opening the arms wide.
3. Slowly bring the hands back together with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Torso stays vertical.

Health benefit: Core rotation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Step the other foot forward and tap the heel lightly on the floor without leaning forward.
3. Shift back onto the front foot and step the opposite foot back, tapping the toe behind you.
4. Continue alternating forward and back taps in a smooth, low-impact rhythm.
Safety cue: Move hips and shoulders together.

Health benefit: Hip adductor/abductor agility.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift your right knee toward your right elbow while twisting your torso and bringing the right elbow down.
3. Lower the leg with control and return to standing.
4. Repeat on the left side or continue the same-side pattern for desired reps.
Safety cue: Keep knees slightly bent.

Health benefit: Rear deltoid activation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Step forward with your right foot and reach both hands down to tap the top of the right foot.
3. Push back to standing and repeat with the left foot or continue alternating.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down.

Health benefit: Coordination and fun cardio.
Steps to perform:
