1. Stand in a slight quarter squat with knees soft and weight centered.
2. Take a tiny quick step to the right with your right foot, then bring your left foot to meet it.
3. Shuffle the same small steps to the left while keeping a low stance.
4. Continue alternating directions with light, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep kicks low.

Health benefit: Ipsilateral core work.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms extended sideways at shoulder height.
2. Keep a slight bend in the elbows and open the arms wide.
3. Bring the arms forward in a wide arc until the fingertips meet in front of your chest.
4. Reverse the motion slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Balance on standing leg first.

Health benefit: Lateral agility.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and arms open wide at chest height.
2. Swing the right arm across your chest and wrap the left arm over it to mimic a hug.
3. Open the arms back out wide with control.
4. Repeat alternating which arm crosses on top each rep.
Safety cue: Don't cross feet.

Health benefit: Chest activation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and arms extended out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Rotate your torso to the right while keeping hips facing forward and let the arms swing with the motion.
3. Rotate to the left in the same controlled manner and continue alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Slight bend in elbows.

Health benefit: Cognitive and footwork challenge.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders straight up toward your ears in a smooth shrug.
3. Roll the right shoulder back and down while keeping the left shoulder elevated.
4. Roll the left shoulder back and down while lifting the right, and continue alternating slowly.
Safety cue: Say "Out, Out, In, In" to rhythm.

Health benefit: Opens chest and stretches upper back.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and extend both arms straight out at chest level.
2. Swing both arms outward horizontally to open the chest.
3. Bring arms together crossing the right arm over the left in front of the chest like scissors.
4. Reverse the motion quickly, crossing the left over the right, and repeat with control.
Safety cue: Don't fling arms back violently.

Health benefit: Loosens stiffness in the spine.
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with chin neutral and eyes facing forward.
2. Gently turn your head to the right as if saying "no," then return to center.
3. Slowly nod your head forward and back as if saying "yes," keeping movements small and controlled.
Safety cue: Lift heel to protect knees.

Health benefit: Releases upper trap tension.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place your fingertips lightly on your thighs.
2. Tilt your pelvis forward, lift your chest, and slide your hands upward on your thighs to arch your lower back.
3. Tuck your pelvis, round your upper back, and slide your hands downward toward your knees.
4. Flow smoothly between the two positions with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Keep neck long.

Health benefit: Warms up chest and rear delts.
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright and extend one arm forward at shoulder height with the palm facing down.
2. Bend the wrist to point the fingers toward the floor, then lift the wrist to point the fingers toward the ceiling in a controlled motion.
3. Repeat the flexion and extension for several repetitions, then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep core tight.

Health benefit: Improves cervical rotation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart and raise both arms so elbows bend at about 90 and palms face down.
2. Keep your upper arms steady and move your forearms in large circular motions at the elbows.
3. Continue the circles for several repetitions, then reverse the direction.
Safety cue: Move only within comfort range.

Health benefit: Mobilizes lumbar and thoracic spine.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Swing your right arm across your chest toward the left hip while rotating your torso slightly.
3. Sweep the right arm up and overhead toward the left side, reaching as far as comfortable.
4. Continue the motion fluidly for several repetitions, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Move slowly and breathe.

Health benefit: Prepares wrists for loading/movement.
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright with elbows bent at 90 degrees and upper arms parallel to the floor.
2. Pull your shoulder blades down and back to stabilize your shoulders.
3. Open your chest and pulse your forearms slightly outward a few inches.
4. Keep movements small and controlled for the desired count.
Safety cue: Don't force the stretch.

Health benefit: Lubricates elbow joint.
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank or kneeling plank with hands under shoulders and body in a straight line.
2. Allow your chest to sink slightly then push the ground away to round the upper back and protract the shoulder blades.
3. Reach your hands forward by pushing the shoulders apart while keeping the arms straight.
4. Return to a neutral scapular position and repeat for the set number of reps.
Safety cue: Isolate movement to elbows.

Health benefit: Stretches posterior shoulder.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Raise your right arm overhead and bend the elbow to bring your hand toward your upper back.
3. Press through your triceps to extend the arm back overhead while slightly reaching across your head.
4. Lower the arm and repeat on the left side, alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder down.

Health benefit: Opens tight pecs/shoulders.
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms extended in front at shoulder height and palms facing down.
2. Clench both fists tightly and hold for a brief count while keeping the wrists neutral.
3. Open your hands wide, spread the fingers and extend the palms, then cycle the clench and release smoothly.
Safety cue: Keep ribs tucked in.

Health benefit: Mobilizes shoulder blades.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Reach your right arm overhead and lean laterally to the left, sliding the left hand down your left thigh if desired.
3. Return to center with control and reach your left arm overhead, leaning to the right.
4. Continue alternating sides in a steady, fluid rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep elbows straight.

Health benefit: Stretches triceps and lats.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms extended forward at chest height.
2. Sweep the right arm diagonally down and out while the left arm moves up and in, tracing the first loop of a figure-8.
3. Reverse the paths so each arm traces the opposite loop smoothly and continuously.
4. Continue alternating loops in a controlled rhythm for the desired duration.
Safety cue: Don't arch back.

Health benefit: Increases blood flow to hands.
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Tilt your right ear slowly toward your right shoulder with controlled movement.
3. Roll your chin down toward your chest and then tilt your left ear toward your left shoulder.
4. Move smoothly between sides in a slow, continuous flow for desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep wrists neutral.

Health benefit: Opens side body/intercostals.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and elbows bent at your sides to form a "W" shape.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and press your elbows slightly back to hold the W.
3. Extend your arms upward and slightly outward to form a "Y" with palms facing each other.
4. Return to the W and repeat the W-to-Y transition in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep hips steady.

Health benefit: Rotational shoulder mobility.
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbows bent at 90 and forearms parallel to the floor.
2. Rotate palms upward slowly until fully supinated.
3. Rotate palms downward slowly until fully pronated.
4. Alternate between supination and pronation in a smooth, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Smooth, fluid motion.

Health benefit: Stretches lateral neck muscles.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Tuck the pelvis and roll the spine forward one vertebra at a time.
3. Continue the wave upward through the chest and neck until upright.
4. Reverse the sequence by initiating the wave from the head back down to the pelvis.
Safety cue: Do not lift shoulder to ear.

Health benefit: Activates lower traps.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bring palms together at chest in prayer position.
2. Press palms firmly together and engage the chest and shoulders.
3. Release the squeeze and gently separate the hands while maintaining posture.
Safety cue: Squeeze blades in W.

Health benefit: Mobilizes radioulnar joints.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width, bend elbows to about 90, and keep hands near your shoulders.
2. Open elbows wide to the sides while retracting your shoulder blades.
3. Close elbows toward the front of your chest, keeping upper arms parallel to the floor.
4. Repeat the open-and-close motion in a controlled, rhythmic tempo.
Safety cue: Keep elbows at sides.

Health benefit: Full spine articulation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and extend arms out to the sides at shoulder height with a soft bend at the elbows.
2. Sweep both arms forward in a wide arc and let the hands meet or cross in front of the chest.
3. Open the arms back out to shoulder height along the same arc.
4. Maintain the soft elbow bend and move in a smooth, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Move sequentially.

Health benefit: Stretches wrist flexors.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and lift your right arm overhead while keeping the left hand near your chest.
2. Rotate your torso to the right and thread the right arm down and under the left arm toward the left hip.
3. Reverse the motion to return upright and repeat the same sequence on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep palms touching.

Health benefit: Shoulder rotation mobility.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Raise your right arm straight forward to shoulder height with a controlled motion.
3. Lower your right arm slowly as you raise your left arm to shoulder height.
4. Continue alternating arms in a steady, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Full range of motion.

Health benefit: Chest opening without load.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Elevate your shoulders up toward your ears in a smooth motion.
3. Pull your shoulder blades back and down, continuing the movement in a circular path.
4. Complete the circle by bringing the shoulders forward and repeat in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Focus on the stretch back.

Health benefit: Thoracic rotation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shift weight onto your left leg.
2. Swing your right leg forward a small, controlled distance with a soft knee.
3. Swing your right leg backward a small, controlled distance using hip motion.
4. Repeat for several swings, then switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Follow hand with eyes.

Health benefit: Shoulder flexion mobility.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your left leg.
2. Bend your right knee slightly and swing the right leg across in front of you in a low, controlled motion.
3. Swing the right leg out to the right side keeping your hips square and your toes pointing forward.
4. Repeat for the chosen reps, then switch legs and repeat the sequence.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down.

Health benefit: Scapular control/mobility.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Jog in place and drive your heels up toward your glutes while keeping your knees pointing down.
3. Keep a quick, light tempo and swing your arms naturally for the desired duration.
Safety cue: Isolate the shoulder blade.

Health benefit: Loosens hip flexors/hamstrings.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hug your right knee to your chest and balance briefly on your left leg.
3. Step your right foot back into a low lunge, lowering your hips and keeping your torso upright.
4. Push through the left heel to return to standing, then repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Don't arch back on backswing.

Health benefit: Loosens adductors/abductors.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on hips for balance.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest with a straight back.
3. Open the right knee outward to the side, keeping the torso upright.
4. Return the foot down and repeat on the left side, alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Avoid twisting the planted knee.

Health benefit: Dynamically stretches quads.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Position feet hip-width and press through the balls of both feet to lift your heels.
3. Lower your heels slightly below neutral and then lift them back up in a quick rhythm.
4. Keep knees soft and maintain a steady, controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Keep knees pointing down.

Health benefit: Hip mobility and balance.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto your left foot.
2. Keep the left heel planted and roll the sole outward so the foots outer edge bears weight (inversion).
3. Roll the sole inward so the foots inner edge bears weight (eversion).
4. Move slowly with control for repetitions, then switch to the other foot.
Safety cue: Step back carefully.

Health benefit: Hip rotation mobility.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and extend the other leg straight forward with toes pointed.
3. Sweep the extended foot lightly across the floor in an arc, keeping toes close to the ground.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other leg, alternating sides in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep hips square forward.

Health benefit: Stretches calves/achilles.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and extend arms straight in front at shoulder height.
2. Keep the kicking leg straight but not locked and lift it forward to a low height.
3. Lower the leg under control and switch to the other leg while keeping the torso upright.
4. Continue alternating low kicks at a steady, controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Keep back leg straight.

Health benefit: Mobilizes ankle joint.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place hands behind your head or elbows out.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while rotating your torso to bring your left side toward the knee.
3. Lower the right leg and return to center.
4. Lift the left knee while rotating to the right and continue alternating twists in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Gentle movement only.

Health benefit: Hamstring stretch.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet wider than hip-width and hands clasped at chest.
2. Shift weight to the right leg and bend the right knee while pushing hips back into a side lunge.
3. Drive through the right foot to return to center and straighten the right leg.
4. Repeat the same lunge to the left in a smooth alternating motion.
Safety cue: Keep back flat.

Health benefit: Active hamstring stretch.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto your left leg.
2. Bend your right knee and reach your right hand back to grasp your ankle, pulling the heel toward the glute while keeping chest slightly forward.
3. Release the ankle and swing the right leg forward to return to standing, then switch sides in a continuous rhythm.
Safety cue: Only kick to comfort height.

Health benefit: Core and hip integration.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and place hands behind your head or across your chest.
2. Hinge at the hips and push your hips back with a slight knee bend, keeping your back flat until your torso is near parallel to the ground.
3. Squeeze your glutes and drive your hips forward to lift your torso back to standing.
4. Repeat the hip-hinge movement in a controlled, rhythmic manner.
Safety cue: Don't pull head.

Health benefit: Groin stretch.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out.
2. Drop into a high squat until thighs form about a 45-degree angle.
3. Pulse by moving up and down a few inches with controlled small motions.
4. Keep chest lifted and knees tracking over toes while repeating pulses.
Safety cue: Keep heels down.

Health benefit: Stretches front thigh.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step forward placing the heel down first, then roll to the toes.
2. Place each step directly in front of the previous foot along an imaginary straight line.
3. Keep hips level and arms relaxed for balance.
4. Continue heel-toe walking for the chosen distance with steady, controlled steps.
Safety cue: Use wall if unbalanced.

Health benefit: Strengthens/stretches posterior chain.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a stable support and place the outside of one ankle on the opposite thigh above the knee.
2. Sink your hips back into a shallow squat on the standing leg while keeping that knee soft.
3. Hinge slightly forward from the hips to increase the stretch while holding the support as needed.
4. Return upright, repeat dynamically for the set, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Soft bend in knees.

Health benefit: Hip opening.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Bend one knee slightly and lift it to about hip height.
3. Move the lifted knee in slow controlled circular motions.
4. Repeat the circles in the opposite direction and switch legs.
Safety cue: Knees track over toes.

Health benefit: Balance training.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a small step forward with one foot.
2. Lower into a shallow lunge by bending both knees while keeping your torso upright.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg and extend your arms out in front as you twist.
4. Return to standing by pressing through the front foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Look forward, not down.

Health benefit: External hip rotation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one foot slightly and alternate flexing and pointing the ankle while making small forward-backward pedal motions.
3. Switch feet and continue the pedaling motion at a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep knee safe/pain-free.

Health benefit: Knee joint lubrication.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart with knees soft and hinge at the hips, pushing hips back.
2. Keep chest long and core engaged as you lower your torso forward.
3. Shift weight slightly forward and bend knees to drop into a squat.
4. Press through heels to stand and smoothly hinge back to repeat the flow.
Safety cue: Very small range of motion.

Health benefit: Hip flexor + thoracic stretch.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and toes turned slightly outward.
2. Shift weight to the right and bend the right knee while sending the left hip back to feel the inner thigh stretch.
3. Move smoothly to the left side and continue alternating with controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Twist from torso, not knee.

Health benefit: Plantar fascia stretch.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides or hips.
2. Step your right foot diagonally behind your left and bend both knees into a curtsy lunge.
3. Lightly tap the back foot to the floor while keeping your torso upright.
4. Drive through the front foot to return to standing and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Roll through the toes.

Health benefit: Adductor length.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Keep your heels on the floor and lift your toes toward your shins.
3. Tap your toes lightly on the floor a short distance in front of you.
4. Alternate taps between feet at a controlled, rhythmic pace.
Safety cue: Keep leg straight.

Health benefit: Outer hip stretch.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands by your sides.
2. Step one foot straight back and lower into a reverse lunge until both knees bend about 90 degrees.
3. Reach both arms overhead or forward as you descend.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and switch legs dynamically.
Safety cue: Keep hips square.

Health benefit: Hamstring activation.
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with both feet flat on the floor and knees bent.
2. Tighten the front of one thigh to press the back of the knee down toward the seat or straighten the leg slightly.
3. Hold the contraction for the desired count then relax and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Don't lean backward.

Health benefit: Shin activation.
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands at chest height on the wall with feet hip-width and a short step back.
2. Bend knees slightly and push hips back a few inches into a small squat while keeping your chest tall.
3. Hold the mini-squat for one to two seconds with weight over your heels.
4. Push through your heels and straighten your legs to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep heel down.

Health benefit: Full front line stretch.
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your bottom arm.
2. Straighten the top leg and point the foot forward.
3. Lift the top leg upward in a controlled motion to hip height without rolling the hips.
4. Lower the top leg slowly to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck tailbone slightly.

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps activation and knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor and lean back slightly with hands behind you for support and knees bent.
2. Lift both knees toward your chest and keep your feet together.
3. Rotate your knees to the right in a controlled motion while keeping your shoulders grounded.
4. Sweep your knees back through center and rotate to the left, repeating the movement.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and knee aligned while gently contracting the quadriceps

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with knees bent and feet flat under your hips.
2. Place your hands on your thighs and lift your heels by curling your toes upward.
3. Press the balls of your feet firmly into the floor while pushing down gently with your hands to create resistance.
4. Hold the press for a count then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep weight in the heels and chest lifted with knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet flat and hip-width apart.
2. Turn the sole of the target foot slightly outward so the outer edge contacts the floor.
3. Press the outer edge of that foot firmly into the floor while resisting the movement with your hand on the inner ankle.
4. Hold the isometric press for a count then release and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift the leg with slow controlled movement from the hip

Health benefit: Enhances core rotational control and low back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Keep toes and heel on the floor and draw the ball of the foot toward the heel to lift the arch.
3. Maintain the lifted arch without curling your toes and breathe normally.
4. Release the arch and relax before repeating.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move the legs slowly without jerking

Health benefit: Improves calf strength and ankle push off power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes pointing forward.
2. Bend knees slightly and keep your torso upright.
3. Shift weight smoothly onto one foot while keeping hips level.
4. Return weight to center and repeat to the other side with control.
Safety cue: Stabilize the ankle and press through the ball of the foot with controlled force

Health benefit: Strengthens peroneal muscles and enhances lateral ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Inhale, then exhale and draw your belly button toward your spine to brace the core.
3. Hold the braced position while breathing normally.
4. Relax the muscles and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the ankle steady and resist outward without lifting the heel

Health benefit: Supports foot intrinsic strength and improves arch support
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms at your sides.
2. Tilt your pelvis toward your ribs to flatten the lower back (12 o'clock).
3. Tilt the pelvis away to arch the lower back (6 o'clock) and then drop each hip to 3 and 9 o'clock.
4. Move slowly between positions with small, controlled motions.
Safety cue: Shorten the foot by lifting the arch while keeping toes relaxed and the heel grounded

Health benefit: Promotes balance and reinforces hip and leg weight transfer
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the surface.
2. Keep your head on the surface and draw your chin straight back toward your spine.
3. Hold the retraction for 5-10 seconds while breathing normally.
4. Relax and repeat the movement.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly with hips level and knees tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Enhances deep core engagement and spinal support during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head or crossed on your chest.
2. Press your pelvis into the seat to keep the lower back stable.
3. Slide the middle of your upper back backward by extending the thoracic spine over the chair.
4. Return to upright and repeat the glide.
Safety cue: Exhale and draw the belly gently toward the spine while keeping the low back neutral

Health benefit: Improves pelvic mobility awareness and coordinated pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and place your palms on a stable surface behind your hips.
2. Pull your shoulder blades down and press your hands backward into the surface without moving your torso.
3. Hold the isometric press for 5-10 seconds, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Use small controlled pelvic motions and keep the low back gently contacting the mat

Health benefit: Improves neck posture and deep cervical flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair facing the table with feet flat and hips and knees at 90.
2. Place your forearms on the tabletop with elbows bent and palms flat.
3. Slide your hands forward along the table until you feel a comfortable shoulder stretch.
4. Pull your hands back to the starting position while keeping your core engaged.
Safety cue: Tuck the chin and keep the neck long with shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and upper back movement efficiency
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Bend your elbows to 90 and tuck them to your sides near your hips.
3. Squeeze your elbows firmly inward against your torso without moving your shoulders.
4. Hold the squeeze and then relax your arms to the starting position.
Safety cue: Sit tall and glide from the thoracic spine while keeping the lumbar stable

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and posterior chain endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Bend one elbow to 90 and bring your palm toward your shoulder with the upper arm resting on the floor.
3. Place the opposite hand over the working forearm and push down while resisting with the biceps to prevent movement.
4. Hold the isometric contraction, then release and switch arms.
Safety cue: Hold the extension with scapulae depressed and torso steady

Health benefit: Encourages scapular mobility and controlled shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit and rest your forearm on your thigh with elbow bent 90 and palm facing up.
2. Keep the elbow steady and rotate the forearm to turn the palm down slowly.
3. Reverse the rotation to return the palm up with controlled movement.
4. Repeat for the desired number of smooth repetitions.
Safety cue: Slide the arms with elbows tracking under shoulders and chest open

Health benefit: Promotes elbow alignment and forearm muscle engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a corner and place your forearms on each wall with elbows at ribcage level.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest toward the corner until you feel a low chest stretch.
3. Keep a neutral spine and avoid shrugging your shoulders.
4. Hold while breathing normally, then step back to reduce the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to your sides and squeeze evenly without shrugging

Health benefit: Increases biceps tension and upper arm stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and press your lower back and shoulders into the wall.
2. Raise your arms into a wide "W" with elbows bent and the backs of your hands touching the wall.
3. Slide your arms upward along the wall as far as comfortable while keeping elbows wide.
4. Lower the arms back to the "W" with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace the core and keep the elbow fixed while contracting the biceps

Health benefit: Improves forearm rotational control and wrist coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the front edge of a sturdy chair with feet flat and hip-width apart.
2. Reach both arms overhead while lengthening through your spine.
3. Straighten both legs forward a few inches off the floor while keeping your core engaged.
4. Lower arms and legs with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Anchor the forearm and rotate slowly with controlled wrist movement

Health benefit: Develops scapular upward rotation and overhead movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Bend one knee and draw your heel toward your glutes while keeping thighs aligned.
3. Lower the foot with control to return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Facilitates spinal lengthening and integrates full body posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent about 90 degrees and feet stacked.
2. Keep your hips stacked and lift the top knee upward while keeping feet together.
3. Squeeze the outer hip as you open the knee to a comfortable height.
4. Lower the knee slowly to the starting position and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Reach tall with a braced core and extend through the full spine

Health benefit: Boosts heart rate and promotes light cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on the floor with legs straight and arms by your sides.
2. Brace your core and press your pelvis gently into the floor to keep hips stable.
3. Squeeze one glute and lift the leg a few inches off the ground using a small controlled motion.
4. Lower the leg slowly and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and brace your core while controlling each rapid knee lift

Health benefit: Improves hamstring activation and knee joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back on the floor with one leg extended and the other knee bent, and lift the extended foot a few inches off the ground.
2. Move only the ankle and trace the alphabet in the air with your big toe using smooth, controlled motions.
3. Return the foot to the ground and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and hinge from the knee while controlling the heel toward the glute

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Slightly bend your knees and engage your core to maintain an upright posture.
3. Fix your gaze on a point ahead and hold your balance for the desired duration.
4. Step back to a normal stance and repeat with the opposite foot forward.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates gluteal muscles and supports hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift your toes slightly while keeping the heels grounded.
3. Spread all toes wide apart using the muscles of the foot.
4. Hold the spread for a few seconds and then relax.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and contract the glute to lift through a small controlled range

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place one hand on a stable surface for balance.
2. Shift your weight forward onto the balls of your feet and lift your heels.
3. Rock back onto your heels, lifting your toes, and repeat in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Stabilize the lower leg and move only the ankle through slow controlled letters

Health benefit: Challenges balance and enhances single limb stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width and place forearms against the wall at shoulder height.
2. Tuck the pelvis and draw the navel toward the spine to engage the core.
3. Maintain a straight line from head to heels and perform a small forward lean by bending at the hips.
4. Return to the starting upright position and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Stand heel to toe with a soft knee and steady breath to maintain balance

Health benefit: Enhances intrinsic foot muscle strength and toe coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with knees wide and big toes touching.
2. Sit back toward your heels and extend your arms forward.
3. Rest your forehead on the floor and relax your torso.
Safety cue: Keep the foot flat and actively spread the toes while relaxing the ankle

Health benefit: Improves ankle flexibility and weight transfer control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the ground and arms by your sides.
2. Gently lift your chest a few inches and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
3. Hold briefly with a neutral neck, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Keep weight centered over the feet and rock slowly with an upright posture

Health benefit: Engages core muscles and promotes postural alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and stacked, bottom arm extended in front.
2. Keep hips steady and sweep the top arm across your body and then up and back.
3. Turn your head to follow the moving hand and rotate your upper back.
4. Return the top arm to the start position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Stretches hips and lower back while encouraging relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Bend your elbows so your fists sit at ribcage level with palms facing each other.
3. Punch rapidly in small alternating motions to an imaginary low bag at waist height.
4. Keep wrists relaxed and maintain a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Lengthen the spine and breathe deeply into the back while keeping the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Improves scapular retraction and upper back muscle engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet staggered and hinge forward from the hips.
2. Rest your non-working hand on your front thigh and let the working arm hang down relaxed.
3. Move the hanging arm in small controlled circular motions clockwise and then counterclockwise.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and squeeze shoulder blades down and together

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and your elbow bent 90 at your side.
2. Place the back of your hand against the outside of the same-side knee to create resistance.
3. Attempt to rotate your forearm inward toward your stomach while pressing into your knee without moving the arm.
4. Hold the contraction for the chosen duration.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine with controlled motion

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder endurance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and one foot slightly forward.
2. Raise both hands to chin level and tuck your chin.
3. Drive short hooks to the body by rotating your hips and pivoting the rear foot.
4. Return hands to guard, move your feet, and repeat rhythmically.
Safety cue: Stabilize the shoulder blades and keep elbows slightly bent with controlled punches

Health benefit: Promotes gentle shoulder joint mobility and fluid movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall at arm's length and place your knuckles flat against the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels and engage your core.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the wall while keeping knuckles pressed.
4. Push through your knuckles to straighten your arms and reset the position.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, relax the arm, and make small controlled circles from the shoulder

Health benefit: Builds rotator cuff stability and controlled internal rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and forehead resting on the floor.
2. Squeeze your glutes and retract your shoulder blades to lift your chest a few inches while keeping your arms and hands on the floor.
3. Hold the raised position with a firm core, then lower slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow tucked to your side and maintain a neutral wrist while pressing inward

Health benefit: Improves aerobic capacity and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands on hips.
2. Step your right foot to the side and shift weight onto it.
3. Bring your left foot to meet the right and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Rotate through the hips and exhale with each punch while keeping the chin tucked

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain activation and thoracic extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with knees bent and feet flat, and place hands behind your hips for support.
2. Lean back slightly and lift both feet a few inches to create a V shape with your torso and thighs.
3. Keep your chest lifted and hold the position while breathing steadily.
4. Lower your feet with control and reset for the next repetition.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Encourages lateral mobility and light cardiovascular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a wall and place fingertips lightly on it for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto one foot and lift the other foot a few inches off the ground.
3. Maintain an upright posture and touch the wall briefly with fingertips if needed to steady.
4. Lower the lifted foot with control and switch to the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture and step with control without letting the hips sway
Physical limitation: Ankle instability / recurrent sprains | Limited single-leg balance

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioception through controlled rhythmic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the edge of a chair with feet flat and knees hip-width apart.
2. Squeeze your inner thighs and press your knees together until they lightly touch.
3. Slowly control your knees apart to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Transfer weight slowly with controlled steps and maintain a tall upright posture

Health benefit: Improves core strength and seated trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the ground and the other foot flat in front to form a lunge.
2. Lower your hips slightly and pulse forward a few inches by contracting the front glute.
3. Maintain an upright torso and perform small controlled pulses for the set.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift your toes so only your heels contact the ground.
2. Walk forward on your heels with short, controlled steps for a short distance.
3. Keep your posture upright and gently lower your toes to stop.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and knee slightly bent to maintain controlled balance

Health benefit: Strengthens hip adductors and supports pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a stable support lightly with one hand.
2. Shift your weight onto one foot and lift the other foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Push through the toes of the standing foot to rise up onto the ball of the foot.
4. Lower the heel back down with control and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Sit tall and squeeze through the inner thighs while keeping spine neutral

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and glute activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and loop a towel around the ball of your foot.
2. Keep the knee straight and pull the towel toward you until you feel a stretch in the calf.
3. Hold the stretch while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over the ankle and pulse with control

Health benefit: Builds ankle dorsiflexion strength and improves gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Fix your gaze on a point straight ahead and keep your eyes open.
3. Engage your core and stand tall without leaning.
4. Hold the position for the chosen time and step out carefully when finished.
Safety cue: Keep toes lifted and walk with controlled even steps

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles while challenging single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat on the floor, and arms by your sides.
2. Tilt your pelvis to press your lower back into the floor and brace your core.
3. Slowly slide one heel forward to straighten the leg while keeping your lower back in contact with the floor.
4. Return the heel to the start and alternate sides with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep weight centered over the midfoot and rise slowly through the heel

Health benefit: Improves calf flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart and hands placed on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Inhale and arch your back, lifting your chest and tailbone while pressing gently into the wall.
3. Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin and tailbone while maintaining hand contact.
4. Flow between the two positions with smooth, controlled breaths.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and dorsiflex the ankle by pulling the towel with control

Health benefit: Develops core stability and coordinated trunk limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent, hips stacked, and both arms extended in front of you on the floor.
2. Keep your bottom shoulder anchored and slowly rotate your top arm across your body.
3. Open the top arm toward the ceiling while following it with your eyes to rotate your torso.
4. Return the arm to the start with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves neck alignment and deep cervical flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders up toward your ears in a slow, controlled motion.
3. Roll your shoulders back and down in a smooth circular path.
4. Reverse the direction and roll your shoulders forward with the same control.
Safety cue: Gently tuck the chin while keeping the neck long and spine neutral

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to a wall with the elbow of the nearest arm bent to 90 degrees and kept close to your side.
2. Place the back of that hand gently against the wall at about waist height.
3. Attempt to rotate your forearm outward away from your belly while keeping the elbow fixed and the hand pressed into the wall.
4. Hold the isometric press with steady tension without moving the shoulder joint.
Safety cue: Rotate the thoracic spine while keeping hips stacked and knees together

Health benefit: Improves shoulder circulation and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and place your forearms on the floor with elbows under your shoulders and palms flat or clasped.
2. Step your feet back and lower your hips so your knees stay on the ground and your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Draw your belly button toward your spine and squeeze your glutes to stabilize the torso.
4. Hold the position with steady breathing and avoid letting your hips sag or lift too high.
Safety cue: Roll shoulders slowly through a full range while keeping your core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens external rotators for shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your forehead on the floor and arms resting alongside your hips.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your chest and arms a few inches off the floor.
3. Draw your elbows toward your hips and turn your palms to face up while maintaining the lift.
4. Hold for 2-3 seconds, then lower your chest and arms slowly to the floor.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain activation and upper back extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg straight on the floor.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Keeping the straight leg straight, lift it until the thigh is level with the bent knee or as high as comfortable.
4. Lower the leg slowly with control back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Lift the chest with shoulder blades down and back while avoiding neck hyperextension

Health benefit: Enhances anterior shoulder mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both legs straight and arms relaxed by your sides.
2. Slide one heel slowly toward your buttocks, bending the knee while keeping the foot on the floor.
3. Continue the slide until the knee reaches a comfortable bend near your chest.
4. Slide the heel back to the starting position with control and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Sit tall and draw shoulder blades together while breathing deeply

Health benefit: Increases heart rate gently and promotes lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Shift weight onto your left leg and keep the left knee soft.
3. Lift your right leg straight out to the side to about 45 degrees with toes facing forward.
4. Lower the right leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and drive knees up with controlled movement and steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and quadriceps while improving lower limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left thigh near the knee and flex the right foot.
3. Hinge forward from the hips with a straight back until you feel a stretch in the right glute.
4. Hold briefly, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances knee mobility and promotes coordinated hip and knee movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with knees bent and feet lifted slightly off the ground.
2. Extend your right foot and rotate the ankle slowly clockwise for several controlled circles.
3. Reverse the rotation and rotate the right ankle counterclockwise the same number of times.
4. Lower the right foot, lift the left foot, and repeat the rotations for the left ankle.
Safety cue: Slide the heel slowly while maintaining a neutral spine and engaged core

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip strength and pelvic stability during single leg tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a sturdy surface and place one hand lightly on it.
2. Shift your weight onto the foot nearest the surface.
3. Lift the other foot a few inches off the floor and keep hips level.
4. Hold the position, then lower and switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep hips level, and lift the leg without leaning your torso

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation range and eases gluteal muscle tension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with one bare foot flat on a towel on the floor.
2. Keep your heel down and curl your toes to pull the towel toward you.
3. Release your toes to smooth the towel back to the start.
4. Repeat the scrunching motion, then switch to the other foot.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a long spine and avoid rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Maintains ankle range of motion and stimulates circulation in the lower leg
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright and place one foot directly in front of the other with heel touching toe.
2. Keep your hips level and gaze forward while lightly extending your arms for balance.
3. Hold the heel-to-toe stance, then step back to neutral and switch the leading foot.
Safety cue: Keep the knee relaxed and make controlled full ankle circles from the joint

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioception while strengthening ankle and hip stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width apart, and arms at your sides.
2. Exhale and tilt your pelvis posteriorly, pressing your lower back into the floor.
3. Hold the flattened position briefly while keeping your abdominals engaged.
4. Inhale as you release to a neutral spine and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, engage the core, and use a support to maintain balance

Health benefit: Improves intrinsic foot strength and fine motor control of the toes
Steps to perform:
1. Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Exhale and round your spine up toward the ceiling while tucking your chin and tailbone.
3. Inhale and arch your back, lifting your chest and tailbone while looking slightly upward.
4. Move smoothly between the two positions for each repetition.
Safety cue: Anchor the heel and curl the toes to scrunch the towel with slow control

Health benefit: Promotes gentle core engagement and enhances awareness of pelvic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit cross-legged or with knees bent and feet flat, sitting tall with hands behind your head.
2. Rotate your upper torso to the right from the mid-back while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Pause briefly at the end range while maintaining an upright posture.
4. Return to center and repeat the rotation to the left.
Safety cue: Exhale as you flatten the lower back, tilting the pelvis with controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves neck range of motion and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place fingertips on the wall at waist height.
3. Slowly walk your fingertips upward by extending fingers and moving the hand higher.
4. Reverse the motion to walk your fingers back down to the start.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder down and gently tilt the head away from the side being stretched

Health benefit: Enhances upper back mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place palms flat on the wall at chest height and lean forward slightly.
3. Press your hands into the wall as if trying to push it without letting your body move.
4. Maintain the push and keep your core engaged.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from the midback while keeping the spine long

Health benefit: Improves shoulder elevation and active range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop up on your forearm with elbow under your shoulder and knees bent.
2. Press the forearm and lower knee into the floor to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Keep your core tight and hold the position, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances upper body stability and muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a doorway with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your forearms on each side of the doorframe at shoulder height.
3. Step one foot forward and gently lean your chest through the doorway.
4. Keep your shoulders down and breathe steadily while holding the position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and forearm muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on the floor with legs straight and toes grounded.
2. Extend your arms overhead at a 45-degree angle to form a Y with palms facing down.
3. Lift your arms and chest a few inches off the ground by engaging your upper back.
4. Lower slowly and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow extended and gently pull the fingers back while keeping the shoulder relaxed

Health benefit: Improves lateral core stability and shoulder girdle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Step your right foot to the side and shift your weight onto it.
3. Bring your left foot next to the right with a light touch while keeping a steady rhythm.
4. Repeat by stepping to the opposite side and maintain a controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Opens chest and promotes improved posture alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with back straight and both feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift one foot off the floor and straighten the knee until the leg is parallel to the floor.
3. Pause and tighten the front of the thigh.
4. Lower the foot back to the floor with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and upper back muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked and knees bent at about 90 degrees.
2. Keep feet together and lift the top knee upward while keeping hips steady.
3. Pause at the top without rotating the hips.
4. Lower the knee back to touch the bottom knee with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases light cardiovascular activity and lateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs straight and stacked, and support your head with your lower arm.
2. Engage the outer hip and lift the top leg upward with toes pointing forward.
3. Pause at the top and squeeze the glute.
4. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture, lead the movement from the hips, and control each lateral step

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps to support knee function and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a long step back with one foot.
2. Bend the front knee and keep the back leg straight while squaring your hips.
3. Tuck the pelvis slightly and drive the hips forward, hold, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hip flexor flexibility and promotes upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Shift your weight to the balls of your feet and lift both heels as high as possible.
3. Pause and squeeze the calf muscles at the top.
4. Lower the heels slowly back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves balance and ankle mobility for safer walking
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and hips level.
2. Reach one arm straight forward at shoulder height while keeping the torso still.
3. Hold briefly, return the hand to the floor, and repeat with the other arm.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly from heel to toe while maintaining a tall posture and steady breath

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stabilization and improves upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with a neutral spine and weight evenly distributed.
2. Slide your right arm under your left arm, palm facing up, lowering your right shoulder and temple toward the floor.
3. Keep your hips level and breathe as you rotate your chest toward the floor.
4. Return to the starting position and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves neck flexibility and lateral range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and shins parallel to the floor in a table top position.
2. Place your arms at your sides with palms down and press your lower back gently into the mat.
3. Slide both arms slowly overhead along the floor while keeping your core engaged.
4. Reverse the movement to bring your arms back to the sides while maintaining spinal stability.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and spine long while gently guiding the head with the opposite hand

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with your bottom arm extended and the top elbow bent at 90 degrees, tuck the elbow against your side.
2. Keep the upper arm anchored and rotate your forearm upward away from your abdomen.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping the elbow fixed and the shoulder relaxed.
4. Lower the forearm slowly back to the starting position and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged as you rotate, moving slowly and controlling the descent

Health benefit: Increases posterior shoulder flexibility and horizontal adduction range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and bend one elbow to 90 with palm facing up.
2. Place your opposite hand against the palm or forearm to create opposing force.
3. Contract the bicep and push upward against the resistance without moving the elbow.
4. Hold the contraction and keep your torso still.
Safety cue: Align shoulders square and pull the arm across the chest without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Promotes scapular control and shoulder upward rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with knees slightly bent and hands up by your face.
2. Extend your lead arm quickly in a straight line while rotating the forearm so the palm faces down.
3. Retract the hand immediately back to guard under control.
4. Repeat at a steady rhythm while keeping your core engaged and chin tucked.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens rotator cuff external rotators and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge forward slightly with a flat back.
2. Extend both arms straight in front at shoulder height and press palms together.
3. Open the arms outward by squeezing the shoulder blades while maintaining palm pressure.
4. Hold the open position and keep your chest lifted without moving the torso.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds biceps endurance and joint stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a doorway with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your forearm and palm against the doorframe at shoulder height.
3. Step one foot forward and rotate your torso away from the frame until you feel a front shoulder stretch.
4. Hold the position and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Stand tall with shoulders back and press into the resistance without shrugging or swinging

Health benefit: Improves upper body coordination and light cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands resting on your hips.
2. Slightly bend your knees and jump both feet outward wider than shoulder-width.
3. Land softly with knees bent and immediately jump feet back together.
4. Repeat at a steady pace while keeping your torso upright.
Safety cue: Exhale on each jab and keep hands up with a stable core and relaxed shoulders

Health benefit: Enhances posterior shoulder endurance and scapular retraction control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place both hands lightly on a wall for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto the target leg and bend the knee slightly.
3. Tighten the front thigh and straighten the knee fully while keeping the foot flat.
4. Hold the contraction briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly, keep a neutral spine, and squeeze shoulder blades together without shrugging

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate and improves lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left thigh just above the knee.
3. Reach your hands behind your left thigh and pull the left knee toward your chest.
4. Keep your lower back on the floor and hold the position.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent, chest up, and core engaged to control movement

Health benefit: Increases glute and hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with knees bent and feet flat, heels touching the floor.
2. Keep your heels planted and lift your toes and the tops of your feet toward your shins.
3. Lower your toes back down slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and dynamic joint range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall about an arm's length away and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step your right foot back and bend both knees, keeping the right heel on the floor.
3. Sink your hips toward the wall until you feel a deep stretch in the lower part of your right calf.
4. Keep your back knee bent and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Move slowly with control and keep the pelvis stable while engaging the core

Health benefit: Strengthens shin muscles and supports ankle dorsiflexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one foot directly in front of the other, heel to toe, on an imaginary straight line.
2. Fix your eyes forward and engage your core.
3. Take slow, controlled steps along the line, placing each heel on the toes of the back foot.
4. Keep a slight knee bend and extend your arms to the sides for balance as you walk, then switch the leading foot.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Engages core and hip flexors for trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and a slight bend in the knees.
2. Step laterally to the right, sweep the left foot behind without jumping, and tap the toe lightly on the floor.
3. Drive through the right leg to return to center and repeat to the left side.
4. Use your arms to counterbalance and maintain a steady, controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances foot placement precision and lateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with big toes touching, knees apart, and sit back on your heels.
2. Walk your hands forward and lower your chest toward the floor, resting your forehead on the floor.
3. Slide your right hand along the floor toward the left to reach the left side, keeping hips back.
4. Hold the reach for a few breaths, return both hands forward, then switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Take heel-to-toe steps with hips level and gaze forward to maintain balance

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain activation and unilateral hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent to 90 degrees and arms extended toward the ceiling.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly lower your right arm overhead and extend your left leg toward the floor without touching it.
4. Return to start and repeat on the opposite side in a controlled motion.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lateral stability and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent in a low stance.
2. Step to the right with your right foot and swing both arms across your body to the left.
3. Step back to center and repeat to the left, maintaining a low posture and rhythmic arm swings.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest upright

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead on the floor and arms bent so elbows point toward hips, forming a W.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and lift your hands, forearms, and chest a few inches off the ground.
3. Lower back down with control and repeat, keeping your neck neutral.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee slightly soft and hip level while using support for balance

Health benefit: Develops core endurance and trunk stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward, keeping the spine long.
3. Place hands on your thighs or shins for support and avoid rounding the back.
4. Hold the position while breathing evenly and keep weight balanced through both feet.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and draw your navel toward your spine

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and improves scapular retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and the bottom arm under your head.
2. Align hips so the top hip sits directly over the bottom hip.
3. Lift the top leg upward from the hip with control, keeping toes pointing forward.
4. Lower the leg slowly to the starting position without letting the hips roll.
Safety cue: Lift elbows off the ground keeping neck long and squeeze shoulder blades together

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and gentle spinal lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a sturdy chair and place a light hand on the back for support.
2. Shift weight onto the nearest foot and engage the standing leg.
3. Lift the other foot a few inches off the floor and hold your balance.
4. Maintain an upright posture and lightly touch the chair if needed for stability.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width apart and toes a few inches from the wall.
2. Place hands on the wall and shift weight onto one foot.
3. Bend the front knee and drive it toward the wall while keeping the heel grounded.
4. Rock back to upright and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stack hips and lift the top leg with glute control and no hip rotation

Health benefit: Increases groin and inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent to about 90 degrees and heels aligned.
2. Rest your head on your arm and keep your hips stacked.
3. Lift the top knee upward while keeping feet together and pelvis stable.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit tall hinge from the hips with a long spine and steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and helps maintain spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright with shoulders relaxed and hands lightly behind your head.
2. Press the back of your head into your hands while resisting movement with equal force.
3. Hold the static contraction for the desired time and then relax.
Safety cue: Pull ribs down and bend from the waist with slow even breathing

Health benefit: Engages core muscles and promotes awareness of pelvic alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out to the right while lifting both arms overhead.
3. Step your right foot back to center while lowering your arms to your sides.
4. Step your left foot out while lifting your arms, then return to center and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Tuck and release the pelvis using the core and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Challenges balance and coordination while enhancing lower limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and bring your right arm across your chest with the elbow slightly bent.
2. Use your left hand to grasp the right elbow and gently pull the arm toward your chest to feel a stretch behind the shoulder.
3. Hold the stretch for 20 to 30 seconds, then switch arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall posture and place each foot in a straight line with controlled steps

Health benefit: Builds neck endurance and posterior neck muscle control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at lower chest or upper abdomen level with elbows slightly bent.
2. Lean in slightly and brace your core to create tension through your arms and chest.
3. Press firmly into the wall without allowing your body to move and hold the contraction.
4. Maintain the isometric push for 10 to 30 seconds, then relax and repeat as needed.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and spine neutral while holding the contraction

Health benefit: Improves aerobic fitness and lateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Get on all fours with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to tailbone.
3. Reach one arm forward to shoulder height while maintaining balance.
4. Lower the arm with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest upright

Health benefit: Strengthens low chest and anterior shoulder stability through sustained muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. March forward by lifting one knee toward hip level and swinging the opposite arm.
3. Land softly and continue alternating at a relaxed walking pace.
Safety cue: Press into the wall with straight wrists and a braced core

Health benefit: Increases wrist range of motion and joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a doorway and place your forearm on the lower doorframe with elbow slightly below shoulder level.
2. Step forward with the foot farthest from the frame until you feel a gentle stretch across your chest.
3. Keep your torso upright and breathe evenly while holding the position.
4. Step back and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Make slow controlled wrist circles with forearm relaxed and supported

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexor activation and light cardiovascular engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Keep palms facing down and maintain a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Make large, controlled forward circles with both arms from the shoulder.
4. Reverse the motion and make large, controlled backward circles.
Safety cue: Stay upright, drive knees forward with a tall posture and steady breath

Health benefit: Increases anterior chest and shoulder flexibility for improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat on the floor and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Engage your core and keep your back straight.
3. Slide one heel forward along the floor until the leg straightens, keeping toes on the floor.
4. Slide the heel back to the starting position and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and avoid overarching the lower back as you lean forward

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and prepares upper body for dynamic activity
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width apart, and arms resting by your sides.
2. Press through your heels, squeeze your glutes, and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Hold the top position while maintaining a tight core and squeezed glutes, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Control the motion with scapular stability and maintain a soft bend in the elbows

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Lower into an athletic stance with weight on the balls of your feet.
3. Push off one foot and take quick lateral shuffles 3 to 5 steps.
4. Reverse direction and continue shuffling for the desired time or reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips square

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and supports pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on it at chest height.
2. Step one foot back with heel on the ground and toes pointing forward.
3. Keep the back leg straight and bend the front knee while pressing hips forward.
4. Hold the stretch and then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep ribs lowered to prevent lower back arch

Health benefit: Enhances lateral agility and hip abductor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat on the floor and knees at about 90 degrees.
2. Spread your toes wide, then curl them downward to grip the floor.
3. Release and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Maintain a slight knee bend

Health benefit: Challenges balance and proprioception under reduced visual input
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and hands beside hips for support.
2. Straighten one leg forward until it is fully extended and toes point upward.
3. Hold the extended position briefly while squeezing the thigh.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Distribute weight evenly between both feet

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves toe dexterity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat close to your hips.
2. Lean back slightly and brace your core to create a straight spine.
3. Lift one foot a few inches off the floor while keeping balance.
4. Lower the foot and repeat with the other leg or hold both lifted to increase difficulty.
Safety cue: Sit tall with feet flat

Health benefit: Combines cardiovascular activity with coordination and upper body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and arms extended out to the sides.
2. Keep both shoulders on the floor and slowly lower both knees to one side.
3. Rotate your head to look toward the opposite hand while maintaining shoulder contact.
4. Return knees to center and repeat the movement to the other side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright as you reach overhead

Health benefit: Improves core engagement and spinal stability during seated tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Draw your shoulder blades together and down as if pinching a small object between them.
3. Hold the squeeze steadily while keeping your neck relaxed.
4. Release the squeeze and return to a neutral posture.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Engage your core and slide both hands forward while maintaining a neutral spine.
3. Reach forward until you feel a controlled stretch without letting your lower back sag.
4. Pull your hands back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep chin neutral and move slowly from the neck

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbows bent at your sides and palms pressed together at chest level.
2. Press your palms firmly into each other while keeping elbows close to your ribs.
3. Maintain the maximal squeeze and breathe steadily.
4. Relax the pressure and rest briefly before repeating.
Safety cue: Keep hips grounded and rotate through the thoracic spine with control

Health benefit: Promotes improved shoulder posture and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Raise one arm overhead and bend the elbow so your hand drops behind your head.
2. Reach the opposite hand up and grasp the bent elbow.
3. Pull the elbow gently toward your head while keeping your torso upright.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades down and together without shrugging

Health benefit: Improves shoulder flexion and scapular mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and make fists, placing knuckles flat on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Step your knees back so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Brace your core and squeeze your glutes to prevent sagging.
4. Keep your neck neutral and breathe steadily while holding the position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and slide hips back while keeping shoulders stable

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder stability through sustained muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and arms overhead in line with your ears.
2. Keep palms facing down and lift your chest and arms a few inches off the floor.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and maintain a neutral neck.
4. Lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Brace the core and press the arm inward without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Increases triceps flexibility and elbow extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy counter and place hands shoulder-width on its edge.
2. Walk feet back until your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend elbows and lower your chest toward the counter until elbows are about 90 degrees.
4. Press through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and draw the elbow toward the head while maintaining a long spine

Health benefit: Strengthens core endurance with reduced wrist stress compared to palms
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Swing your right arm across your chest while your left arm moves backward in a controlled motion.
3. Alternate arms so they cross the midline rhythmically and maintain a steady pace.
Safety cue: Hold a straight line from head to knees and breathe evenly throughout the plank

Health benefit: Improves upper back strength and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with your back straight and hands gripping the sides for support.
2. Keep one foot flat on the floor and extend the other leg fully so the knee is straight.
3. Lift the extended leg a few inches off the seat by contracting the front thigh and hold briefly.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and lift the arms using scapular motion without arching the low back

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and dynamic blood flow to the upper limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Shift weight onto one leg and lift the other leg straight out to the side with toes pointing forward.
3. Raise to about hip height, pause briefly, then lower the leg slowly with control.
Safety cue: Control arm speed and keep shoulders relaxed while allowing thoracic rotation

Health benefit: Enhances hip and thigh strength while improving balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with knees bent at 90 degrees and feet flat under your hips.
2. Place your hands on top of your thighs and press down to provide resistance.
3. Raise your heels by pressing through the balls of your feet, hold briefly, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and front knee tracking over the toes

Health benefit: Targets hip abductor strength and lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand near a stable surface if needed and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the other foot slightly off the ground, keep your hips level, and then close your eyes.
