3. Hold your balance for the desired time, then open your eyes and lower the raised foot with control.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and lift from the outer hip with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases external hip rotation flexibility and gluteal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with feet flat on the floor and toes relaxed.
2. Keep heel and toes grounded and lift only the medial arch to create a dome.
3. Hold the domed arch for 5-10 seconds while breathing evenly.
4. Release the arch and repeat for desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Sit tall and maintain a long spine while leaning forward into the stretch

Health benefit: Builds calf muscle endurance and ankle plantarflexion strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Brace your core and push hips back as you bend knees to lower into a squat.
3. Keep chest upright and knees tracking over the toes.
4. Drive through the heels to stand and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep knee stable and press through the ball of the foot with controlled heel raises

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and promotes arch support
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or mat with feet flat and hands on your knees.
2. Inhale and arch your chest forward while tilting the pelvis slightly for cow.
3. Exhale and round your spine, draw your chin to your chest, and tuck the pelvis for cat.
4. Flow between the two positions with each breath for several cycles.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and hip mobility in a wide stance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shoulders relaxed.
2. Gently pull your chin straight back, creating a double chin without tilting your head.
3. Hold the tucked position for 5 to 10 seconds while breathing normally.
4. Release slowly to neutral and repeat for desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and knees tracking over toes while sitting back between the legs

Health benefit: Improves neck posture and reduces forward head position
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your side to a wall and place the fingertips of the nearest hand on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Keep your elbow slightly bent and your torso upright.
3. Slowly "walk" your fingers sideways along the wall, maintaining light contact.
4. Return the hand to the start position and repeat for desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and neck long while retracting the head

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a doorway and bend the nearest elbow to 90 degrees with the elbow at your side.
2. Place the back of your hand against the doorframe at waist to chest height.
3. Attempt to rotate your forearm outward into the frame and hold the contraction.
4. Maintain the press for 10 to 15 seconds, then relax and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Anchor hips over knees and rotate through the thoracic spine with a stable core

Health benefit: Strengthens upper trapezius and supports shoulder elevation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with your elbow bent 90 and your upper arm at your side.
2. Keep your forearm parallel to the floor and rotate your palm upward toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate your forearm the other way so your palm faces the floor.
4. Continue alternating pronation and supination in smooth, controlled motions.
Safety cue: Lift and lower the shoulders with control while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and finger range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Press your palms together in front of your chest with your fingers pointing upward.
2. Keeping your palms pressed, slowly lower your hands toward your waist until you feel a stretch in the front of your forearms.
3. Hold the stretch while breathing evenly.
Safety cue: Stand tall and crawl your fingers along the wall using scapular movement, keeping ribs down

Health benefit: Builds rotator cuff endurance and stabilizes the shoulder joint
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your arms extended out to the sides at shoulder level and your thumbs pointing up.
2. Engage your upper back and lift your arms off the floor to shoulder height while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
4. Lower your arms slowly back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow pinned to your side and press outward without letting the shoulder hike

Health benefit: Improves forearm rotational mobility and functional wrist control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended straight in front at shoulder height.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and sweep your arms out to the sides until they reach shoulder level.
3. Hold briefly while keeping a straight spine and engaged core.
4. Slowly bring your arms back together in front with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Support the forearm and rotate only at the wrist with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases wrist and forearm flexibility for improved reaching tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and clasp hands at chest or extend them forward.
2. Rotate your torso to the right by turning your chest while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Return to center with control.
4. Rotate to the left and continue alternating smoothly.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder muscles and promotes scapular retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet about hip-width apart and a small step forward.
2. Slide down the wall until your knees bend slightly for a shallow squat while keeping your back on the wall.
3. Engage your core and keep weight in your heels to maintain the hold.
4. Push through your feet to slide up the wall and return to standing when finished.
Safety cue: Raise arms into a T while squeezing the shoulder blades and maintaining a neutral neck

Health benefit: Builds lower body endurance and supports knee joint stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg in front and the other behind so both hips and knees form 90 angles.
2. Place hands on the floor beside your hips for balance.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg and press through your hands to lift and shift the hips.
4. Return to the starting position and smoothly switch legs, repeating the movement rhythmically.
Safety cue: Keep weight in your heels and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances glute activation and hip stability for improved pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and knees bent at 90.
2. Lift one foot slightly and tilt the sole inward to invert the ankle.
3. Tilt the sole outward to evert the ankle and repeat controlled repetitions.
4. Switch to the other foot and repeat the same pattern.
Safety cue: Drive hips up and keep the pelvis stable as you alternate legs

Health benefit: Strengthens hip extensors and improves posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and shoulders relaxed.
2. Take small steps forward walking on your heels with toes lifted off the ground for several steps.
3. Pause, then take small steps forward walking on your toes with heels lifted for several steps.
4. Alternate between heel walking and toe walking for the chosen distance or time.
Safety cue: Stand tall and hinge from the hip without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rotational control in sitting positions
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair or stand with feet flat under hips.
2. Lift only your toes while keeping heels and balls of feet grounded.
3. Spread all toes wide and press them into the floor.
4. Hold 5-10 seconds, relax, and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate through the hips without rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances balance and ankle strength to support confident walking mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on forearms and knees with elbows under shoulders.
2. Step back so your shoulders align over elbows and knees remain grounded.
3. Lift your torso into a straight line from head to knees and engage your core.
4. Hold steady, then lower to the floor to rest.
Safety cue: Walk heel to toe deliberately with core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and supports improved toe alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with big toes touching and knees hip-width or wider.
2. Sit back toward your heels and extend your arms forward while lowering your forehead to the floor.
3. Relax the chest toward the thighs and hold the pose.
Safety cue: Actively spread toes while keeping the forefoot grounded

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and relaxation of the back and hip muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift your shoulders slightly and make 10 small controlled circles forward with only the shoulder joints.
3. Reverse direction and make 10 small controlled circles backward.
Safety cue: Sink hips back, lengthen the spine, and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and increases shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, with a soft bend in the knees and elbows.
2. Retract your shoulder blades and lift your arms out to the sides until they are level with your shoulders.
3. Squeeze your rear delts at the top while keeping elbows slightly bent and palms facing down.
4. Lower your arms slowly back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and chin tucked while gently guiding your head toward the shoulder

Health benefit: Improves shoulder joint mobility and warms up surrounding muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and bend one elbow to 90 degrees with the palm facing your torso.
2. Grasp your working forearm or wrist with your opposite hand to provide resistance, keeping palms facing each other.
3. Attempt to curl the working forearm upward while using the opposite hand to resist the movement, creating an isometric contraction.
4. Hold the tension for a chosen count, then switch arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and move slowly from the shoulder joint with controlled small circles

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and promotes better shoulder alignment during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm and palm flat on the doorframe at shoulder height.
2. Step the same-side foot forward a small step and rotate your torso away from the arm.
3. Keep your spine long and shoulders down as you feel a gentle stretch across the chest.
4. Hold the position, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens core and shoulder stabilizers with lower impact on wrists
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, hands placed just behind your hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Press through your palms to lift your hips a few inches while keeping the elbows slightly bent.
3. Lower your hips a few inches by bending the elbows a little, keeping the movement small and controlled.
4. Press back up through your palms to the lifted position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels, engage the core, and avoid sagging hips

Health benefit: Improves triceps endurance and functional pushing capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one towel rolled under your knee to create a small bump beneath the joint.
2. Tighten the front thigh muscle and press the back of the knee down into the towel without moving the leg.
3. Hold the muscle contraction for the chosen count while breathing normally.
4. Relax the muscle and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and hip flexor activation while providing light cardiovascular stimulus
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall at the edge of a chair with both feet flat and knees bent about 90 degrees.
2. Place one heel on the floor and try to pull the heel back under the chair without letting the foot move.
3. Squeeze the back of the thigh to create a strong isometric contraction.
4. Hold the contraction for the required time and then relax.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture, drive knees with control, and keep a rhythmic arm swing

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to a wall with the hand lightly touching it for balance and feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift your weight onto the nearest leg and keep that knee soft and stable.
3. Lift the outer leg straight out to the side with toes pointing forward and torso upright.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with both feet flat on the floor and legs relaxed.
2. Point both toes away from you to press the feet down and feel the calf engage.
3. Pull both toes up toward your shins to flex the ankles and feel the front lower leg engage.
4. Alternate these movements in a steady rhythm for the desired duration.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips level and lift the leg slowly without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Increases hip flexor flexibility and enhances anterior hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg.
2. Lift the other foot slightly and extend it forward with a soft knee.
3. Tap the floor lightly with the toes of the lifted foot, then return it to the lifted position.
4. Repeat taps for the set, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine, gently tuck the pelvis and breathe into the stretch

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and promotes lower leg circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Place your hands behind your hips with fingers pointing away.
3. Press your hands into the floor and lift your chest and upper back into a gentle arch.
4. Lower slowly back to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the knee relaxed and pump the ankle slowly through full range while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and neuromuscular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and knees soft.
2. Shift your weight to one side and push your hips laterally while keeping your chest upright.
3. Return through center and shift your weight to the opposite side.
4. Continue alternating controlled sways.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, soften the standing knee and tap the toe lightly with control

Health benefit: Supports arch strength and improves foot stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet on the floor, and arms reaching toward the ceiling.
2. Engage your core and press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Slowly slide one heel along the floor until the leg straightens while keeping the opposite arm stationary.
4. Draw the leg back to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Root the toes and lift the arch using intrinsic foot muscles without curling

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and encourages posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms bent at 90 degrees in front of you.
2. Keep your hips facing forward and rotate your upper torso to one side, reaching the top hand back and opening the chest.
3. Return to center and repeat the rotation to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat, hands resting on your thighs, and spine upright.
2. Pull your shoulder blades straight back and together without shrugging the shoulders.
3. Hold the squeeze for a count, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate slowly with controlled motion and keep your chin slightly tucked

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back flat to the wall and press both forearms against the wall at shoulder height with elbows bent.
2. Keep your forearms and entire back touching the wall and brace your core.
3. Slide your forearms upward along the wall until your arms reach overhead or as far as comfortable.
4. Slide your forearms back down to the start position while maintaining contact with the wall.
Safety cue: Keep hips facing forward and rotate through the upper back with controlled movement

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and improves posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a wall with your elbow bent 90 and your upper arm resting against your side.
2. Place the back of your hand against the wall and press inward without moving your upper arm.
3. Hold the inward press at a steady effort, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall and squeeze shoulder blades together without shrugging

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and upward rotation of the scapula
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm straight in front at shoulder height with the palm facing up and fingers extended.
2. Use your other hand to gently pull the fingers and palm back toward you until you feel a stretch in the forearm.
3. Hold the stretch at a steady level, then switch arms and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves wrist and forearm flexibility for functional hand use
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your forehead on the floor and your arms bent so your hands are by your ears in a W shape.
2. Squeeze your glutes and lift your chest, head, and hands a few inches off the ground.
3. Rotate your thumbs toward the ceiling and pull your shoulder blades together.
4. Hold briefly then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Engages core and shoulder muscles to enhance posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and clasp your hands behind your back.
2. Straighten your arms and pull your shoulder blades together to open your chest.
3. Gently lift your chin while keeping your neck neutral.
4. Hold the stretch then release your hands and relax.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves respiratory movement and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet about hip-width and one foot-length forward.
2. Slide down into a small squat so your thighs are slightly angled and knees track over toes.
3. Tuck your pelvis, engage your core, and press your lower back into the wall.
4. Hold the position then press through your feet to slide back up to standing.
Safety cue: Draw shoulders back and down while expanding the chest and avoiding arching the lower back

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet together.
2. Press your feet together and open one knee outward while keeping hips flat.
3. Hold the open position briefly and engage the outer hip.
4. Close the knee with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep weight in your heels and maintain a neutral spine
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Obesity/Overweight, Osteoarthritis

Health benefit: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and tibialis anterior activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and bring the soles of your feet together with knees bent.
2. Hold your feet and let your knees fall outward toward the floor.
3. Relax and gently draw your heels toward your groin to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep your core engaged and lift the heel with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with one leg extended and the other leg bent to the side.
2. Reach and grasp the toes of the extended foot with both hands.
3. Pull the toes toward your shin to dorsiflex the foot and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Stabilize the pelvis and open the knee without rotating your torso

Health benefit: Increases hip adductor flexibility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Imagine a clock in front of you and lift one arm to reach toward 12 o'clock.
3. Sweep the same arm slowly to 3, 6, and 9 o'clock while keeping your torso still.
4. Return the arm to center and repeat the sequence with the other arm.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back on the mat and gently lower the knees using hip control

Health benefit: Improves calf muscle flexibility and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and several marbles on the floor by your toes.
2. Use your toes to grasp one marble and lift it toward your heel.
3. Drop the marble beside your foot and repeat with each toe, then switch feet.
Safety cue: Keep the knee straight, dorsiflex the ankle, and sit tall through the spine

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves toe dexterity
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat hip-width apart, and arms at your sides.
2. Exhale and gently tilt your pelvis to press your lower back into the floor.
3. Hold the tilt briefly while keeping your lower abs and glutes engaged.
4. Inhale to release to a neutral spine and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the arch lifted and use controlled toe movement to pick up the marbles

Health benefit: Improves gait stability and single leg balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forearms on the floor and elbows under your shoulders.
2. Press your forearms into the floor and lift your chest while keeping hips on the ground.
3. Draw your shoulder blades down and lengthen through the spine.
4. Lower your chest back down when ready.
Safety cue: Keep your gaze forward, engage your core, and place heel to toe with control

Health benefit: Promotes core engagement and pelvic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or floor with feet flat and spine neutral.
2. Drop your right ear toward your right shoulder without lifting the left shoulder.
3. Place your right hand on the left side of your head and gently guide your head closer to the shoulder.
4. Keep the left shoulder down, hold, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Flatten your lower back to the mat by gently engaging the lower abdominals

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and improves postural awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit cross-legged or on a chair with a tall spine and hands resting by your sides.
2. Reach your right arm up and rotate to thread it under your left arm toward the floor.
3. Lower your right shoulder and temple toward the ground and rest your right hand there.
4. Gently unwind the arm back to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and lift through the chest without overarching the low back

Health benefit: Improves upper neck and shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hinge forward at the hips, resting your other hand on your thigh for support and letting the working arm hang relaxed.
2. Keep the shoulder relaxed and allow the hanging arm to swing gently forward and backward using momentum.
3. Initiate small clockwise circles with the hanging arm, keeping movements controlled and smooth.
4. Reverse the direction and perform the same size counterclockwise circles for the same duration.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and tilt your head slowly toward the opposite shoulder

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a weight at your sides or place your hands on your shoulders for manual resistance.
2. Lift your shoulders straight up toward your ears in a controlled motion.
3. Pause briefly at the top while keeping your arms relaxed.
4. Lower your shoulders fully back down to the starting position.
Safety cue: Rotate from your midback with controlled motion and keep hips squared forward

Health benefit: Promotes gentle shoulder mobility and movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with elbows bent at 90 and press your elbows gently against your ribs while holding a short towel between your hands.
2. Squeeze the towel and rotate your forearms outward, keeping your elbows pinned to your sides.
3. Hold the externally rotated position briefly while maintaining the towel squeeze.
4. Slowly return your forearms to the neutral starting position.
Safety cue: Let the arm hang and make small controlled shoulder circles without shrugging

Health benefit: Enhances external rotator strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on a mat and place forearms shoulder-width apart with elbows under shoulders.
2. Walk your knees back slightly and rest weight on your knees while keeping hips lifted.
3. Lengthen your spine and form a straight line from head to knees.
4. Press forearms into the floor and hold the position.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tucked to your sides and rotate forearms outward with steady control

Health benefit: Improves wrist and forearm flexibility for better hand positioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearm and palm against the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the doorway until you feel a stretch across the front of the chest and shoulder.
3. Keep your torso upright and hold the stretch, then switch arms.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens core muscles and enhances postural stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels with knees hip-width apart.
2. Reach your arms behind you along the mat and clasp your hands or place palms near your heels.
3. Lower your chest toward your thighs while lengthening the sides of your torso.
4. Soften your shoulders away from your ears and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases chest flexibility and promotes open shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step your right foot to the right and shift your weight onto it.
3. Bring your left foot to meet your right with a light tap.
4. Repeat the movement to the left and continue alternating steadily.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and gently retract the shoulder blade before leaning into the stretch

Health benefit: Improves latissimus mobility and upper back reach
Steps to perform:
1. Lie flat on your back with legs straight and arms by your sides.
2. Engage your core and lift both legs a few inches off the floor while keeping them straight.
3. Hold the position with steady breathing for the desired time.
Safety cue: Press hips back toward heels and reach arms back while maintaining a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and enhances hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left thigh just above the knee to form a figure four.
3. Thread your hands through the gap and grasp the back of your left thigh or shin.
4. Gently pull your left leg toward your chest and hold, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with the knee bent and the heel resting on the floor.
2. Place your hand on the outer edge of the forefoot to provide gentle resistance.
3. Push the forefoot outward against your hand while keeping the heel down.
4. Return to neutral slowly and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift with control from the outer hip to avoid rolling backward

Health benefit: Strengthens ankle evertors and supports lateral ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat hip-width apart and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Press the heel and ball of the foot into the floor and lift the medial arch without curling the toes.
3. Hold the lifted arch for a few seconds and then relax before repeating.
Safety cue: Stabilize the lower leg and move the foot slowly against resistance with toes pointing forward

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees soft.
2. Shift weight onto the balls of the feet and rise into a controlled calf raise.
3. Roll the weight back onto the heels and lift the toes off the floor.
4. Repeat the toe-to-heel transitions in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates foot intrinsic muscles to support arch integrity
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Brace your core and extend your right arm forward and left leg back until they are level with your body.
3. Keep hips and shoulders square and maintain a neutral spine while holding.
4. Slowly return to hands and knees and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Lift the arch while keeping toes relaxed and weight evenly distributed between heel and toe

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and dynamic balance during weight shifts
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Hug one knee to your chest using both hands behind the shin while keeping the other leg relaxed on the ground.
3. Hold briefly, then lower the leg back to the start position and switch sides.
Safety cue: Roll slowly from heel to toe with an upright spine and soft knees

Health benefit: Develops core stability and coordinated spinal movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright with shoulders relaxed and chin tucked slightly.
2. Place both hands on the back of your head and press your head backward into your hands without allowing movement.
3. Hold the tension for the set duration, then relax and release the pressure.
Safety cue: Brace your core and extend limbs slowly while keeping hips steady to avoid pelvic rotation

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and gently lengthens lower back muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with legs crossed and hands resting at your sides.
2. Reach your right arm overhead and lean your torso to the left, keeping hips grounded.
3. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens neck extensor muscles and supports head control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Swing your right arm across your body to the left while rotating your torso and letting the left arm swing back.
3. Continue alternating arms in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep chin tucked and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk flexibility and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with feet touching the wall and hands under your shoulders.
2. Walk your feet up the wall while simultaneously walking your hands closer to the wall.
3. Continue until your chest is near the wall or you reach a vertical position.
4. Reverse the movement by walking your hands back and lowering your feet to return to plank.
Safety cue: Anchor hips and hinge from the waist with a long spine

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and dynamic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the top arm bent 90 at the elbow and the forearm resting against your abdomen.
2. Keep the elbow tucked to your side and rotate the forearm upward toward the ceiling while keeping the elbow fixed.
3. Pause briefly at the top, then slowly lower the forearm back to the start.
4. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions with controlled tempo.
Safety cue: Control arm speed and maintain tall posture with a braced core

Health benefit: Builds shoulder and core strength while challenging balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with your elbows bent at 90 and forearms parallel to the floor, palms facing down.
2. Rotate both forearms to turn the palms upward (supination) while keeping the elbows stationary.
3. Rotate back to turn the palms downward (pronation) with controlled motion.
4. Continue alternating smoothly for the chosen repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders packed and move slowly with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves forearm rotational control and wrist functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart and hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
2. Bend the elbows to about 90 and lift the upper arms out to the sides so they align with your shoulders.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blades together and hold the contracted position, keeping the neck neutral.
4. Maintain the isometric hold for the desired duration while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep wrist neutral and rotate from the forearm with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Promotes upper body strength while modifying wrist loading
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy doorway and grasp the frame at waist height with both hands.
2. Walk your feet forward and lean back until your arms are straight and your body forms a plank angle.
3. Pull your chest toward the frame by bending your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Slowly extend your arms and lean back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Press through the knuckles while keeping a neutral spine and stable scapulae

Health benefit: Activates posterior shoulder muscles to support scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Tuck your chin and draw your knees toward your chest while reaching forward with your arms.
3. Roll your torso forward along your spine until you come up to a seated or prone position.
4. Reverse the motion in a controlled way to return to the supine start.
Safety cue: Maintain a soft bend in the elbows and squeeze the shoulder blades together

Health benefit: Enhances spine mobility and full body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your legs straight and toes pointed.
2. Bend your knees to curl your heels toward your glutes while squeezing your hamstrings.
3. Hold the top briefly with control.
4. Slowly lower your feet back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Engage the core and articulate the spine slowly while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and improves knee flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Extend your arms out to the sides for stability.
3. Slowly lower both knees together to one side until you feel a gentle rotation in your hips.
4. Return your knees to center and repeat the movement to the other side.
Safety cue: Press your hips into the bench and curl the heel with controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and supports functional hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet hip-width apart and flat on the floor.
2. Press through the balls of your feet and lift your heels as high as possible.
3. Pause at the top, then lower your heels slowly back to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hip and keep the torso tall while using the support

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and gaze forward.
2. Shift your weight onto one foot and lift the opposite foot off the floor by bending the knee.
3. Keep the standing knee soft and your hips level while maintaining balance with eyes open.
4. Hold the position, then lower your foot and switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Anchor your pelvis and rotate the knees slowly with steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and enhances ankle plantarflexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and a towel spread under your toes.
2. Press your heels into the floor and curl your toes to scrunch the towel toward you.
3. Keep your heels planted and extend your toes to push the towel back out.
4. Repeat the scrunch-and-release motions with steady control.
Safety cue: Press through the balls of the feet and lift the heels with control

Health benefit: Improves foot intrinsic strength and supports arch stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Extend both arms straight up toward the ceiling with palms facing each other.
3. Slowly lower one arm overhead toward the floor while keeping your ribs and hips still.
4. Return the arm to center and repeat with the other arm in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Anchor the heel and curl the toes deliberately to pull the towel

Health benefit: Improves dynamic balance and gait coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Come to hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Drop your belly, lift your chest and tailbone to arch the spine into cow.
3. Round your back, tuck your chin and tailbone to create a cat position; flow between both.
Safety cue: Take slow heel-to-toe steps and maintain an upright posture

Health benefit: Enhances deep core activation and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Tuck your chin gently toward your chest to lengthen the back of the neck.
3. Lift your head a few inches off the ground while keeping the chin tucked.
4. Lower your head slowly back down with control.
Safety cue: Press the low back into the floor and move the arms slowly with control

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle trunk flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Reach one arm underneath the opposite arm and slide the shoulder and ear toward the floor.
3. Rotate your torso to open the chest while keeping hips facing the floor.
4. Return the arm to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Move through full spinal flexion and extension with deep, steady breaths

Health benefit: Improves neck posture and strengthens neck stabilizing muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the bottom shoulder stacked and the bottom elbow bent to 90 degrees in front of you.
2. Use your top hand to gently press the bottom forearm down toward the floor until you feel a mild stretch in the back of the shoulder.
3. Keep hips and knees stacked and relax into the stretch, then release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin and lift the head while maintaining a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a waist-high table with feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your nearest hand flat on the table at hip level.
3. Shift weight into the hand and slide it slowly sideways along the table while keeping your torso upright.
4. Reverse the slide back to the start and repeat controlled.
Safety cue: Rotate through the thoracic spine slowly while keeping the low back stable

Health benefit: Improves shoulder internal rotation and flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and head against a wall and feet a few inches away.
2. Bend your elbows slightly and let your arms rest by your sides or in a goalpost position.
3. Draw your shoulder blades down and together without shrugging or bending your elbows.
4. Hold the squeeze briefly then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Anchor the shoulder blade and rotate the arm with controlled motion

Health benefit: Promotes lateral shoulder mobility and controlled scapular movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand perpendicular to a wall and place your palm and inner forearm flat on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Keep the arm straight and slowly rotate your chest away from the wall.
3. Stop when you feel a gentle stretch in the front of your upper arm.
4. Hold briefly then return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Slide the arm laterally with the elbow close and avoid shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and supports upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your forearm supported on a flat surface and your hand hanging off the edge, palm neutral.
2. Keep the forearm still and move the wrist slowly toward the thumb side (radial deviation).
3. Reverse the motion and move the wrist toward the little-finger side (ulnar deviation), then repeat.
Safety cue: Press your shoulder blades gently into the wall while keeping your ribs down

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your forehead on folded hands and arms extended overhead in a Y, thumbs pointing up.
2. Lift both arms a few inches off the floor by squeezing the shoulder blades together and keeping the thumbs up.
3. Lower the arms slowly to the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Move the wrist slowly through a comfortable range while keeping the forearm supported

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and shoulder stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width apart and toes slightly turned out.
2. Bend at the hips and knees to lower into a shallow squat while keeping weight over the heels.
3. Lightly touch the seat with your butt or hover just above it without fully sitting down.
4. Press through the heels to stand tall and repeat.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips, keep the neck neutral, and lift using your shoulder blades

Health benefit: Promotes cardiovascular activity and improves balance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked and knees bent at about 45 degrees.
2. Rest your head on your arm and bring your heels together.
3. Keeping feet touching, lift the top knee toward the ceiling by opening the hip.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Stand tall, engage your core, and march with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Strengthens hip external rotators and glute muscles for improved lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with the soles of your feet together and knees dropping outward.
2. Hold your feet or ankles and draw your heels toward your groin.
3. Press your knees gently toward the floor using your elbows.
4. Lean forward slightly from the hips while keeping a straight back.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced as you open the knee

Health benefit: Challenges static balance and enhances postural control in narrow stance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall beside a stable support and place one hand lightly on it for balance.
2. Shift your weight onto the standing leg and engage your core.
3. Lift the outside leg straight out to the side to hip height with toes pointing forward.
4. Lower the leg slowly with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, soften the knees, and focus your gaze forward

Health benefit: Promotes calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion for improved walking mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Draw your belly button toward your spine and tuck your tailbone to flatten the lower back.
3. Hold the tilt for 2-3 seconds while breathing normally.
4. Release to a neutral spine and repeat.
Safety cue: Press the back heel down and keep the back leg straight for a steady stretch

Health benefit: Activates deep abdominal muscles to enhance pelvic alignment and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your right ear toward your right shoulder using only your neck muscles.
3. Apply gentle pressure with your right hand if you need more range.
4. Return to center and repeat on the left side.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis by engaging the core and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal elongation and relaxation while stretching the hips and back
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Keep your hips facing forward and rotate your chest to the right using your thoracic spine.
3. Pause at the end range while maintaining an upright posture.
4. Return to center and repeat to the left.
Safety cue: Reach the hips back toward the heels and breathe while maintaining a long spine

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Keep a soft bend in the elbows and make small controlled circles forward using only your shoulders.
3. Continue for the chosen count then reverse the direction.
4. Keep your core engaged and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from the mid back with control

Health benefit: Improves shoulder elevation strength and upper trapezius engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways next to a wall with the elbow bent at 90 and the upper arm at your side.
2. Place your palm or forearm against the wall and press inward without moving the elbow.
3. Hold the press for 10-20 seconds while maintaining steady tension.
4. Relax and repeat on the other side if needed.
Safety cue: Lift straight up and lower slowly without shrugging the neck

Health benefit: Builds internal shoulder stability and rotator cuff endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and make fists, placing your knuckles flat on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Lift your torso so your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Brace your core and squeeze your glutes while breathing evenly.
4. Hold for the chosen duration then lower your knees to rest.
Safety cue: Keep elbow pinned to your side and press inward without shrugging

Health benefit: Builds core strength and promotes shoulder and spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Place your arms against the wall in a "V" at about 30-45 degrees with elbows bent.
3. Slowly slide your arms upward along the wall until they are overhead or as high as you can while keeping contact.
4. Pause, then slowly slide your arms back down to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to knees and brace the core

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and functional shoulder elevation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and knees at about 90 degrees.
2. Press your heel into the floor and tighten the quadriceps to attempt to straighten the knee a few degrees without lifting the foot.
3. Hold the slight extension for a short count while keeping the thigh engaged.
4. Slowly relax the muscle and return to the starting relaxed position.
Safety cue: Keep forearms against the wall and slide in the scapular plane without shrugging

Health benefit: Increases low-intensity cardiovascular activity and lateral movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart a short distance from the wall.
2. Slide your back down the wall until your knees form a high-angle bend (less than a deep squat) with hips and shoulders touching the wall.
3. Hold the position with core engaged and weight through your heels.
4. Press through your heels and slide up the wall to return to standing.
Safety cue: Step with control, keep chest up and avoid letting the knees collapse inward

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall near a wall or chair for balance.
2. Shift weight onto the supporting leg and lift the other leg slightly to the side with the knee straight.
3. Press the lifted leg outward into your hand or imagined resistance without letting the leg move.
4. Hold the press while keeping hips level and breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Keep the thigh stable and extend the knee with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Lift one forefoot to tap the floor a short distance forward, then return that foot to flat.
3. Alternate feet in a steady rhythm while keeping your torso still.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and abduct the leg without leaning your torso

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with feet flat and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Lift your toes while keeping your heels pressed down and spread your toes as wide as possible.
3. Hold the spread briefly, then relax your toes and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace your core and tap the foot deliberately without bouncing

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one hand lightly on a wall and place one foot directly in front of the other heel-to-toe.
2. Shift weight onto the front foot in a controlled manner while keeping your gaze forward and the supporting hand on the wall.
3. Bring the back foot forward to meet the front foot while maintaining upright posture.
4. Repeat heel-to-toe steps, alternating the leading foot each time.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee slightly bent and control each touch to the wall

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves toe dexterity
Steps to perform:
1. Begin on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Slide your right arm straight forward along the floor while sliding your left leg straight back, keeping hips level.
3. Hold the extended position briefly with core engaged.
4. Slide both limbs back to the start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep the heel grounded and actively spread the toes while maintaining a neutral ankle

Health benefit: Improves cervical posture and head alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable surface and place one hand lightly on it for balance.
2. Shift weight onto the supporting leg and hinge slightly at the hip.
3. Swing the free leg forward and then backward in a controlled pendulum motion while keeping your torso still.
Safety cue: Retract chin and glide the head straight back while keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Get on hands and knees in a tabletop position with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Brace your core and keep your spine neutral.
3. Slide the right knee out to the side along the floor while keeping the foot in contact, then slide it back.
4. Repeat for desired reps and then switch to the left leg.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips and rotate your chest while keeping the pelvis square

Health benefit: Strengthens core stability and improves trunk endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and a slight bend in the knees.
2. Step the right foot out to the side while keeping your weight centered.
3. Bring the left foot to meet the right with a controlled movement and maintain a soft knee bend.
4. Continue stepping side to side at a steady, low-impact pace.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral mobility and supports balance with low joint stress
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and toes relaxed.
2. Tighten one thigh muscle and press the back of that knee gently toward the floor.
3. Hold the contraction for 5-10 seconds, relax, and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Take controlled side steps with knees slightly bent and weight centered over your feet

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and promotes hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one leg in front and the other to the side, both knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Square your hips and keep your torso upright.
3. Lean forward over the front shin to deepen the front hip stretch.
4. Rotate your torso and lean over the back leg to mobilize the rear hip, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds hip abductor strength and improves pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and lift one foot off the ground.
2. Point the toes and slowly trace large circles with your ankle in a controlled motion.
3. Reverse the direction of the circles and repeat with the other ankle.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and avoid rotating the torso as you lift the top leg

Health benefit: Promotes ankle mobility and enhances proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit and cross one foot over the opposite knee.
2. Grasp the toes and gently pull them back toward your shin until you feel a stretch along the arch.
3. Hold briefly, release, and repeat on the other foot.
Safety cue: Move only the foot from the ankle joint and control the motion throughout

Health benefit: Improves single leg stability and neuromuscular balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright with feet together and eyes focused ahead.
2. Place the heel of one foot directly in front of the toes of the other on an imaginary line.
3. Walk forward slowly, placing each foot heel-to-toe and keeping steady balance.
4. Keep arms relaxed at your sides or extended for balance and continue with controlled steps.
Safety cue: Keep a soft bend in the standing knee and maintain an upright posture

Health benefit: Improves plantar fascia flexibility and supports foot mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and the other leg extended straight.
2. Place your hands lightly behind your head or across your chest and keep your neck neutral.
3. Exhale and lift only your head, neck, and shoulder blades a few inches off the floor.
4. Inhale and slowly lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Pull the toes toward the shin and keep the foot aligned with a relaxed ankle

Health benefit: Enhances gait coordination and challenges dynamic balance while walking
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with big toes touching and knees spread comfortably apart.
2. Fold forward and lower your torso onto your thighs while stretching your arms forward or alongside your body.
3. Rest your forehead or chest on the floor and remain in the position while relaxing your muscles.
Safety cue: Take small controlled steps and place each foot heel to toe while staying upright

Health benefit: Improves upper trapezius flexibility and neck range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on a mat with forehead resting and arms by your sides, palms down.
2. Keep your neck neutral and squeeze your shoulder blades together without shrugging.
3. Lift only your chest slightly by letting the shoulder blades retract, keeping arms relaxed.
4. Hold briefly and then relax back to the start.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder down and spine long while tilting the head toward the opposite shoulder

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and spinal rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to a wall and place your closest hand on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step the far foot away from the wall and push your hips out so your body forms a diagonal.
3. Move the hand laterally along the wall while stepping the feet sideways to follow.
4. Continue walking sideways for the desired distance, then reverse to return.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and rotate through the thoracic spine with control

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and improves posterior shoulder alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms by your sides, thumbs pointing forward.
2. Raise both arms in the scapular plane about 30-45 from your body up to shoulder height.
3. Lower your arms slowly back to the start with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades together without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Builds shoulder mobility and active upper extremity coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Hold a rolled towel lengthwise in one hand.
2. Squeeze the towel as hard as possible with your fingers and thumb.
3. Hold the squeeze for 5-10 seconds.
4. Release slowly and repeat before switching hands.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hand grip strength and forearm muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with legs extended and forehead on the floor.
2. Place your arms alongside your torso with palms facing down.
3. Lift your chest and arms a few inches off the floor while squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Hold for 5-10 seconds, then lower and repeat.
Safety cue: Grip the towel firmly using fingers and thumb without tensing the forearm excessively

Health benefit: Develops chest and triceps activation with reduced load on joints
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and arms relaxed at waist height.
2. Step your right foot to the right about shoulder-width and bend your knees slightly.
3. Bring your left foot to meet your right and tap the floor while moving your arms low to the right.
4. Repeat the same motion to the left side, alternating rhythmically.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and lower with controlled elbows close to the body

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and lower body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a firm chair with feet flat and knees bent.
2. Straighten one knee a few inches by contracting the front thigh, keeping a small bend.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly, then lower the foot slowly.
4. Repeat for desired reps, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Step laterally with controlled weight transfer and keep the chest lifted

Health benefit: Activates quadriceps to improve knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on hips.
2. Step one foot back into a long lunge while keeping the front knee over the ankle.
3. Tilt your pelvis forward and shift hips until you feel a stretch in the front of the back hip.
4. Keep your torso upright, hold the stretch, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Support the thigh and contract the quad to extend the knee with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor endurance and promotes circulation in lower limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and knees at about 90 degrees.
2. Press through the balls of both feet to lift your heels as high as possible.
3. Pause at the top, then lower your heels slowly back to the floor.
4. Repeat for desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and lift each knee slowly without leaning back

Health benefit: Builds calf muscle strength and supports ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with bare feet flat and a towel laid on the floor under your toes.
2. Extend your toes forward and then curl them to hook the towel edge.
3. Pull the towel toward you by flexing your toes while keeping heels down.
4. Release the towel and repeat the curl-and-pull motion in control.
Safety cue: Press through the balls of the feet and lift the heels with controlled ankle alignment

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and functional sit to stand ability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands on your hips.
2. Tuck your tailbone and draw your belly button toward your spine to flatten the lower back.
3. Release the tuck and arch your lower back slightly while lifting the chest.
4. Alternate the posterior and anterior tilts in a slow, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and improves side stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and head facing forward.
2. Place your right hand gently against the right side of your head.
3. Press your head into your hand while resisting movement with your hand for a few seconds.
4. Switch sides and repeat the resisted press on the left side.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbow and lift hips into a straight line while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips, keeping a neutral spine.
2. Brace your core and press your palms into the floor.
3. Slowly slide your hands forward while keeping hips and torso steady.
4. Pause at end range, then pull your hands back under your shoulders.
Safety cue: Sit tall and extend through the thoracic spine while keeping the core braced

Health benefit: Promotes scapular control and shoulder girdle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and place a rolled towel under your upper arm near the elbow.
2. Tuck your elbow against your side and rest your forearm across your belly.
3. Rotate your forearm upward toward the ceiling while keeping the elbow fixed to your side.
4. Lower your forearm back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back and avoid shrugging toward the ears

Health benefit: Enhances scapular mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with elbow bent 90 at your side and make a fist with the thumb pointing up.
2. Keep the elbow stationary and rotate your forearm so the palm faces up.
3. Rotate back to the starting hammer-grip position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral pelvis and slide the shoulders forward with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder external rotators and improves rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Place forearms on the mat shoulder-width apart and set knees on the floor under hips.
2. Engage your core and keep a straight line from head to knees without sagging or arching.
3. Hold the position while breathing steadily for the desired time.
4. Lower hips gently to the mat to rest.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow tucked to the side and rotate slowly while stabilizing the shoulder blade

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and enhances trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and shoulders relaxed.
2. Draw your chin straight back toward the spine without tilting the head up or down.
3. Hold the tucked position for a few seconds while breathing evenly.
4. Release slowly and return to neutral.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to hips and brace the core

Health benefit: Promotes cervical alignment and deep neck muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, and place elbows bent at 90 degrees by your sides.
2. Press your lower back into the floor and keep elbows and wrists lightly touching the ground.
3. Slowly slide your arms outward and upward within a comfortable range while maintaining contact.
4. Return arms to the starting position with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Gently retract the chin keeping eyes level and lengthen the back of the neck

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor activation and circulation through rhythmic seated movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with back straight and feet flat.
2. Extend your right leg until the knee is nearly straight and hold briefly.
3. Lower the right leg with control and immediately extend the left leg.
4. Continue alternating legs in a steady, controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Sit tall with hips back and lift knees alternately with controlled breath

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps activation and knee joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs straight and toes pointing up.
2. Squeeze the front of one thigh and press the back of the knee gently into the floor.
3. Hold the contraction for a few seconds.
4. Relax and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and back against the chair while extending the knee slowly

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps engagement and improves knee stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Shift weight onto your left leg and keep it slightly bent.
3. Lift your right leg a few inches out to the side with toes pointing forward.
4. Lower the right leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Squeeze the thigh and press the knee into the mat while keeping the pelvis level

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductor muscles and enhances lateral pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the edge of a chair and bring the soles of your feet together.
2. Hold your feet with your hands and let your knees fall open to the sides.
3. Keep your spine straight and gently press your elbows on your inner thighs.
4. Breathe calmly and maintain the position for several slow breaths.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips square and lift the leg without tilting the pelvis

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift one foot and tap the toes to the floor in front of you, then return to the start.
3. Alternate feet at a controlled, steady pace.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Engages lower abdominal muscles and promotes ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand behind a sturdy chair and place both hands lightly on the backrest for support.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and bend the standing knee slightly.
3. Lift the other foot and place the toes beside the ankle or against the inner calf of the standing leg.
4. Hold your balance, then lower the raised foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the low back neutral and lower each toe with control while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Challenges balance and improves single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with one leg extended and the other knee bent.
2. Loop a strap around the ball of the extended foot and hold the ends with both hands.
3. Keep the knee straight and gently pull the strap to flex the foot toward you.
4. Hold the stretch while breathing evenly, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and a soft support knee while lightly touching the chair for balance

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot in front of the other and set both feet wider than hip-width.
2. Plant both feet evenly and align your hips and shoulders forward.
3. Soften your knees slightly and engage your core to stabilize.
4. Keep your gaze forward and hold, then repeat with the opposite foot forward.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates deep core muscles and promotes coordinated lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie prone with your legs extended and forearms on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Press your forearms down and lift your chest into a gentle, low backbend.
3. Lengthen through your spine, relax your shoulders away from your ears, and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core as you lift each knee slowly

Health benefit: Encourages gentle spinal extension and supports upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and shoulders relaxed.
2. Interlace fingers and place palms on your forehead for gentle support.
3. Tuck your chin and nod your head forward slowly against the hands.
4. Return to neutral with control and repeat as needed.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge forward at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor.
2. Rest your non-working hand on your thigh for support.
3. Let the working arm hang relaxed and swing it in small controlled circles.
4. Reverse the circle direction after several rotations.
Safety cue: Keep the top hip stacked and rotate the shoulder with slow control

Health benefit: Promotes gentle shoulder joint mobility and fluid movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hips and knees bent to 90 degrees and toes lightly touching the floor.
2. Press your lower back gently into the mat and engage your core.
3. Slide one heel along the floor diagonally away from your body while keeping your hips stable.
4. Return the heel to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular control and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand side-on to a wall with the elbow of the working arm bent at 90 degrees.
2. Place the outer forearm and elbow against the wall at shoulder height.
3. Press your elbow outward into the wall without moving your torso.
4. Maintain the press and breathe steadily while keeping the shoulder engaged.
Safety cue: Brace the core and slide the hand diagonally without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and muscular endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and extend one arm with the palm up and fingers pointing toward the ceiling.
2. Place the palm and fingers flat on the wall at shoulder height.
3. Lean your body forward slowly until you feel a stretch along the inner forearm.
4. Keep the elbow straight and breathe steadily while holding the stretch.
Safety cue: Press evenly into the wall keeping the shoulder blades down and avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Strengthens core and lateral trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a corner and place your forearms or palms on each wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward to create a staggered stance.
3. Lean your torso forward until you feel a stretch across the chest.
4. Keep your shoulders down and breathe steadily while holding the position.
Safety cue: Lift the hips and maintain a straight line from knees to shoulders

Health benefit: Opens chest and improves anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on the floor with legs straight and arms extended overhead in a Y shape.
2. Keep your neck neutral and gaze toward the floor.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your arms off the floor into the Y until the upper back engages.
4. Lower your arms with control until they lightly touch the floor and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances upper back strength and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and knees soft.
2. Step your right foot to the right, then bring your left foot to meet it and tap lightly.
3. Continue stepping side to side at a steady pace and swing your arms naturally.
Safety cue: Keep your gaze down and lift from the shoulder blades without overextending the neck

Health benefit: Promotes knee and hip mobility through controlled flexion and extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips and knees bent to about 90 degrees and feet stacked.
2. Keep your feet together and lift the top knee upward by opening the hip while keeping the pelvis stable.
3. Lower the knee with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Slide the heel with control and keep the pelvis stable

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Keep both shoulders down and slowly drop both knees to one side.
3. Pause while feeling the gentle rotation in your hips and lower back.
4. Bring knees back to center and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and avoid rolling the pelvis backward

Health benefit: Improves hip joint mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and knees bent 90 degrees.
2. Lift one foot slightly off the floor and turn the sole inward at the ankle.
3. Hold the inward position briefly while keeping the rest of the leg still.
4. Return the foot to neutral and repeat with the other ankle.
Safety cue: Move slowly and keep the lower back gently pressed to the floor

Health benefit: Targets ankle muscles to improve inversion control and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a stable surface for balance.
2. Shift your weight back and lift your toes so your heels bear your weight.
3. Shift your weight forward and lift your heels so your toes bear your weight.
4. Alternate rocking between heels and toes with slow, controlled movements.
Safety cue: Stabilize the shin and invert the foot with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances ankle flexibility and balance during weight transfers
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand with bare feet flat on the floor and weight evenly distributed.
2. Spread your toes and press the ball of the foot into the floor.
3. Curl your toes downward to grip the floor and lift the arch slightly.
4. Hold the curl briefly, then relax and repeat.
Safety cue: Shift weight slowly with soft knees and an upright torso

Health benefit: Activates foot intrinsic muscles to support arch stability and toe control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot on an imaginary straight line and shoulders over hips.
2. Step forward placing the heel of the front foot directly in front of the toes of the back foot on the line.
3. Keep hips level and eyes forward while maintaining balance.
4. Continue walking heel-to-toe along the line and switch leading foot.
Safety cue: Keep toes relaxed and curl from the ball of the foot with control

Health benefit: Challenges dynamic balance and improves lateral foot placement accuracy
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Brace your core and extend one arm straight forward to shoulder height.
3. Keep hips and legs stationary and maintain a neutral spine.
4. Retract the arm under control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Take small controlled steps while keeping an upright posture

Health benefit: Encourages spinal mobility and gentle movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and one hand placed behind your back.
2. Rotate your head about 45 degrees away from the side you want to stretch.
3. Tuck your chin and tilt your head down toward the opposite armpit.
4. Use the free hand to gently guide the head deeper into the stretch.
Safety cue: Move the spine smoothly with steady breaths and soft knees

Health benefit: Improves neck lateral mobility and muscle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Place one hand behind your head while keeping the other hand firmly planted.
3. Rotate your torso to lift the elbow of the hand behind your head toward the ceiling.
4. Rotate back to bring that elbow down and thread it under your torso toward the opposite hand.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and shoulder blade down

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine rotation and core coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright and extend one arm straight across your chest.
2. Reach the opposite hand to grasp the extended arm near the upper arm or elbow.
3. Pull the arm gently across your chest while keeping your shoulders relaxed.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and rotate through the upper back slowly

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and upward rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides, thumbs pointing up.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and lift both arms diagonally in the scapular plane to shoulder height.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and pause briefly at the top.
4. Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and walk the hands up the wall with controlled motion

Health benefit: Enhances wrist extension flexibility and forearm muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Place your fists shoulder-width apart on the floor and extend your legs behind you into a straight line.
2. Engage your core and glutes to keep hips level and maintain a neutral neck.
3. Breathe evenly while holding a rigid plank position.
4. Lower your knees to the ground and push back to a resting position when finished.
Safety cue: Keep the elbow extended and gently pull the wrist back until you feel a stretch

Health benefit: Develops core endurance while maintaining wrist alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hinge at the hips with a soft bend in the knees.
2. Let your arms hang toward the floor with palms facing each other and keep a neutral spine.
3. Open your arms out to the sides by squeezing your shoulder blades until your arms are roughly parallel to the ground.
4. Slowly return your arms to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and brace the core to prevent sagging

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder muscles and improves scapular retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy door and grasp the edge or handles at waist height.
2. Lean back with straight arms, bracing your core and angling your body.
3. Pull your elbows toward your ribs and squeeze your shoulder blades, holding the position.
4. Release slowly and step back to reset.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances mid back strength and scapular stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart, knees soft, and hips slightly bent.
2. Take a slow, controlled step to the side by pushing off the opposite foot.
3. Follow with the other foot and maintain low, steady movement.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep elbows close, and press back against the door with steady tension

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and improves knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with your back straight and both feet flat on the floor.
2. Extend one leg until the knee is straight and toes point upward.
3. Hold the extended position, then lower slowly and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Sit tall and control the knee extension with a braced core

Health benefit: Activates hamstrings to enhance posterior thigh stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Dig one heel into the floor and tighten the back of your thigh.
3. Hold the contraction while keeping your hips and lower back still.
4. Release the muscle and relax before repeating on the other side.
Safety cue: Press the heel into the surface and keep the pelvis and low back stable

Health benefit: Improves hip abductor strength and lateral balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair and place one hand lightly on the back for support.
2. Shift weight onto the standing leg and lift the other leg straight out to the side without leaning.
3. Keep toes pointing forward and the lifted leg straight but not locked.
4. Lower the leg slowly to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift the leg to the side without leaning the torso

Health benefit: Increases hip external rotation mobility and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall near the edge of a chair and place one ankle over the opposite thigh so the ankle rests above the knee.
2. Keep your back straight and gently press the raised knee downward with your hand.
3. Lean forward from your hips until you feel a gentle stretch in the hip and glute.
4. Hold briefly and then return upright before switching sides.
Safety cue: Sit upright and hinge from the hips to keep the spine long during the stretch
