2. Brace your core and lower one foot toward the floor in a slow, controlled march while keeping the opposite knee at 90 degrees.
3. Return the lowered leg to the starting position and repeat on the other side without letting your lower back arch.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral lumbar spine and exhale as you lift each knee

Health benefit: Builds anterior core endurance and dynamic spinal stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and hold a dumbbell with both hands extended overhead while lifting your shoulders and legs into a hollow position.
2. Rock smoothly back toward your heels and then forward to the starting hollow while keeping your lower back pressed to the floor.
3. Maintain tight core tension and controlled breathing throughout each rock.
Safety cue: Squeeze ribs down and press lower back into mat for controlled rocking

Health benefit: Improves squat mechanics, hip mobility, and lower body strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and hold a dumbbell vertically at your chest in a goblet grip.
2. Sit back and down into a deep squat keeping your chest up and elbows inside your knees.
3. Use your elbows to push your knees outward (pry) to open the hips and deepen the squat.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and reset your goblet hold before the next rep.
Safety cue: Keep chest upright and knees tracking toes while driving hips back and down

Health benefit: Enhances chest muscle activation and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with palms facing each other and arms extended above your chest.
2. Keep a soft bend in both elbows and slowly lower your arms out to the sides until you feel a stretch in the chest.
3. Pause and hold the dumbbells steady at the lower position for the prescribed time.
4. Bring the dumbbells back together above your chest in a controlled motion and rack them safely.
Safety cue: Maintain slight elbow bend and retract shoulder blades

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and posterior chain mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart holding one dumbbell with both hands in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the knees and push your hips back as you lower the dumbbell toward your shins.
3. Keep your spine neutral and hold the lowest position where you feel the hamstrings engaged.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and place the dumbbell down safely.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keeping a neutral spine and chest lifted

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and oblique muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a bench holding a dumbbell in one hand beside your thigh and keep the other hand on your waist or thigh.
2. Slowly bend your torso toward the dumbbell side, sliding the weight down toward the knee while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Hold the lateral bend at the lowest comfortable point while maintaining a neutral spine.
4. Return to upright by contracting the opposite oblique and switch sides after completing the hold.
Safety cue: Keep ribs stacked over hips and brace core

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring lengthening and increased spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell with both hands in front of you.
2. Hinge at the hips and let the dumbbell hang toward the floor with a soft bend in the knees.
3. Relax your upper back and let your chest and head drop toward your thighs while keeping hold of the dumbbell.
4. Engage your glutes and drive through your heels to return to standing while keeping the dumbbell close to your legs.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips and maintain long spine while relaxing neck

Health benefit: Improves triceps and shoulder flexibility for better overhead range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and hold one dumbbell vertically overhead in your right hand.
2. Bend your right elbow and lower the dumbbell behind your head while keeping the upper arm close to your ear.
3. Reach your left hand to gently support the right elbow and deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and spine neutral while pressing elbow overhead

Health benefit: Enhances hip and ankle mobility while promoting squat depth control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hold one dumbbell at your chest with both hands in a goblet grip.
2. Squat down by pushing your hips back and keeping your chest up until you reach a deep squat.
3. Relax and breathe while holding the deep squat and keep the dumbbell close to your chest.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and ribs down with knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and spinal mobility with rotational loading
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, and hold a dumbbell with both hands across your chest.
2. Engage your core and slowly lower your knees together to one side while keeping both shoulders on the floor.
3. Pause at the end range, then use your core to bring your knees back to center.
4. Repeat the motion to the other side for desired reps.
Safety cue: Maintain a tall spine and inhale before rotating then exhale as you twist

Health benefit: Improves full body mobility and dynamic hip and thoracic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Step forward into a tall lunge and hold a dumbbell in the hand opposite your front leg.
2. Place your front-side hand on the floor inside your front foot and sink your hips toward the ground.
3. Rotate your torso and reach the dumbbell up toward the ceiling while following it with your eyes.
4. Return your hand to the floor, step back, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Brace core hinge at hips and control rotation while keeping shoulders down

Health benefit: Promotes scapular depression control and upper back mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with a dumbbell in one hand and your arm relaxed at your side.
2. Allow the weight to pull your shoulder down while keeping your chest lifted.
3. Tilt your head away from the weighted side to deepen the stretch, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Gently pull shoulder blade down and relax neck avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Increases hip and groin flexibility and improves adductor range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with the soles of your feet together and knees bent outward.
2. Hold a dumbbell vertically with both hands and place it on top of your feet or against your lower shins.
3. Hinge forward from the hips with a straight spine until you feel a stretch in the inner thighs.
4. Maintain the position and gently deepen the forward lean as tolerated.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and hinge forward from hips avoid rounding lower back

Health benefit: Enhances core strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat, holding one dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Lean back slowly from the hips until your torso reaches about a 45-degree angle while keeping your core engaged.
3. Return to an upright position by contracting your abs and control the movement.
Safety cue: Brace core and hinge from hips keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor in a shin box position with the front shin vertical and the back shin behind you.
2. Hold a dumbbell with both hands and rest it on your front thigh or across your hips.
3. Keep an upright chest and engage the hips as you rotate slightly toward the front leg.
4. Hold the position or perform small controlled lean-ins and lean-outs to load the hips.
Safety cue: Sit tall stack hips and shoulders control movement with slow transitions

Health benefit: Increases lat and shoulder mobility for improved overhead movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width and hold a light dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Reach your left arm overhead and hinge slightly at the hips while sliding the dumbbell down the outside of your right thigh.
3. Lean your torso toward the right to feel the lat stretch and breathe evenly.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep ribcage down and reach through the arm without arching lower back

Health benefit: Enhances hip extension and anterior hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Step your left foot forward into a low lunge and place your right knee on the floor while holding one dumbbell with both hands at chest height.
2. Tuck your pelvis under and shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the right hip.
3. Keep your torso upright and engage your core to stabilize the position.
4. Hold for the set time, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis chest upright keep front knee aligned over ankle

Health benefit: Strengthens oblique muscles and improves lateral trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in your right hand with your arm extended overhead.
2. Keep your hips square and slowly bend your torso to the left, lowering the dumbbell along the right side.
3. Pause when you feel a controlled stretch in the oblique, then use your obliques to pull back upright.
4. Switch the dumbbell to the left hand and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace core exhale and control the side bend without twisting torso

Health benefit: Improves thoracic spine mobility and upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your upper back supported on a bench or foam roller and plant your feet flat.
2. Hold one dumbbell across your chest with both hands.
3. Lean back over the support by hinging through the mid-back and let the weight assist the extension.
4. Extend the thoracic spine to lift your chest, control the return, and repeat.
Safety cue: Extend through thoracic spine with controlled motion, avoid collapsing lower back

Health benefit: Promotes anterior arm flexibility and shoulder extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a bench with feet flat and hold a light dumbbell in one hand with the palm facing up.
2. Extend that arm behind your torso with the elbow straight and let the dumbbell gently pull the hand downward.
3. Hold the stretch for the desired time, then switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep scapula depressed and spine long, avoid shrugging

Health benefit: Improves calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion for better gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with the balls of one foot on a low step or curb and hold a dumbbell at your side.
2. Keep the knee of the standing leg straight and slowly lower the heel below the step to feel a calf stretch.
3. Maintain an upright posture and hold the lowered position for the desired time.
4. Press the heel back up to the step to release the stretch and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep toes forward and heel anchored, avoid bouncing

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and side bending range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with legs crossed and hold a light dumbbell in the hand on the side to be stretched.
2. Reach the opposite arm overhead and lengthen the spine.
3. Lean away from the weighted side until you feel a lateral stretch in the lower flank.
4. Breathe and return to center before switching sides.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips and lengthen side body, avoid rotating torso

Health benefit: Promotes spinal elongation and gentle shoulder and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with knees wide and toes together and hold a light dumbbell with both hands extended forward.
2. Sit hips back toward your heels and fold your torso over your thighs while reaching the dumbbell along the floor.
3. Press the dumbbell into the mat to deepen the stretch and relax the chest.
4. Breathe and slowly lift the dumbbell as you return to a kneeling position.
Safety cue: Breathe deep and maintain neutral cervical spine, press hips back evenly

Health benefit: Improves forearm flexibility and grip comfort
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with forearm supported on your thigh or a bench and hold a light dumbbell with palm facing up.
2. Allow the weight to pull your wrist back until you feel a gentle stretch along the inner forearm.
3. Keep the elbow soft, hold the position, then slowly lift the dumbbell to release the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep elbow straight while slowly lowering the wrist into a controlled stretch

Health benefit: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. From all fours, slide one knee forward and place that shin under your torso while extending the opposite leg straight back.
2. Place a light dumbbell on top of the front thigh near the hip, square your hips, and lengthen your spine.
3. Hold the pose for the chosen time, remove the dumbbell, and press back into tabletop to switch sides.
Safety cue: Square hips forward while lengthening the spine and breathing evenly

Health benefit: Builds core stability and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and secure a light dumbbell between your feet near the arches.
2. Place your hands under your glutes and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Lift both legs to about a 45-degree angle and hold with the dumbbell secured.
4. Lower the legs slowly, remove the dumbbell, and rest.
Safety cue: Lift the weighted anchor leg with a neutral spine and braced core

Health benefit: Improves thoracic rotation and spinal mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with your arms extended to the sides and hold a light dumbbell in the hand on the same side as the leg you will rotate.
2. Engage your glutes, lift that leg, bend the knee, and rotate the foot across your back toward the opposite hand.
3. Return the leg to the start position, set the dumbbell down if needed, and repeat before switching sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a grounded pelvis and control rotation through the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Enhances anterior shoulder mobility and scapular awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on a bench with your chest supported and your arm hanging down holding a dumbbell in a neutral grip.
2. Keep a slight bend in the elbow and raise the dumbbell forward to shoulder height with controlled motion.
3. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the start position and reset before the next rep.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder blades depressed with core engaged to protect the anterior shoulder

Health benefit: Increases adductor flexibility and hip abduction range
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with soles together and knees dropped outward, holding a dumbbell across your thighs near the knees.
2. Sit tall and press the dumbbell gently down toward your thighs to apply light resistance.
3. Hinge forward from the hips with a straight back until you feel a stretch in the inner thighs.
4. Hold the stretch briefly, then release pressure and return to an upright seated position.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and hinge from hips to avoid lower back rounding

Health benefit: Improves trunk rotation and single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a half-kneeling stance with one knee on the floor and the front foot flat, holding a dumbbell with both hands at chest height.
2. Brace your core and rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping hips square and the dumbbell close to your chest.
3. Pause briefly at the end range while maintaining an upright posture.
4. Rotate back to center with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Anchor pelvis and rotate thorax while keeping hips facing forward

Health benefit: Enhances posterior chain activation and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Set a dumbbell handle across the base of both palms and place hands shoulder-width on the floor.
2. Tuck toes and lift hips to form a Down Dog, pressing palms down onto the dumbbell.
3. Hold the position while maintaining a long spine and steady breaths.
4. Lower hips back to the floor and remove the dumbbell.
Safety cue: Press through palms and drive hips back while lengthening the spine

Health benefit: Improves pectoral flexibility and upper chest mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Adjust an incline bench to 30-45 degrees and lie back with a light dumbbell in one hand.
2. Extend the arm out to the side with a slight elbow bend and lower the dumbbell until the chest opens.
3. Hold the stretch, then raise the arm back and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep shoulder blade down and back and avoid shrugging the working shoulder

Health benefit: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with one knee bent at 90 degrees and place a light dumbbell across the top of the foot near the toes.
2. Point the toes down to plantarflex and then pull the toes up to dorsiflex in a controlled motion.
3. Perform repeated smooth repetitions for the desired count.
4. Remove the dumbbell and repeat on the opposite ankle.
Safety cue: Stabilize shin over foot and move only at the ankle joint

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic mobility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your right side with knees bent and hold a light dumbbell in your top hand across your chest.
2. Place your lower arm on the floor and lift the top arm so the dumbbell points to the ceiling.
3. Rotate your torso and open the top arm across your body so the dumbbell moves toward the floor behind you.
4. Reverse the rotation and return the dumbbell to point toward the ceiling with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine not the lower back

Health benefit: Builds lateral hip strength and improves single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell at your chest with both hands in a goblet hold.
2. Step your right foot wide to the side and bend your right knee while keeping your left leg straight.
3. Sink your hips back and lower into a lateral lunge, holding the bottom position.
4. Press through your right foot to return to standing.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and knee tracking over toes, weight through heels
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease

Health benefit: Strengthens shoulder internal rotators and enhances joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your right side with your upper arm against your torso and elbow bent 90, holding a light dumbbell in your top hand.
2. Keep your elbow pinned to your side and rotate your forearm inward to bring the dumbbell toward your abdomen.
3. Pause briefly at the end range with control.
4. Slowly rotate outward to return the dumbbell to the starting neutral position.
Safety cue: Control the movement, keep elbow pinned to the side and forearm steady

Health benefit: Improves single leg stability and enhances core anti rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Set one foot forward and one foot back in a stable split stance about one stride apart.
2. Hold a dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands in a goblet or racked position.
3. Lower your hips slightly and settle into a static, upright position while keeping weight evenly distributed.
4. Maintain the hold for the desired time and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace core, distribute weight evenly between feet

Health benefit: Increases glute and posterior chain activation for hip extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Place a dumbbell across your hips and secure it with both hands.
3. Drive through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
4. Squeeze your glutes and hold the top position for the desired time while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes, keep ribs down and avoid overextending lower back
is_not_suitable_for: Sleep Apnea, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Heart Failure (Stable)

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and lumbar spine mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a light dumbbell with both hands in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips and slide the dumbbell down your shins toward your ankles while keeping your back long.
3. Relax your head and neck, reach toward your toes with the dumbbell, and hold the stretch while breathing.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with a long spine and controlled descent

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and supports improved upper back posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down on an incline bench with a light dumbbell in each hand and your arms hanging long.
2. Keep arms straight and pull your shoulder blades together to lift the dumbbells slightly by retracting the scapulae.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blades and hold the top position briefly.
4. Slowly lower the dumbbells by letting the shoulder blades spread and repeat.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades slowly keeping neck neutral and ribs stacked

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor flexibility and anterior chain mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with your back knee against a wall and place the same-side foot on the wall while holding a dumbbell in the hand on the back-leg side.
2. Tuck your pelvis and squeeze your glutes while pressing the back knee into the wall and raising the dumbbell overhead.
3. Maintain an upright torso and feel the front hip flexor lengthen.
4. Hold the stretch, then switch sides and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis and brace core to protect lower back

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and shoulder girdle opening
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand overhead with a neutral grip.
2. Brace your core and side-bend away from the dumbbell while keeping the opposite hand by your thigh.
3. Pause at the bottom to feel a lateral stretch along the ribs and obliques.
4. Slowly return to center and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep ribs anchored and hinge from the waist for controlled lateral bend

Health benefit: Improves hip external rotation mobility and promotes glute activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and place your right ankle across your left thigh into a figure-4; hold a dumbbell on top of the crossed shin near the ankle.
2. Drive through the left heel to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line, pressing the dumbbell into the crossed leg for resistance.
3. Lower your hips with control until your glutes touch the floor and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and hinge forward from hips to deepen safely

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral shoulder strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on your left leg and hold a dumbbell at shoulder height with your left hand; brace your core and keep a slight bend in the standing knee.
2. Press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is fully extended while maintaining balance on the standing leg.
3. Lower the dumbbell back to shoulder height with control and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Brace your core before pressing overhead

Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and improves hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your left foot forward and your right toes resting lightly on a low bench behind you while holding a dumbbell in the goblet position at your chest.
2. Sit back into the left hip and bend the left knee to lower into a squat until the thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through the left heel to stand upright while keeping the dumbbell at your chest, then repeat and switch legs.
Safety cue: Drive through your front heel on every rep

Health benefit: Builds core rotational strength and oblique control
Steps to perform:
1. Assume a side plank on your forearm with feet stacked and hold a dumbbell in the top hand.
2. Lift hips to form a straight line and raise the top arm holding the dumbbell toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate your torso and thread the dumbbell under your torso toward the floor without letting hips sag.
4. Reverse the movement and return the dumbbell to the ceiling with core engaged.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight spine while reaching under with control

Health benefit: Improves core anti rotation stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and press a dumbbell overhead with one arm, palm facing forward and elbow locked.
2. Brace your core and take small controlled steps forward while keeping the weight stabilized overhead.
3. Walk the prescribed distance or time while maintaining posture, then lower the dumbbell slowly to the shoulder.
Safety cue: Keep your shoulders level while walking

Health benefit: Promotes unilateral biceps strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and hold a dumbbell in the working hand at your side.
2. Keep your torso upright and curl the dumbbell toward your shoulder with controlled elbow flexion.
3. Lower the weight slowly to the start position and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Curl with a controlled tempo while standing tall on one leg

Exercise Name: DB Reverse Lunge to Knee Drive
Health benefit: Develops lower body strength and explosive hip drive
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Step one foot back into a controlled reverse lunge, lowering until the front thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through the front heel and lift the rear knee forward and up into a knee drive.
4. Reset briefly and repeat on the same leg or switch legs on the next rep.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and control the descent before driving the knee up

Health benefit: Increases core engagement and improves gait stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell in one hand at your side to create an offset load.
2. Brace the core and lift one knee up to hip level while keeping the torso upright and the weight steady.
3. Lower the foot back down with control and alternate knees in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips level as you slowly lift each knee

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and upper back while enhancing single leg stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg with a slight bend in the knee and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach the dumbbell toward the ground while extending the free leg behind to keep a straight spine.
3. Pull the dumbbell into a row by driving the elbow up toward the ribcage as you return the torso toward upright.
4. Lower the weight with control and repeat or switch sides after the set.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a flat back and control the row movement

Health benefit: Enhances grip strength and shoulder stability through controlled pressing
Steps to perform:
1. Hold a dumbbell bottoms-up at shoulder with the handle vertical and elbow tucked.
2. Brace your core and press the dumbbell straight overhead without letting the wrist collapse.
3. Lower the dumbbell slowly back to the shoulder while keeping the bottom-up orientation.
4. Repeat for reps then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep wrist stable and elbow close to maintain shoulder alignment

Health benefit: Improves lower body mobility and multi directional coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Hold a dumbbell at chest in a goblet or racked position and stand tall.
2. Step forward (or diagonally like a clock position) into a controlled lunge, lowering until the front knee tracks over the toes.
3. Push through the front heel to return to standing.
4. Repeat for reps, alternating clock positions and legs.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes and remain tall through the torso

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and shoulder girdle control through anti-rotation and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Place two dumbbells on the floor shoulder-width apart and adopt a bear hold with knees hovering and hands on the handles.
2. Brace your core and lift one hand to tap the opposite shoulder while keeping hips and torso stable.
3. Return the hand to the handle and repeat the tap with the other hand.
4. Continue alternating taps while maintaining a flat back and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips level during each shoulder tap

Health benefit: Improves unilateral shoulder stability and core bracing while challenging grip and posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and press a dumbbell overhead with one hand until the arm is straight.
2. Brace your core and keep a neutral spine and gaze forward.
3. Walk forward in controlled steps while keeping the dumbbell stable overhead.
4. Lower the dumbbell to your side under control and switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and shoulder packed while walking tall

Health benefit: Develops unilateral pressing strength and improves hip and trunk stability during overhead movement
Steps to perform:
1. Set into a half-kneeling position with the front foot planted and hold a dumbbell at shoulder level of the front arm.
2. Square your hips, brace your core, and keep your back upright.
3. Press the dumbbell overhead until the arm is fully extended.
4. Lower the dumbbell back to the shoulder with control and switch kneeling sides.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and glutes engaged to avoid lower back arch

Health benefit: Builds single-leg strength and balance while enhancing knee and hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and cradle a dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and bend the standing knee to lower into a single-leg squat while the other leg moves slightly back.
3. Keep your chest up and core engaged as you descend to a comfortable depth.
4. Drive through the heel to return to standing and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep knee tracking over toes and control the descent

Health benefit: Trains full-body coordination mobility and core stability through controlled transitional movement
Steps to perform:
1. DB Turkish Sit-Up: Lie on your back holding a dumbbell vertical in one hand with the same-side knee bent and the other leg extended.
2. Brace your core and use your free elbow to help sit up while keeping the dumbbell overhead.
3. Continue to rise to a tall kneel while keeping the dumbbell aligned over your shoulder.
4. Reverse the steps slowly to return to the starting lying position with control.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move slowly while maintaining scapular stability

Health benefit: Combines lower body power with rotational core engagement to improve coordinated strength
Steps to perform:
1. DB Squat to Rotational Press: Stand feet shoulder-width and hold a dumbbell at one shoulder with elbow tucked.
2. Sit back into a squat until your thighs are near parallel while keeping your chest upright.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and rotate your torso toward the dumbbell side.
4. Press the dumbbell overhead and lower it back to the shoulder under control.
Safety cue: Drive through heels keep chest lifted and rotate using a braced core

Health benefit: Enhances lateral shoulder strength and single-leg balance while promoting scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. DB Single-Leg Lateral Raise: Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand with a slight elbow bend.
2. Hinge at the hips and lift the arm out to the side until it is parallel to the floor while keeping balance.
3. Lower the dumbbell with control and repeat while keeping the standing knee soft and torso stable.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee soft and torso stable as you lift with slow control

Health benefit: Strengthens glute activation and single-leg hip extension improving posterior chain stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent, the other leg extended, and a dumbbell rested on your hips held with both hands.
2. Drive through the heel of the planted foot and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to extended heel.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and keep the dumbbell stable with your hands.
4. Lower your hips slowly to the mat and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Press through heel keep hips level and avoid arching lower back

Health benefit: Improves core anti-rotation strength and shoulder stability through dynamic plank transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Grasp a dumbbell in one hand and set into a high plank with feet wider than hip-width.
2. Rotate your torso and press the dumbbell toward the ceiling as you stack or stagger your feet into a side plank.
3. Return the dumbbell to the floor under control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a braced core and stacked shoulders as you rotate with control
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Health benefit: Develops rotational lower body strength and coordinated upper body pressing in multiple planes
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell at chest level with both hands in a goblet grip.
2. Step diagonally back and across into a transverse lunge, lowering until your front thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Drive through the front foot to stand and simultaneously press the dumbbell overhead until your arm is extended.
4. Lower the dumbbell to your chest with control and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Step across with knee tracking toes keep chest tall and press from core

Health benefit: Improves overhead pressing strength and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Brace your core and sit tall to keep an upright torso.
3. Press both dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and core braced as you press overhead

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand by your sides.
2. Step forward with one foot into a long lunge and lean your torso slightly forward over the front thigh.
3. Bend both knees until the front thigh is roughly parallel to the floor and the rear knee lowers toward the ground.
4. Drive through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips and keep chest proud to maintain neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances core control and coordinated limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and hold a single dumbbell in the hand on the same side as the leg you will move.
2. Slowly extend the same-side leg toward the floor while lowering the dumbbell overhead and keep your lower back pressed into the floor.
3. Return the leg and dumbbell to the starting position and repeat for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Press lower back gently into floor and exhale to control limb movement

Health benefit: Develops lateral leg strength and improves hip mobility and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold one dumbbell vertically at your chest with both hands.
2. Step wide to the right and push hips back while bending your right knee into a side lunge, keeping the left leg straight.
3. Drive through the right foot to return to center and lift the right knee up into a balance, squeezing the glutes.
4. Lower back to start and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Drive through bent heel and keep knee tracking over toes as you rise

Health benefit: Increases unilateral pressing strength while promoting posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and hold one dumbbell in your right hand extended above your chest.
2. Drive through both feet and lift your hips into a bridge so your torso forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Bend your right elbow to lower the dumbbell to your chest while keeping wrist neutral.
4. Press the dumbbell back to full arm extension while maintaining the bridge, then lower and repeat; switch arms.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes to keep hips level and brace core as you press

Health benefit: Enhances unilateral leg endurance and joint stability under load
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a split stance with your front knee over the ankle and rear foot on the toes, and hold one dumbbell at your chest with both hands.
2. Lower into a split squat until the front thigh is parallel to the floor and your weight is evenly distributed.
3. Hold the iso-position with a braced core and tall chest for the prescribed time, then press up to standing.
Safety cue: Keep front knee stacked over ankle

Health benefit: Builds core strength and hip flexor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Place two dumbbells parallel on the floor shoulder-width apart and sit between them.
2. Grip the handles firmly and press down to lift your hips off the floor.
3. Extend your legs straight in front of you and hold the L position.
4. Keep the shoulders down and breathe steadily while holding the position.
Safety cue: Press hands firmly into the floor

Health benefit: Improves coordinated lower to upper body strength and functional pressing power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back into a controlled reverse lunge, keeping the front knee over the ankle.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and press both dumbbells overhead.
4. Lower the weights to shoulder height and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Drive through front heel throughout the lunge

Health benefit: Strengthens biceps while encouraging trunk stability and posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel tall with knees hip-width and hold one dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Keep elbows close to your ribs and curl the dumbbells toward your shoulders.
3. Lower the dumbbells with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep torso tall with ribs down

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and reinforces hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with one foot forward and hold a dumbbell at your upper chest with both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips with a flat back and push your hips back while keeping the front knee soft.
3. Lower your torso until it is near parallel to the floor.
4. Drive your hips forward and return to standing while squeezing your glutes.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and hold a dumbbell at your side in the hand opposite the standing leg.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips level while maintaining a tall spine.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while softening the standing knee

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and functional trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hold a dumbbell with both hands by one hip.
2. Rotate your torso and chop the dumbbell diagonally upward across your body to finish overhead by the opposite shoulder.
3. Reverse the movement with control and return the dumbbell to the starting hip position.
4. Repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Lead with your core not arms and exhale during the lift

Health benefit: Improves rear shoulder and upper back muscle coordination for posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on your right leg with a slight bend in the knee and hold a dumbbell in your left hand.
2. Hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor and let the left arm hang toward the ground.
3. Raise the dumbbell out to the side in a wide arc, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
4. Lower the weight with control and repeat, then switch legs and arm sides.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and retract shoulder blades as you control the fly

Exercise Name: DB Curtsy Lunge to Lateral Kick
Health benefit: Enhances hip stability and lateral movement control for functional mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell close to your chest with both hands.
2. Step your right leg diagonally behind your left into a curtsy, bending both knees.
3. Push through the front foot to stand and immediately lift the rear leg out to the side for a controlled lateral kick.
4. Lower the leg, reset, and repeat for reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain upright chest and front knee tracking over toes during both movements

Health benefit: Increases core endurance and tension for improved midline stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and hold a dumbbell with both hands extended overhead.
2. Lift your shoulders and legs a few inches off the floor into a hollow position while keeping the dumbbell overhead.
3. Rock gently back and forth in small arcs using your core to control the movement.
Safety cue: Brace your core tuck pelvis and breathe steadily during controlled rocking

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength while promoting shoulder mobility and overhead stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet shoulder-width, hold a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level with palms facing each other.
2. Brace your core and squat down until thighs are parallel, keeping chest up and weight in the heels.
3. Drive through the heels to stand and press both dumbbells overhead into a wide Y position with arms slightly diagonal.
4. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder level under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace core and keep chest lifted as you press into the Y

Health benefit: Targets triceps while challenging unilateral stability and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered stance with one foot forward and one foot back and hold a single dumbbell with both hands overhead.
2. Keep elbows close to your head and lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending the elbows.
3. Extend the elbows to raise the dumbbell back overhead with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and elbow tucked to minimize shoulder movement

Health benefit: Improves dynamic balance and single-leg control during walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in tandem stance with one foot directly in front of the other and hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
2. Tighten your core and take a small controlled step forward with the front foot while maintaining balance.
3. Bring the back foot forward to re-establish tandem alignment while keeping an upright posture.
4. Continue heel-to-toe steps in a controlled manner, then switch lead foot as needed.
Safety cue: Maintain upright torso and take small controlled steps to challenge balance

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk strength and challenges balance under asymmetric load
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Brace your core and keep your hips facing forward.
3. Bend your torso to the right, sliding the dumbbell down your thigh.
4. Return to standing and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips and avoid rotating spine as you bend
is_not_suitable_for: Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain, Sarcopenia

Health benefit: Combines hamstring and core mobility with upper back pulling strength development
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hold a dumbbell in your right hand at your side.
2. Hinge at the hips, place both hands on the floor, and walk your hands forward into a high plank.
3. Shift weight to the left hand and row the dumbbell toward your ribcage, then lower it.
4. Walk your hands back to your feet, stand up by reversing the hinge, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and hips stable during walkout then row with scapular retraction

Health benefit: Builds chest and core strength while offering adjustable resistance for progressing push-up form
Steps to perform:
1. Loop the resistance band across your upper back and hold the ends under each palm while assuming a high plank.
2. Brace your core and keep a straight line from head to heels with hands under shoulders.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the floor, feeling the band add resistance.
4. Press through your palms to extend your elbows and return to the starting plank.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and brace core to avoid sagging hips

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and improves posture through horizontal pulling movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet hip-width and hinge at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, holding the band ends with palms facing in.
2. Keep a flat back and pull your elbows back, squeezing your shoulder blades to row the band toward your hips.
3. Slowly extend your arms to control the band's return and reset for the next rep.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with a long spine and retract shoulder blades

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder and upper arm strength and improves overhead mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
2. Brace your core and press the band overhead until your arms are fully extended.
3. Lower the band back to shoulder height with control.
Safety cue: Stand tall keep ribs down and press straight overhead

Health benefit: Promotes scapular stability and balances posterior shoulder muscles for improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at eye level and grab the ends with both hands.
2. Step back to create tension and stand with feet hip-width apart.
3. Pull the band toward your face, flaring your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades.
4. Slowly extend your arms to return to the start while keeping a tall posture.
Safety cue: Pull elbows high with scapular retraction and control the return

Health benefit: Increases elbow flexor strength and functional pulling capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the center of the band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ends with palms facing up.
2. Keep your elbows close to your sides and brace your core.
3. Curl your hands toward your shoulders by bending the elbows and contracting the biceps.
4. Lower your hands slowly back to the starting position under control.
Safety cue: Keep elbows tucked by sides and lower slowly under control

Health benefit: Builds triceps strength and supports elbow extension during pushing tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Secure the band overhead and grasp the ends with palms facing down.
2. Step back to create tension and position your elbows tight to your sides.
3. Press your hands downward by extending your forearms until your arms are straight.
4. Return your hands slowly to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Keep elbows close to ribs and lower with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Develops horizontal pressing strength and improves functional pushing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the resistance band at chest height behind you and grab the handles with palms facing down.
2. Step forward to create tension and stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
3. Press both hands forward until your arms are fully extended.
4. Return your hands to chest level slowly and with control.
Safety cue: Stand tall retract shoulder blades and press with steady controlled tempo

Health benefit: Targets lateral deltoids to enhance shoulder width and abduction control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the middle of the resistance band with feet hip-width and hold the handles at your sides.
2. Keep a slight bend in your elbows and brace your core.
3. Lift both arms out to the sides to shoulder height with control.
4. Lower your arms back to your sides slowly.
Safety cue: Lead with elbows slightly bent and lift with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves unilateral back strength and corrects strength imbalances
Steps to perform:
1. Place the band under your front foot or anchor it low and hold the handle with one hand.
2. Hinge at the hips with a flat back and extend your arm toward the anchor.
3. Pull the handle toward your hip while squeezing your shoulder blade.
4. Extend your arm back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips keep spine neutral and pull with scapular retraction

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and rear delts to counteract rounded shoulders
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hold the resistance band with both hands at shoulder width in front of you, arms straight.
2. Pull the band apart by moving your hands outward until your arms reach shoulder level.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and pause for one second.
4. Slowly return your hands to the starting position under control.
Safety cue: Stand tall squeeze shoulder blades together and move through slow controlled range

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps and glutes while promoting lower body strength and movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ends at shoulder height across your upper back.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat until your thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Keep your chest up and knees tracking over your toes while maintaining tension in the band.
4. Drive through your heels and extend your hips to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking over toes descend with control

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and posterior chain while improving hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet hip-width apart and hold the ends in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips with a slight bend in the knees and keep your back flat as you lower the band toward your shins.
3. Feel the stretch in your hamstrings while maintaining tension in the band and a neutral spine.
4. Drive your hips forward, squeeze your glutes, and return to standing.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with a neutral spine keep soft knees
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Osteoporosis, Chronic Low Back Pain

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles to improve hip extension strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent, feet flat, and loop a resistance band just above your knees.
2. Press feet into the floor, squeeze glutes, and lift hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keep tension on the band by pushing knees slightly outward and hold briefly at the top.
4. Lower hips slowly back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes and press hips up while keeping ribs tucked

Health benefit: Develops lateral leg strength and hip mobility for improved side to side control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width, place a band around your thighs just above the knees, and step one foot wide to the side.
2. Push hips back and bend the stepping knee into a lateral lunge while keeping the other leg straight and chest upright.
3. Drive through the heel of the bent leg to return to standing while maintaining band tension by pressing knees outward.
4. Reset feet hip-width and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Push hips back and keep trailing knee aligned over ankle

Health benefit: Builds hamstring strength and knee flexion control for functional lower limb performance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with a resistance band looped around your ankles and anchored at your feet or held lightly by your hands.
2. Bend one knee and curl your heel toward your glutes against the band's resistance while keeping hips pressed into the mat.
3. Lower the leg back down with control and repeat, then perform the same pattern with the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep hips pressed into bench and curl with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Enhances lateral hip stability and glute endurance for better movement alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Place a loop band around your lower thighs just above the knees.
2. Bend your knees slightly into a half-squat and brace your core.
3. Take a wide step to the side, keeping constant tension on the band.
4. Continue stepping laterally while maintaining hips level and tension in the band.
Safety cue: Keep knees aligned with toes and step slowly with control

Health benefit: Isolates glute muscles to improve hip extension power and posterior activation
Steps to perform:
1. Place a loop band around the foot to be worked and come onto hands and knees.
2. Keep the working knee bent at about 90 and your core engaged.
3. Drive the heel up and back toward the ceiling, extending the hip against the band's resistance.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and exhale as you press the heel up

Health benefit: Targets hip external rotators to strengthen hips and support pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a band just above both knees and lie on your side with hips stacked.
2. Bend both knees to about 90 and keep your feet together.
3. Lift the top knee upward by rotating the hip while keeping the feet touching and the band taut.
4. Lower the knee slowly with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced while opening slowly

Health benefit: Emphasizes quadriceps activation to enhance knee extension strength and muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair and loop the band around one ankle, anchoring the other end under the chair leg.
2. Grasp the chair sides and keep the opposite foot flat on the floor.
3. Extend the banded leg forward until the knee is nearly straight.
4. Lower the leg back slowly with control.
Safety cue: Sit tall with back supported and extend the leg slowly with control

Health benefit: Trains hip abductors to improve lateral stability and balance during single leg tasks
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and loop a band around both ankles with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto the standing leg and engage your core.
3. Lift the other leg straight out to the side against the band's resistance.
4. Return the leg slowly to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Stand tall keep hips level and lift slowly without leaning

Health benefit: Enhances anti-rotation core stability and torso control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor, holding the band with both hands at your chest.
2. Step away to create tension and plant your feet shoulder-width apart.
3. Press your hands straight out in front of your chest, resisting rotation from the band.
4. Pull your hands back to your chest with control.
Safety cue: Brace your core and press slowly to resist rotation

Health benefit: Develops rotational power and oblique engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band high and stand sideways to the anchor with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Grasp the band with both hands overhead and straighten your arms.
3. Rotate your torso and pull the band down and across your body toward the opposite hip.
4. Control the return to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate from the ribs keeping hips steady and control band descent

Health benefit: Builds core endurance while promoting upper back strength
Steps to perform:
1. Loop the band under your left foot and hold the other end in your right hand.
2. Get into a high plank with hands under shoulders and legs straight.
3. Pull your right elbow back to row the band toward your ribcage while keeping hips square.
4. Extend the arm back to plank and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and exhale as you pull the band

Health benefit: Increases abdominal muscle activation and trunk flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band under your feet and lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Hold the band ends at chest level and brace your core.
3. Exhale and crunch up, pulling the band toward your knees.
Safety cue: Curl ribs toward hips and control descent with steady breathing

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and improves side bending control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the middle of a loop band with feet shoulder-width and hold one handle overhead.
2. Place the opposite hand on your hip and keep your torso tall.
3. Bend your torso toward the opposite side, sliding the overhead hand down the thigh against the band's resistance.
4. Return slowly to upright under control.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and bend from the ribs not the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances core stability while challenging hip flexor and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a band around both feet and get into a high plank with hands under shoulders.
2. Pull one knee toward your chest against the band's resistance while keeping hips stable.
3. Quickly switch legs by returning the first leg and driving the opposite knee forward.
4. Continue alternating at a controlled, steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and brace your core during controlled alternating knee drives

Health benefit: Promotes coordinated core activation and improved contralateral limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and loop a resistance band around the soles of both feet while holding the band ends overhead with straight arms.
2. Raise knees to tabletop and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Extend one leg straight toward the floor while lowering the opposite arm toward the mat against the band's tension.
4. Return to tabletop and repeat on the other side in a slow, controlled motion.
Safety cue: Keep low back pressed to floor while moving limbs slowly and breathing steadily

Health benefit: Combines rotational core engagement with increased abdominal resistance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and loop the band around the soles of both feet while holding the band ends near your hands.
2. Lift your head and shoulders and extend one leg while drawing the opposite knee toward your chest.
3. Rotate your torso and bring the opposite elbow toward the bent knee against the band's resistance.
4. Alternate sides in a controlled bicycle motion while keeping the core engaged.
Safety cue: Lift shoulder blades rotate from ribs not neck and control band tension

Health benefit: Improves trunk rotation strength and dynamic core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand side-on holding the band with both hands extended.
2. Tighten your core and rotate your torso away from the anchor in a controlled motion.
3. Return slowly to the starting position and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall with soft knees rotate through thoracic spine and exhale on each twist

Health benefit: Develops full body power by linking lower body drive to upper body press
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold the ends at shoulder height with palms facing inward.
2. Sit back into a deep squat while keeping chest up and band tension underfoot.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and press the band overhead until arms are fully extended.
4. Lower the band back to shoulder height with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest up sit hips back drive through heels and exhale on press

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength while enhancing upper back and shoulder activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hold handles with palms facing your body.
2. Sit back into a squat with chest up and knees tracking over toes.
3. Drive through heels to stand and pull the handles up to chest height with elbows leading.
4. Lower the handles under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and knees tracking over toes as you control the pull

Health benefit: Develops unilateral leg strength while increasing biceps strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with the band under your front foot and hold handles with palms facing forward.
2. Step the back foot behind into a lunge and lower until both knees are about 90 degrees.
3. Push through the front heel to rise and perform a biceps curl by bending the elbows.
4. Lower the hands, reset the lunge, and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain upright torso and front knee over ankle while controlling the curl

Health benefit: Enhances core stability coordination and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Loop the resistance band around both ankles and come to hands-and-knees with hips lifted and knees slightly off the floor.
2. Move your right hand and left foot forward a short distance while keeping hips low and core engaged.
3. Alternate opposite hand and foot in short, controlled steps while maintaining tension in the band.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and tight core, move slowly with controlled shoulder blades

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Place the band under your feet in a wide sumo stance and hold the band with both hands between your legs.
2. Hinge at the hips, push your knees out, and keep your chest upright.
3. Drive through your heels and extend hips and knees to stand, pulling the band upward.
4. Hinge at the hips and bend the knees to lower back to the start with control.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a neutral spine and knees tracking over toes

Health benefit: Targets lower back and hamstring strength while promoting hip hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Place the band under your feet shoulder-width apart and drape it across your upper back, holding the ends at your sides.
2. Soften your knees and hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and chest slightly forward.
3. Lower your torso until parallel to the floor or you feel a hamstring stretch.
4. Drive your hips forward to return to standing and keep tension on the band.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep a neutral spine and braced core throughout the movement

Health benefit: Builds total body pulling strength and enhances upper trap activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the band with straight arms in front of your thighs.
2. Hinge at the hips and lower until your hands reach just below the knees.
3. Drive through the heels and stand tall, then immediately shrug your shoulders toward your ears.
4. Lower your shoulders and hinge at the hips to return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips keeping a neutral spine and control the shrug instead of jerking

Health benefit: Improves single leg stability while adding rotational core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with the band under your front foot and hold both ends at chest level.
2. Step your back foot straight behind you into a reverse lunge and keep the band taut.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg while keeping your hands together at chest height.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and reset the band before repeating.
Safety cue: Step back with chest lifted rotate from thoracic spine keep hips square

Health benefit: Combines lower body stability with shoulder abduction strength development
Steps to perform:
1. Place the band under your front foot and hold the ends at your sides with palms facing inward.
2. Lower into a static lunge with your torso upright and knees bent at about 90 degrees.
3. Lift your arms out to the sides to shoulder height against the band's resistance.
4. Lower the arms with control while maintaining the lunge position.
Safety cue: Maintain upright torso brace core and raise bands with controlled shoulder movement

Health benefit: Increases upper body endurance coordination and quickness
Steps to perform:
1. Grab the band ends and hold it taut behind your shoulders or anchor it behind you at chest height.
2. Stand in an athletic stance with knees soft and core engaged.
3. Punch forward alternately with quick, controlled motions against the band's resistance.
Safety cue: Keep soft bend in knees breathe steadily and retract shoulder blades on punches

Health benefit: Enhances upper body power and neuromuscular rate of force development
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band behind you at chest height and take a staggered stance.
2. Hold the handles at chest level with elbows bent and core braced.
3. Press the handles forward explosively until your arms are nearly extended.
4. Return under control to the start and repeat quickly for speed.
Safety cue: Anchor scapulae press explosively but control band recoil and exhale on effort

Health benefit: Enhances upper body muscular endurance and shoulder stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the middle of the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends in each hand.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips, bend the knees, and keep a tall chest.
3. Alternate whipping each arm up and down rapidly to create waves.
4. Maintain a quick rhythm and control the band between reps.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep a neutral spine

Health benefit: Builds back strength and improves scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and hinge forward from the hips.
2. Grab the band ends with palms facing each other and maintain a flat back.
3. Pull the handles toward your hips quickly, driving the elbows back.
4. Lower under control and repeat at a fast tempo.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a flat back and drive elbows back

Health benefit: Increases triceps endurance and elbow joint coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and step on the middle of the resistance band.
2. Grip the band ends and raise your arms overhead with elbows bent behind your head.
3. Press your hands up a few inches to slightly straighten the elbows.
4. Pulse small up-and-down movements from the elbows while keeping your torso steady.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and pelvis neutral to avoid lumbar extension

Health benefit: Develops biceps power and improves forearm muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the resistance band with feet hip-width apart and hold ends palms facing forward.
2. Keep elbows close to your sides and curl both hands quickly toward your shoulders.
3. Lower the hands under control and repeat at a brisk pace.
Safety cue: Anchor elbows beside ribs and lower slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and upper body rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the resistance band behind you at chest height.
2. Hold one end in each hand and step into a staggered stance.
3. Punch one arm forward fully while keeping the other hand near your chin.
4. Retract the punched arm and repeat with the other arm in an alternating rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture and rotate through torso keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Strengthens rear deltoids and promotes scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the Resistance band at about eye level and grab the ends with a neutral grip.
2. Step back to create tension and stand tall with knees slightly bent.
3. Pull the band toward your face, flaring your elbows wide and squeezing the shoulder blades.
4. Slowly extend the arms to the start position under control.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and lead with elbows keeping neck long and neutral

Health benefit: Improves posture by activating posterior shoulder and upper back muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Hold the Resistance band overhead with a wide grip and arms straight.
2. Pull your hands apart and lower the band down the sides until it reaches shoulder height.
3. Reverse the motion to return the band overhead under control.
Safety cue: Keep chest tall and squeeze shoulder blades without shrugging

Health benefit: Increases upper back endurance and improves rowing mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and loop the Resistance band around the soles of your feet, holding the ends in both hands.
2. Keep your core engaged and arms extended with a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Rapidly drive your elbows back, pulling the band to your lower ribs while squeezing the shoulder blades.
4. Return to the starting position with control and prepare for the next rep.
Safety cue: Drive scapular retraction and control the return with a neutral spine

Health benefit: Develops lower body power and enhances explosive leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Place a looped resistance band under both feet and hold the ends at shoulder level.
2. Drop into a squat by pushing hips back and bending knees until thighs are near parallel.
3. Explosively extend hips and knees and jump upward while keeping the band taut.
4. Land softly back into the squat position and immediately prepare for the next jump.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and chest upright

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and hip abductors endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a mini resistance band around both ankles and stand with feet shoulder-width and knees slightly bent.
2. Push one foot laterally while stepping the other foot to maintain band tension and a low athletic stance.
3. Shuffle quickly with small steps in one direction while keeping constant band tension.
4. Reverse direction and continue the same quick, controlled shuffles.
Safety cue: Maintain low hips chest forward quick light steps on the balls of feet

Health benefit: Enhances ankle stability and foot quickness for improved agility
Steps to perform:
1. Place a looped resistance band around both ankles and stand with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Quickly jump both feet outward then immediately jump them back together while keeping the band taut.
3. Keep a rapid rhythm and short ground contact time for continuous in-out repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep chest proud and core braced while moving feet quickly and with control

Health benefit: Builds glute and core strength while improving hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with feet flat, knees hip-width, and loop the band just above your knees.
2. Press your knees outward against the band and drive your hips up into a bridge.
3. Lift one knee toward your chest while keeping your hips elevated and band tension engaged.
4. Lower that foot back and repeat on the other side with controlled, steady movements.
Safety cue: Drive through heels and keep hips level throughout each controlled march

Health benefit: Develops quadriceps strength and knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair and anchor the band under your foot, looped around your ankle.
2. Extend the knee forward over two seconds until the leg is straight.
3. Hold the straight position for one second.
4. Return the leg to the start over two seconds and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall, engage quads, extend slowly and avoid locking the knee

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral stability during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with the band around both ankles and shift weight onto the support leg.
2. Lift the other leg out to the side over two seconds while keeping your torso still.
3. Hold the abduction at the top for one second with hips level.
4. Return the leg slowly to the start over two seconds and repeat.
Safety cue: Stand tall, keep hips square, lift leg slowly with controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves lateral power, balance, and dynamic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Place a looped resistance band around your ankles for Skater Hops.
2. Drop into a shallow squat with weight on your standing leg.
3. Hop laterally to the right and land softly on the right foot while the band resists.
4. Push off immediately to hop left and continue alternating quickly.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest upright to control lateral force

Health benefit: Develops lower-body explosive power and hip extension strength
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a long resistance band around your hips and anchor the other end behind you for Resistance Band Broad Jump.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width, bend knees, and load your hips.
3. Swing your arms and explode forward, driving your hips into the band during the jump.
4. Land softly with knees bent and reset the band tension before the next rep.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Activates glutes and improves lateral hip stability during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Place a mini loop band just above your knees for Monster Walk (Fast Paced).
2. Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward into an athletic stance.
3. Take quick wide steps forward and outward while keeping constant tension on the band.
4. Continue alternating fast paced steps for the desired distance or time.
Safety cue: Keep knees slightly bent and step controlled with hips level

Health benefit: Builds single-leg strength and functional power for everyday movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a step with one foot on the step and the resistance band looped under that front foot.
2. Hold the band ends at your hips and brace your core.
3. Drive through the front foot and explode upward until the rear foot clears the floor.
4. Slowly lower the rear foot back to the floor and reset.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel with torso upright and knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Enhances core endurance and shoulder stability while improving hip drive
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a high plank with the resistance band looped around both feet and hands under shoulders.
2. Pull one knee toward your chest against the band's resistance while keeping your hips level.
3. Quickly switch legs, driving the other knee forward while maintaining tension.
4. Continue alternating at a controlled, steady pace.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control hips to prevent sagging or piking

Health benefit: Improves core stability and hip abductor endurance during dynamic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with the resistance band looped around both ankles and hands under shoulders.
2. Jump both feet outward against the band's resistance until wider than hip-width.
3. Jump both feet back together under control while keeping your core tight.
4. Repeat at a steady tempo while maintaining a flat back.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core braced while breathing evenly

Health benefit: Improves rotational core strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band low at your right foot and grasp the handle with both hands.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and bend knees slightly.
3. Pull the band upward and across your body to your left shoulder in a chopping motion while pivoting on your back foot.
4. Slowly return to the start under control with the band taut.
Safety cue: Brace your core hinge at the hips rotate with controlled movement

Health benefit: Enhances lower abdominal strength and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and loop the band around the soles of your feet while holding the ends at your sides.
2. Lean back slightly with a tall chest and brace your core.
3. Draw your knees toward your chest, keeping the band taut.
4. Extend your legs back out slowly without losing tension on the band.
Safety cue: Sit tall engage lower abs draw knees in slowly

Health benefit: Improves lower abdominal endurance and hip flexor stamina
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with the band looped around your ankles and arms at your sides or under your hips.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the ground and engage your core.
3. Alternately kick your feet up and down in small, controlled motions while maintaining tension on the band.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed into mat breathe steadily and control legs

Health benefit: Strengthens oblique muscles and enhances lateral trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and loop the resistance band under your right foot, holding both ends at shoulder height on your right side.
2. Brace your core and exhale as you pull the band down toward your right hip while bending your torso to the right.
3. Pause and squeeze the right oblique.
4. Slowly return to start and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral squeeze obliques slowly without pulling on the band

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with legs extended and loop the resistance band around the ball of your right foot, holding the ends in both hands.
2. Keep your knee straight and pull the band toward you to dorsiflex the ankle until you feel a calf stretch.
3. Hold the stretch, then release and repeat on the left foot.
Safety cue: Sit tall keep ankle relaxed lean into the stretch from hips breathe

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the resistance band at chest height and stand sideways with feet shoulder-width, holding the band with both hands at chest level.
2. Keep your hips square and rotate your torso away from the anchor while pulling the band across your body.
3. Pause and squeeze your obliques.
4. Return slowly to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and rotate through thoracic spine with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Develops core stability and hip flexor coordination during single leg support
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a light resistance band around both feet near the arches and come into a high plank on your hands.
2. Brace your core and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Lift your right foot a few inches forward against the band while keeping hips level.
4. Lower the right foot and repeat with the left, marching steadily and controlled.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and breathe steadily as you lift opposite limbs

Health benefit: Enhances hip abductor strength and cardiovascular agility
Steps to perform:
1. Place a loop band around your ankles and stand with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Slightly squat, then explosively jump your feet outward while raising your arms overhead.
3. Land softly with knees bent and immediately jump your feet back together while lowering your arms.
4. Continue jumping in a steady rhythm, keeping tension on the band.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and hips stacked over ankles

Health benefit: Boosts overall power development and metabolic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a resistance band just above your knees and stand with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hinge at the hips, place hands on the floor, and jump your feet back into a high plank while keeping the band taut.
3. Jump your feet forward back to a squat position with knees tracking over toes.
4. Drive through your heels and explode into a vertical jump, land softly, and return hands to the floor.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hinge hips back before stepping or jumping forward
is_not_suitable_for: Obesity / Overweight, Osteoarthritis, Osteoporosis, Coronary Artery Disease, Metabolic Syndrome, Hypothyroidism, Heart Failure (Stable), Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD), Cancer (Lifestyle-related / Post-treatment)

Health benefit: Combines lower and upper body strength for functional movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the center of a resistance band with feet shoulder-width and hold the handles at shoulder level.
2. Sit back into a squat until thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Drive up through the heels and press the handles overhead until arms are extended.
4. Lower the handles back to shoulder height and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive through heels keep chest lifted and press while bracing core

Health benefit: Enhances hip flexor power and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a staggered sprint stance with the front foot on the resistance band and hold the handles at your hips.
2. Explosively drive the rear knee forward and upward while pulling the handles toward your hips.
3. Return to the staggered stance with control and repeat the sprinting motion quickly.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and drive knees forward with controlled hip power
