is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Hyperthyroidism, Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD), COPD, Metabolic Syndrome, Heart Failure, Hypothyroidism

Health benefit: Builds unilateral leg strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width over the middle of the resistance band and hold the handles at your sides.
2. Step one foot back into a reverse lunge and lower until both knees are near 90 degrees.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand while pulling the back knee up toward your chest against the band.
4. Return the foot to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and control the descent before driving the knee up

Health benefit: Improves lateral mobility and upper back muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the middle of the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends in both hands.
2. Step right with your right foot and slide your left foot to meet it while keeping knees soft.
3. As you step back to center, pull your elbows toward your ribs and squeeze your shoulder blades to row.
4. Repeat the step-touch and row to the left while maintaining steady band tension.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly and retract shoulder blades with slow controlled rows

Health benefit: Develops shoulder stability and core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Loop the band around both wrists and stand facing a wall at arm's length.
2. Place your palms on the wall and walk your hands up the wall while keeping the band taut.
3. Walk your hands back down to the start while maintaining tension and shoulder control.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move hands slowly while maintaining a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances lower body strength and overhead pressing coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Sit back to lightly touch the chair with hips while keeping the band taut and chest lifted.
3. Drive through your heels to stand and press the band overhead until arms are extended.
4. Lower the band back to shoulder height and sit back to repeat.
Safety cue: Press through heels keep knees tracking toes and avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and shoulder muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the band with feet hip-width and hold the ends with palms facing your body.
2. Step laterally about 1-2 feet to one side to create tension and keep knees soft.
3. Drive elbows up and out to pull the band toward your chest in an upright row.
4. Step back to the start, lower the hands under control, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and step smoothly avoiding rounded shoulders

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and thoracic extension
Steps to perform:
1. Hold the band with a wide grip in front of your hips and keep your arms straight.
2. Move your arms upward and back, passing the band overhead and behind your body with control.
3. Reverse the motion to bring the band back in front of your hips and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move shoulders slowly with controlled motion

Health benefit: Targets rotator cuff muscles to improve shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at waist height and hold the handle with the working hand, elbow bent 90 and tucked to your side.
2. Rotate your forearm outward away from your torso while keeping the elbow fixed to your side.
3. Return the forearm slowly toward your body under control and repeat.
Safety cue: Tuck elbow to ribs and rotate slowly without shrugging shoulders

Health benefit: Promotes better posture through improved scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Hold a resistance band in front of you with both hands at shoulder height and arms extended.
2. Pull your hands apart horizontally while keeping your arms straight.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and hold briefly.
4. Return slowly to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades back and down keeping neck long and chest open

Health benefit: Enhances latissimus flexibility and overhead range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Hold a resistance band overhead with both hands wider than shoulder-width and step back to create tension.
2. Keep your arms straight and hinge at the hips, leaning to one side to stretch the opposite lat.
3. Hold the stretch briefly while maintaining a long spine.
4. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and core engaged while reaching overhead slowly

Health benefit: Improves chest mobility and counteracts forward shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Hold a resistance band behind your back with both hands and arms straight.
2. Pull the band outward while lifting your chest and opening your elbows away from the body.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades down and together and hold the open-chest position briefly.
4. Slowly release the band to the start position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and retract shoulder blades while inhaling deeply

Health benefit: Enhances scapular control and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a resistance band under both feet and hold an end in each hand.
2. Stand with your back and head against a wall and press your forearms and wrists into the wall.
3. Slide your arms upward along the wall until your arms are overhead.
4. Control the descent and slide your arms back down to the start.
Safety cue: Press low back gently to wall and slide arms with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases pectoral flexibility and promotes balanced shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band at chest height and hold the band with one hand.
2. Step forward and away to create tension and position your arm slightly behind your torso.
3. Keep the shoulder down and rotate your chest away until you feel a stretch in the front of the shoulder and chest.
4. Release tension by stepping toward the anchor and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Anchor band securely and hinge slightly forward keeping ribs down

Health benefit: Improves neck and upper back mobility and reduces muscular tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a resistance band behind your back and hold one end in your lower hand and the other end in your upper hand.
2. Pull gently down with the lower hand to create light tension in the band.
3. Tilt your head toward the upper-hand side and tuck your chin slightly to feel a stretch along the opposite side of the neck.
4. Return to center, switch hand positions, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep chest open and tuck chin slightly to avoid neck hyperextension

Health benefit: Strengthens rotator cuff coordination and enhances shoulder joint stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to it.
2. Grip the band with the working hand and bend the elbow to 90 degrees so the upper arm is parallel to the floor.
3. Rotate the forearm upward while keeping the elbow fixed and the movement controlled.
4. Slowly return to the start position.
Safety cue: Keep upper arm parallel to floor and rotate shoulder with controlled movement

Health benefit: Builds upper back strength and improves posture by activating scapular muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the middle of the band with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hold the band ends and hinge forward at the hips with a flat back.
3. Raise your arms diagonally overhead into a Y with thumbs pointing up.
4. Lower the arms back to the start with control.
Safety cue: Lift with scapular upward rotation keep a neutral spine and slow controlled tempo

Health benefit: Enhances core rotational control and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with knees bent and loop the band under your feet while holding the ends with both hands.
2. Lean back slightly and engage your core.
3. Rotate your torso and pull the band to one side, then return and rotate to the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall engage core rotate through thoracic spine not by swinging hips

Health benefit: Opens hip flexors and supports hip extension mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel in a half-kneeling position with the front foot flat and the back knee on the floor, and loop the resistance band under the front foot and around the back thigh.
2. Hold the band ends at chest level to create steady tension and brace your core.
3. Shift your hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the back hip.
4. Hold the position while maintaining an upright torso and controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis slightly keep torso tall and brace core during the stretch

Health benefit: Activates glute medius for improved lateral hip stability and gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Place a loop band just above your knees and come to all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Brace your core and lift one knee out to the side, keeping the hip bent at 90 degrees.
3. Squeeze the outer hip at the top of the movement without rotating your torso.
4. Lower the knee back down with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis stable avoid torso rotation and lift with controlled movement

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances pelvic stability during lateral movement
Steps to perform:
1. Place a loop band around both ankles and stand with feet shoulder-width apart and a slight squat.
2. Step your right foot diagonally forward and across your left foot to form an "X" with your legs.
3. Return the right foot to the starting width, then step your left foot diagonally forward and across the right.
4. Continue alternating controlled cross-over steps while keeping tension in the band and a low squat.
Safety cue: Keep a slight squat maintain knees aligned over toes and step slowly

Health benefit: Enhances lower abdominal control and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around both feet while holding the ends overhead.
2. Raise both legs toward the ceiling and maintain band tension.
3. Slowly lower one leg toward the floor while keeping the opposite leg vertical and the core braced.
4. Return the lowered leg to vertical with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep lower back pressed into floor

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and hip range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with knees bent, soles together, and loop the band around your feet.
2. Hold the band ends and pull to create tension while pressing your knees toward the floor.
3. Lean forward from the hips with a lifted chest to deepen the stretch.
4. Hold, release the band slowly, and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall hinge from hips keep spine long

Health benefit: Promotes quadriceps flexibility and knee joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down and loop the band around one ankle, holding the other end in the same-side hand.
2. Bend that knee and pull the band to draw your heel toward your glutes while keeping hips square.
3. Keep your chest down and pelvis stable as you feel the stretch in the front of the thigh.
4. Release the band slowly and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and avoid arching your lower back

Health benefit: Improves lateral thigh flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Secure one end of the band to a low, stable anchor.
2. Loop the free end around the outside of the ankle of the leg you will stretch.
3. Step away to create light tension and cross that leg behind your standing leg.
4. Lean your torso away from the anchor and push your hip toward the band.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and avoid leaning or twisting the torso

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band to a low stable point beside you and loop the free end around the ankle of the leg you will lift.
2. Stand tall on the opposite leg and step away to create light tension.
3. Lift the banded leg slightly and hold your balance with a soft knee and engaged core.
Safety cue: Maintain tall posture with a slight bend in the standing knee

Health benefit: Builds core anti-rotation strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Secure the band to a stable anchor at chest height.
2. Stand perpendicular to the anchor and hold the band with both hands at your chest.
3. Step away to create tension and press your hands straight out in front of your chest.
4. Hold the extended position with a braced core and resist the band pulling you toward the anchor.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep spine neutral while resisting rotation

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band to a fixed point at chest height and hold the free end with both hands across your chest.
2. Sit tall with feet flat and keep your hips square to the anchor.
3. Rotate your torso away from the anchor until you feel the band resist.
4. Return slowly to center with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from midback keeping hips square

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair and loop the resistance band under your feet, holding the ends at chest level.
2. Exhale and round your spine, pulling the band slightly forward and tucking your chin for the cat position.
3. Inhale and arch your back, pulling the band slightly back and lifting your chest for the cow position.
Safety cue: Move slowly between positions coordinating inhale and exhale with each motion

Health benefit: Develops core stability and cross-body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the resistance band low in front of you and kneel on all fours, holding the band in one hand and looping it around the opposite foot.
2. Brace your core and extend the banded arm forward while extending the opposite leg backward until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Hold briefly with hips square and the band taut.
4. Return to start with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Hinge at hips extend opposite arm and leg while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Strengthens lateral core muscles and improves trunk endurance
Steps to perform:
1. For Side Plank Hold, loop a mini band around both thighs just above the knees.
2. Lie on your side and prop up on your forearm with feet stacked.
3. Press into the forearm and lift hips until the body forms a straight line.
4. Maintain hip height and keep slight outward pressure on the top knee against the band.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders over elbow and keep torso in a straight line

Health benefit: Improves pelvic control and lower back stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, and place a loop band around both thighs above the knees.
2. Flatten your lower back to the floor by tilting the pelvis posteriorly.
3. Squeeze the glutes and press your knees slightly outward against the band while holding the tilt.
Safety cue: Brace low abs and flatten lower back into the floor slowly

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk mobility and side abdominal engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and step one foot onto the band, holding the other end in the same-side hand at shoulder height.
2. Brace your core and keep hips facing forward.
3. Bend laterally at the waist and reach the hand down along the outside of the hip and thigh.
4. Control the return upward against the band tension and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and ribs down as you reach slowly

Health benefit: Increases core activation and improves spinal flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band overhead and kneel facing the anchor with knees hip-width apart.
2. Grasp the band behind your head or at your temples and brace your core.
3. Crunch down by bringing your elbows toward your hips while keeping your hips still.
4. Return slowly to upright while controlling the band tension.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis, draw navel to spine, control each crunch with exhale

Health benefit: Improves rotational mobility and enhances core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hold the band with both hands extended and rotate your torso away from the anchor until you feel tension.
3. Hold the rotated position and keep your hips facing forward while resisting the band's pull.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine, rotate from chest while maintaining hip stability

Health benefit: Builds anti-rotation core strength and improves trunk stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor holding the band at your chest.
2. Press the band straight out with both hands until your arms are extended and locked.
3. Walk forward slowly while keeping your arms extended and resisting rotation from the band.
4. Walk back to the start while maintaining the extended position and core stability.
Safety cue: Brace core, squeeze glutes, step slowly without letting torso rotate

Health benefit: Develops full body mobility and overhead shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Overhead Squat: Stand on the band with feet shoulder-width and grasp the ends overhead with arms straight.
2. Brace your core, push hips back, and bend knees to lower into a squat while keeping the band vertical.
3. Keep chest up and knees tracking over toes while maintaining band tension overhead.
4. Drive through your heels to stand and control the band back to the start.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and ribs down while bracing core

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and promotes thoracic rotation control
Steps to perform:
1. Spiderman Lunge: Loop the band under the front foot and hold the ends in each hand at chest height.
2. Step into a deep forward lunge with hips square and keep the band taut.
3. Lower the back knee and bring the same-side elbow to the inside of the front foot while maintaining band tension.
4. Push through the front heel to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and shoulders back while controlling the descent

Health benefit: Improves dynamic hip and thoracic mobility while preparing movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. World's Greatest Stretch: Step into a long lunge with the band looped under the front foot and hold the band in the same-side hand.
2. Lower the back knee and place the opposite elbow inside the front foot to load the hips.
3. Rotate your torso and reach the band-hand up toward the ceiling while keeping hips square.
4. Return the hand to the floor, step back, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and rotate from the thoracic spine while breathing smoothly

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and builds integrated rotational stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand wide with the band looped under your front foot and held overhead in the same hand.
2. Keep the arm straight and hinge at the hips while rotating your torso toward the front foot.
3. Reach the free hand toward the front foot and maintain a braced core.
4. Drive through the hips to return to standing and repeat with control.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a braced core and steady gaze

Health benefit: Improves posterior chain mobility and teaches coordinated squat mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with both feet on the band and hold the ends at shoulder level.
2. Sit back into a squat until your hips drop toward knee height while keeping chest up.
3. Drive through your heels to stand, fully extending hips and shoulders.
4. Reset posture and repeat.
Safety cue: Initiate with hips back keep spine neutral and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Improves hamstring and core mobility while enhancing shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and loop the band under both feet, holding the ends in your hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and walk your hands forward into a strong plank while keeping the band taut.
3. Pause in plank with a braced core, then walk your hands back toward your feet and stand.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips keep core braced and spine neutral

Health benefit: Builds hip strength, rotational mobility, and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width, place the middle of the band under your front foot, and hold the ends at chest level.
2. Step forward into a lunge, bending both knees to about 90 degrees and keeping your torso upright.
3. Rotate your torso toward the front leg while pulling the band across your chest.
4. Push through the front heel to return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep front knee over ankle and rotate from thoracic spine not lower back

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic hamstring flexibility and neuromuscular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width, step on the band with both feet, and hold the ends with both hands at hip height.
2. Keep the lifted leg straight and kick one leg forward to hip height while reaching the opposite hand toward the toes.
3. Lower the leg under control while maintaining band tension and switch legs in a marching pattern.
4. Keep the chest up and a slight bend in the standing knee throughout the movement.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture hinge at hips keep leg extended without rounding back

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with the band looped under that foot and hold the band ends in both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and push the free leg straight back while reaching the hands toward the standing foot.
3. Keep a soft bend in the standing knee and maintain a flat back as you lower.
4. Pull through the standing hip to return upright and repeat before switching legs.
Safety cue: Keep slight knee bend hinge at hips keep hips level and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip strength, mobility, and single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and loop the resistance band under both feet, holding the ends at chest height.
2. Step wide to the right and sit back into a lateral lunge, keeping the left leg straight.
3. Drive through the right heel and pull the band toward your hips as you return to center.
4. Shift weight onto the right foot and lift the left knee into a balance while keeping band tension.
Safety cue: Sit hips back keep chest tall drive through planted foot and control balance

Health benefit: Increases triceps and shoulder flexibility and overhead range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and hold one end of the band overhead with the right hand and the other end behind your back with the left hand.
2. Bend the right elbow and pull down with the left hand to create tension in the band.
3. Keep the torso upright and hold the position to target the right triceps.
Safety cue: Keep ribcage down and core engaged as you reach overhead

Health benefit: Improves posterior shoulder mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Hold the band with both hands in front of you at shoulder height and step back to create tension.
2. Pull the band with the right hand across your chest while keeping the left hand steady.
3. Keep the shoulders down and turn the torso slightly toward the right to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back as you pull the band across your chest

Health benefit: Enhances chest and thoracic mobility while promoting upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold the band behind your back at shoulder height.
2. Pull your hands outward and back while keeping a slight bend in the elbows.
3. Squeeze your chest and shoulder blades together at the end range and hold briefly.
4. Slowly control the band back to the start position.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and open chest slowly on the exhale

Health benefit: Improves latissimus flexibility and overhead shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band overhead and grasp it with one hand using an overhand grip.
2. Step away and lean your torso away from the anchor with the arm straight to feel the lat stretch.
3. Hold the stretch briefly, then return to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep spine neutral and reach side body long while controlling band tension

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexor length and forearm mobility for improved comfort
Steps to perform:
1. Secure one end of the band under your foot and hold the other end with the palm facing up.
2. Extend your arm and use the band to gently pull your hand back so the fingers point toward the floor.
3. Hold the stretch briefly, then relax and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep elbow straight and gently flex wrist while breathing into the stretch

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and muscular control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height behind you and hold the ends with both hands.
2. Place the band across the back of your head and stand tall.
3. Tilt your head forward slowly against the band's resistance.
4. Return to neutral with control and tilt your head backward against the band.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and chin gently tucked to avoid neck compression

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and improves scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height in front of you and hold an end in each hand.
2. Step back to create tension and hinge slightly at the hips.
3. Pull your hands outward and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
4. Return your arms slowly to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and control the eccentric return

Health benefit: Increases biceps flexibility and elbow joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band behind you at shoulder height and hold it with palm facing up.
2. Step forward to create tension and straighten your arm slightly.
3. Press your hand back and rotate your palm up to feel the biceps lengthen.
4. Hold briefly then release the tension slowly.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and chest open while breathing deeply

Health benefit: Enhances chest flexibility and promotes improved posture
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the resistance band to the door frame at shoulder height and hold the band end with the hand of the side to be stretched.
2. Step forward with the opposite foot and allow the band to pull your arm back until your palm faces away.
3. Rotate your torso away from the anchored arm until you feel a stretch across the chest.
4. Hold the position and return slowly by stepping back and releasing band tension.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and pelvis neutral as you open the chest

Health benefit: Improves shoulder internal rotation and joint mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Secure the band to a fixed anchor at waist height and grasp the band with the hand of the arm you will internally rotate.
2. Bend your elbow to 90 and keep your upper arm pressed against your ribcage while stepping away to create light tension.
3. Rotate your forearm inward toward your stomach to produce internal shoulder rotation.
4. Hold the end position and slowly control the return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep elbow tucked to your side and rotate slowly with control

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and loop the band around the arch of one foot, holding the band ends with both hands.
2. Keep the opposite knee bent and pull the band to lift the looped leg straight toward the ceiling.
3. Keep a slight bend if needed and flex the foot to increase the hamstring stretch.
4. Hold the stretch and lower the leg slowly with control.
Safety cue: Keep low back pressed into mat to avoid lumbar arching

Health benefit: Enhances quadriceps flexibility and knee joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and loop the resistance band around your top ankle.
2. Reach back and hold the band ends with the same-side hand.
3. Pull the band to bring your heel toward your glutes to stretch the front of your thigh.
4. Keep your hips aligned and steady while holding the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and pelvis neutral to prevent lumbar extension

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip abduction range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and loop the resistance band around the sole of one foot.
2. Bend the opposite knee with foot flat and hold the band ends with both hands.
3. Slowly draw the banded leg out to the side across your body to stretch the inner thigh.
4. Keep your lower back on the floor and control the movement while holding the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep opposite hip grounded and pelvis level to avoid twisting

Health benefit: Promotes lateral hip flexibility and gluteal muscle lengthening
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back and loop the resistance band around the ankle of the leg to be stretched.
2. Keep the opposite knee bent with foot flat and hold the band ends with both hands.
3. Gently pull the banded leg across your body toward the opposite shoulder to target the outer thigh.
4. Keep your hips flat and hold the stretch with controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and control the leg motion to protect low back

Health benefit: Improves glute flexibility and hip external rotation range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat; loop the resistance band around your right foot and hold the ends.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left thigh into a figure-4 and pull the band toward your chest to draw the right knee closer.
3. Keep your shoulders on the floor and hold the stretch, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep low back flat and draw the knee toward chest with control

Health benefit: Improves hip extension range of motion and anterior hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with your right knee on the floor and left foot planted ahead; loop the resistance band under the left foot and hold the ends at hip height.
2. Tuck your pelvis and press your hips forward while pulling the band gently to maintain tension and deepen the front hip stretch.
3. Keep your torso upright and hold the position, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Tuck your tailbone to maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances groin and inner thigh flexibility for improved hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with soles of feet together and knees dropping to the sides; loop the resistance band around the outer arches of both feet and hold the ends.
2. Pull the band toward you to bring your heels closer to your groin while using your elbows to press knees gently toward the floor.
3. Maintain an upright spine and hold the stretch, then release the band.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge from your hips to avoid rounding

Health benefit: Strengthens glute activation while promoting hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band to a low sturdy point and loop the free end around one ankle while lying face down.
2. Slightly bend the knee and squeeze the glute to lift the ankle off the floor against the band.
3. Lower the leg slowly with control and repeat for desired reps.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and squeeze glutes during the lift

Health benefit: Increases ankle dorsiflexion range for better foot and gait mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with one leg extended and wrap the band around the top of the foot, holding the ends in your hands.
2. Pull the band toward you to draw the toes upward and dorsiflex the ankle.
3. Hold briefly, then release slowly and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep knee aligned over toes and press heel down

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and oblique muscle length
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width, step one foot on the band, and grasp the other end overhead with both hands.
2. Keep arms straight and bend sideways at the waist toward the anchored foot until you feel a lateral stretch.
3. Return to center with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and breathe deeply through the stretch

Health benefit: Enhances spinal rotation mobility and thoracic flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with legs extended and loop the band around the soles of both feet, holding an end in each hand.
2. Bend the right knee and place the right foot outside the left thigh, keeping the spine long.
3. Rotate the torso to the right while pulling the band gently with the left hand and placing the right hand behind you.
4. Hold the twist and maintain steady tension on the band.
Safety cue: Keep sit bones grounded and rotate from the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic extension and shoulder mobility while lengthening the back
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels, then loop the band under your palms and hold the ends overhead.
2. Walk your hands forward and lower your torso toward your thighs into child's pose.
3. Reach the arms forward and pull the band lightly to create a gentle stretch through the shoulders.
4. Keep the neck neutral and maintain steady tension on the band.
Safety cue: Reach through fingertips while lengthening the spine and breathing deeply

Health benefit: Encourages spinal extension control and posterior chain engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and place the band under both feet, holding the ends behind your neck.
2. Slightly bend the knees and brace the core.
3. Squeeze the shoulder blades and lift the chest to extend the upper back against the band's resistance.
4. Slowly return to a neutral standing position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and extend through the upper back with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves lateral flexion range and side body flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on both knees on a mat and loop a resistance band under your left knee, holding the band in your right hand at shoulder height.
2. Brace your core and lift your left arm overhead to create a straight line from hip to hand.
3. Reach your right hand laterally toward the right while keeping the band taut.
4. Return slowly to the start and repeat, then switch the band to the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips keeping ribs stacked and reach with control

Health benefit: Increases lumbar rotation mobility and improves lower back range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat and loop a resistance band around both knees.
2. Keep both shoulders on the floor and draw your knees together toward one side against the band's resistance.
3. Pause near the end range, then control the knees back to center.
4. Repeat on the opposite side after completing your set.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders anchored to the floor and rotate from the hips slowly

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and promotes gentle core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a light resistance band looped across your upper back and the ends secured under each palm.
2. Exhale and round your spine upward toward the ceiling while gently pulling the band forward.
3. Hold the rounded position briefly while keeping your neck relaxed.
4. Inhale and return to a neutral spine with control while maintaining light tension in the band.
Safety cue: Move slowly and exhale as you articulate each vertebra

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and improves trunk mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band at chest height and stand perpendicular with feet hip-width apart.
2. Hold the band with both hands at sternum level and extend your arms slightly.
3. Rotate your torso away from the anchor while keeping hips facing forward.
4. Return to center with control and repeat for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and rotate from the ribs with controlled tension

Health benefit: Promotes anterior core flexibility and gentle lumbar extension
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band behind you at shoulder height and kneel with knees hip-width apart.
2. Grasp the band overhead with both hands and keep your hips stacked over your knees.
3. Gently lean back from the thoracic spine to create a stretch in the abdominals while keeping arms straight.
4. Return to an upright kneeling position with control.
Safety cue: Tuck pelvis slightly and breathe into the front body to avoid overextension

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk mobility and lengthens quadratus lumborum muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band low at your side and stand perpendicular with feet shoulder-width apart.
2. Hold the band overhead with the hand nearest the anchor and step away to create tension.
3. Side-bend away from the anchor, reaching the opposite arm down to feel a stretch along the flank.
4. Return to neutral with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Lengthen through the side of the waist and avoid collapsing the opposite hip

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility while lengthening hamstrings and calves
Steps to perform:
1. Begin Downward Dog by looping the band around your wrists and planting hands shoulder-width apart on the mat.
2. Step feet back and lift hips to form an inverted V while keeping light band tension.
3. Press palms down and gently pull the band outward to open shoulders and lengthen the spine.
4. Keep legs active and hold the pose while maintaining steady band tension.
Safety cue: Push hips back and exhale while keeping a long neutral spine

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring flexibility and lumbar spine mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Start Forward Fold by standing with feet hip-width apart and looping the band under the balls of your feet, holding the ends in your hands.
2. Hinge at the hips and slide your hands down the band as you fold forward with a soft bend in the knees.
3. Use the band to lengthen the spine and draw the torso closer to the legs.
4. Keep the band taut and relax the neck while holding the fold.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips keeping a long spine and steady breaths

Health benefit: Improves hip and ankle mobility while reinforcing functional squat posture
Steps to perform:
1. Set up Deep Squat Hold by standing with feet slightly wider than hip-width and looping the band around your thighs just above the knees.
2. Sit back into a deep squat with heels down and descend until your hips are close to knee level.
3. Press your knees outward against the band to maintain hip openness and resist knee collapse.
4. Keep your chest lifted and hold the squat while maintaining steady band tension.
Safety cue: Sit back into heels with chest upright and knees tracking toes

Health benefit: Opens hip flexors while enhancing thoracic extension and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band under your front foot and hold both ends in your hands.
2. Step into a deep lunge with the back knee lowered and the front knee over the ankle.
3. Press the hands overhead while stretching the band and reach toward the ceiling.
4. Hold briefly, lower the hands, release the band, and switch sides.
Safety cue: Square hips, engage core, and lengthen through spine as you reach

Health benefit: Enhances lateral flexibility hamstring length and standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand wide and anchor the band under your front foot while holding the ends.
2. Turn the back foot slightly and reach the forward hand toward the shin while pulling the band upward with the other hand.
3. Open the chest and extend the top arm toward the ceiling while keeping tension on the band.
4. Hold the pose, release the band slowly, and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a long side body and stack shoulders over hips

Health benefit: Stretches inner thighs and hamstrings while promoting pelvic mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and loop the band around both feet, holding the ends.
2. Hinge at the hips and fold forward with a flat back while keeping steady tension on the band.
3. Use the band to gently pull your torso deeper toward your legs while keeping the knees soft.
4. Hold the fold, then release the band and rise up slowly, vertebra by vertebra.
Safety cue: Soften knees, hinge from hips and lead with chest to protect spine

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet slightly wider than hip-width and loop a resistance band under both feet, holding an end in each hand.
2. Extend arms out to the sides and press them diagonally up and out to form a star shape.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades and keep the core engaged as you hold the wide-armed position.
4. Slowly lower your arms under control to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and squeeze shoulder blades down and together

Health benefit: Enhances lateral trunk flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Step into a wide lunge with the front knee bent and loop the band under the back foot, holding the free end in the front hand.
2. Reach the front arm up and back along the ear while gently pulling the band to assist the upward reach.
3. Slide the opposite hand down the back leg and lengthen through the side body, keeping the front knee bent.
4. Hold the posture, then release the band and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep front knee aligned over second toe and brace your core

Health benefit: Builds lateral hip strength and ankle mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and place a looped resistance band just above both knees, hands meeting in front for balance.
2. Shift your weight to one side and push the hip outward while bending the working knee and keeping the other leg straight.
3. Lower into a deep lateral squat until your hips are near knee height and keep the chest upright while the band controls knee tracking.
4. Hold the low position, maintain tension in the band, then push through the heel to return and switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit back into hips with chest up and weight on heel

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and promotes core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and anchor the band under both feet.
2. Hold the band ends at shoulder height with palms facing each other.
3. Sit back and lower your hips as if into a chair, keeping knees behind toes.
4. Press through your heels and pull the band slightly upward to maintain tension and hold the pose.
Safety cue: Press knees over toes tuck tailbone and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Improves unilateral arm strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot and trap the band under that foot.
2. Grasp the band with the same-side hand and keep your elbow tucked to your ribcage.
3. Curl your hand toward your shoulder and lower slowly with control.
Safety cue: Stand tall hinge slightly from hips and curl with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one leg and place the band under that foot, keeping the other knee lifted.
2. Hold the band with the hand on the same side and let the arm hang by your side.
3. With a slight bend in the elbow, lift the arm out to shoulder height.
4. Lower the arm with control and keep your core engaged to maintain balance.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee soft and hips level

Health benefit: Develops chest strength while challenging postural control
Steps to perform:
1. Place the resistance band under your front foot and step into a tandem stance with one foot directly behind the other; hold handles at chest level.
2. Pull your shoulders down and back, brace your core, and keep a slight bend in your knees.
3. Press both hands straight forward until your arms are fully extended.
4. Slowly return your hands to chest level under control.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders square and spine neutral

Health benefit: Builds shoulder stability and improves core resistance to rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the middle of the resistance band and hold one handle overhead with your arm straight and palm facing forward.
2. Squeeze your glutes and brace your core to keep your torso tall and your shoulder stable.
3. Hold the position for the desired time, then switch arms.
Safety cue: Brace core and avoid overarching lower back

Health benefit: Increases triceps strength and single-leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Step on the resistance band with one foot and lift the other foot slightly off the ground; grasp the handle behind your head with your elbow bent.
2. Keep your elbow close to your ear and maintain an upright torso.
3. Extend your forearm upward to straighten the elbow while balancing on one leg.
4. Lower the handle back behind your head slowly and repeat, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Tuck elbow and control the band on the descent

Health benefit: Promotes upper back strength and scapular retraction control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at head height to a sturdy point.
2. Kneel with one knee on the ground and the other foot flat, grab the band with both hands and extend your arms.
3. Pull the band toward your face, lead with your elbows and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
4. Slowly extend your arms back to the start with control.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and keep torso tall

Health benefit: Improves upper back strength and unilateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height to a sturdy point.
2. Assume a split stance with the front knee bent and the back leg straight, and hold the band handle with one hand.
3. Pull the handle toward your torso, keep the elbow close to your body, and squeeze the shoulder blade.
4. Return the handle to the start with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Brace your core and pull the band with elbow driving back slowly

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder muscles and improves single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot and loop the band under that foot, holding the band ends in both hands.
2. Hinge forward at the hips with a flat back and a slight bend in the standing knee.
3. With palms facing each other, lift both arms out to the sides in a wide arc and squeeze your shoulder blades.
4. Lower the arms slowly to the start while maintaining balance.
Safety cue: Maintain a hip hinge and control the band as shoulders open

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder overhead strength and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with toes on the middle of the resistance band and heels elevated on a small block; hold the band ends in each hand.
2. Hinge slightly at the hips and raise your arms diagonally overhead into a Y with thumbs pointing up.
3. Press the band upward and back until arms are fully extended without shrugging shoulders.
4. Lower the arms slowly to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Engage glutes and core keep chest tall exhale during controlled overhead press

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder blade stability and upper back posture
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and grasp the handle with one hand, stepping back to create tension.
2. Keep your arm straight and pull your shoulder blade directly toward your spine without rotating the torso.
3. Pause with the scapula squeezed, then slowly return to the starting length of the band.
Safety cue: Stabilize torso and pull the shoulder blade back without shrugging

Health benefit: Strengthens glute muscles and improves single leg pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one foot flat and loop the band under that foot, holding the band across your hips; extend the opposite leg.
2. Drive through the planted foot and lift your hips until your torso and thigh form a straight line.
3. Squeeze the working glute at the top while keeping the raised leg aligned with the torso.
4. Lower your hips slowly to the mat with control.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel keep hips level and core braced as you lift

Health benefit: Increases single leg strength and lower body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Secure the resistance band to a sturdy overhead anchor and hold both ends at chest level.
2. Stand on one leg and extend the other leg straight in front of you.
3. Bend the standing knee and lower into a pistol squat while using the band to support your weight.
4. Push through the heel and use the band to assist you back to standing.
Safety cue: Keep weight in heel and sit back slowly maintaining knee alignment

Health benefit: Enhances multidirectional lunge strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Loop the band under the lead foot and hold the ends at chest height.
2. Step the same foot to a chosen clock position and lower into a controlled lunge.
3. Drive through the front heel to return to the start while maintaining band tension.
4. Repeat the lunge to other clock positions before switching legs.
Safety cue: Step with control and keep front knee tracking over toes

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor endurance and walking coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band low behind you and loop the free end around the front of one ankle.
2. Stand tall and brace your core while holding a stable support if needed.
3. Lift the banded knee toward hip height against the band's resistance in a marching motion.
4. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Stand tall brace your core and lift slowly from the hip

Health benefit: Strengthens hamstrings and enhances single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on one foot with the band looped under that foot and hold the band ends in both hands.
2. Hinge at the hips with a soft knee and push the free leg back as you lower your torso, keeping the band taut.
3. Drive the standing hip forward and squeeze the glute to return to standing while keeping a neutral spine.
Safety cue: Hinge from hips with a flat back and soft knee

Health benefit: Improves lateral hip strength and reactive balance
Steps to perform:
1. Place a loop band around your ankles and stand feet hip-width apart with a slight knee bend.
2. Step laterally with one foot against the band's tension while keeping your torso upright.
3. Bring the trailing foot together and lift it briefly to balance on the stepping leg.
4. Hold the balance for a moment, then step back out and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Push through heel on step and stabilize through the standing hip

Health benefit: Improves ankle stability and strength of supporting foot muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with your heel on the floor and securely anchor one end of the band to a stable object outside the foot.
2. Loop the free end around the forefoot so the band pulls the sole outward.
3. Slowly turn the sole of your foot inward against the band's resistance, then return to neutral.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral ankle alignment and invert slowly with controlled tension

Health benefit: Develops single leg strength and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the center of a loop resistance band with feet hip-width and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back into a controlled reverse lunge, keeping torso upright and band tension.
3. Drive the back knee forward and up into a high knee, pulling the band upward.
4. Return to standing with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep torso upright and drive through heel when returning to high knee

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a resistance band around both ankles and stand tall on one leg.
2. Brace the core and lift the free leg out to the side until the band is taut.
3. Hold the raised position with hips level, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep standing hip stacked and pelvis level control abduction without torso lean

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and improves rotational control and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot on the center of a loop band and hold the ends at chest height.
2. Step the other leg diagonally behind into a curtsy lunge, keeping the front knee aligned.
3. Push through the front heel to rise and bring the back leg forward into a single-leg balance while maintaining band tension.
4. Hold the balance briefly, then lower the back foot and repeat before switching sides.
Safety cue: Descend into curtsy with chest up knee tracking over toes then stabilize through core

Health benefit: Enhances anti rotation core strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor with feet hip-width.
2. Hold both ends with both hands at your chest and step away to create tension.
3. Extend your arms forward and brace your core, keeping hips square.
4. Move your arms in slow controlled circles while maintaining tension and a neutral spine.
Safety cue: Brace your core keep ribs down move slowly maintaining neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves contralateral coordination and posterior chain activation
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor one end of the band low and loop the other end around the top of one foot while on hands and knees.
2. Brace your core and extend the banded leg straight back until it aligns with your torso.
3. Reach the opposite arm forward as you hold the leg extension, keeping hips level.
4. Return both limbs to the starting position with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and spine neutral as you extend opposite arm and banded leg

Health benefit: Increases shoulder stability and anterior core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Secure the band under a stable anchor in front of you and assume a high plank facing the anchor.
2. Grip the band with one hand and keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
3. Reach the band-hand forward, fully extending the arm while preventing hip rotation.
4. Pull the hand back under your shoulder with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and brace your core

Health benefit: Builds anti rotation endurance and lateral trunk stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor band at chest height and grab the handle with both hands while standing perpendicular to the anchor.
2. Step away to create tension and hold your hands at chest level with feet shoulder-width.
3. Press your arms straight in front and resist the band pulling you into rotation.
4. Brace your core and hold the position for the target time.
Safety cue: Anchor ribs over pelvis, press into band and prevent torso rotation

Health benefit: Improves core timing and coordinated limb control
Steps to perform:
1. Secure the band overhead and lie on your back with knees bent and feet lifted off the floor.
2. Hold the band with both hands extended toward the anchor and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly lower one leg and the opposite arm toward the floor while maintaining band tension.
4. Return both limbs to center and repeat on the other side in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Lower limbs with control while keeping low back gently pressed to floor

Health benefit: Strengthens obliques and hip external rotators for side stability
Steps to perform:
1. Loop the band around your thighs above the knees and set up in a side plank on your elbow with legs stacked.
2. Lift your hips to form a straight line from head to heels and stabilize your torso.
3. Open your top knee against the band for a clamshell, then close it while keeping hips elevated.
Safety cue: Stack shoulders, keep hips lifted, and move the top knee with control

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on a mat and loop the band around the back of your head, holding ends at your temples.
2. Sit tall and brace your core with a neutral spine.
3. Move your hands and the band in a slow circular path around your head, keeping constant tension.
4. Reverse the circle after the set and keep movements controlled.
Safety cue: Keep ribs stacked over hips and move slowly with shoulder blade control

Health benefit: Builds core stability and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Place a loop band around your wrists, come to hands and knees, and lift knees a few inches off the ground so hips stay level.
2. Push your hands outward against the band's resistance and draw your belly toward your spine.
3. Hold a steady breath and maintain a flat back for the required time.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine with hips level and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances pelvic stability and coordinated hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and loop the band around the arches of both feet.
2. Hold the band's ends at your hips and press your lower back into the floor.
3. Engage your core and lift one foot a few inches off the ground in a controlled march while keeping band tension.
4. Alternate legs smoothly and keep your hips level throughout.
Safety cue: Press lower back into mat and march slowly with controlled core

Health benefit: Builds core anti rotation strength and unilateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on your right knee with your left foot flat and loop the resistance band overhead to your right; grasp the band with both hands at chest height.
2. Brace your core and pull the band down and across your body toward your left hip in a controlled chop.
3. Hold the end position isometrically for the prescribed time while keeping your torso stable.
4. Slowly return to chest height and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Brace core keep hips square and generate movement from the torso
is_not_suitable_for: Chronic Low Back Pain, Osteoporosis, Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease

Health benefit: Improves integrated pressing strength and contralateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and step the band under your left foot; hold the band in your right hand at shoulder level.
2. Sit back into a controlled squat while keeping the band at the shoulder and your chest upright.
3. Drive up through your legs and press the band overhead until your elbow is extended.
4. Lower the band back to shoulder level and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Drive through front heel and keep chest tall with shoulders packed

Health benefit: Enhances balance, proprioception, and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on your left foot and secure one end of the resistance band under that foot; hold the other end in your right hand with light tension.
2. Hinge forward and simultaneously extend your right leg and left arm out to the side into a star position while keeping the standing knee soft.
3. Control the return to upright and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and move slowly to maintain control

Health benefit: Strengthens glute activation while promoting shoulder endurance and upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Step on the center of a long resistance band with feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ends overhead with arms extended.
2. Bend knees into a shallow squat and brace your core.
3. Take a wide controlled step to the right, keeping the band taut overhead.
4. Step the left foot in to meet the right and continue side-stepping, then repeat to the left.
Safety cue: Brace core, keep chest lifted, take controlled lateral steps

Health benefit: Increases single leg strength and rotational mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Place one end of the resistance band under your front foot and hold the other end with both hands at chest height.
2. Lower into a split squat by bending the front knee until the thigh is near parallel to the floor.
3. Rotate your torso away from the front leg while extending your arms to create tension on the band.
4. Drive up through the front heel and return your hands to chest position.
Safety cue: Keep front knee tracking over toes and rotate from torso

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance while building posterior chain and rowing strength
Steps to perform:
1. Loop a resistance band under the working foot and hold the ends with both hands at chest level.
2. Lift the non-working leg slightly and sit back into a single-leg squat on the working leg.
3. As you rise, pull your elbows back to perform a rowing motion against the band.
4. Lower with control and repeat for the desired repetitions.
Safety cue: Hinge hips back, keep weight on heel, row with scapular squeeze

Health benefit: Develops lower body power and overhead pressing coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your front foot on the resistance band and hold the ends at shoulder height.
2. Step back into a lunge until both knees are bent.
3. Drive through the front heel to stand and press the band overhead until arms are straight.
4. Lower the band to shoulder height and repeat with control.
Safety cue: Drive through front heel, keep ribs down, exhale on press

Health benefit: Improves single-leg strength and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Place a low platform in front and loop the band under the stepping foot while holding the ends at your hips.
2. Step onto the platform with the banded foot and press through the heel to fully stand.
3. Bring the trailing foot up and hold a single-leg balance with the band under tension.
4. Step down slowly and repeat for the desired reps.
Safety cue: Drive through lead heel keeping hips level and chest tall

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and pelvic control during walking
Steps to perform:
1. Secure the band around your waist and anchor it behind at hip height.
2. Stand with feet in a straight line and maintain a tall posture.
3. Step forward heel-to-toe while resisting the backward pull of the band.
4. Continue the tandem walk for the set distance, then turn and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine and steady small steps to control band tension

Health benefit: Enhances full-body coordination and controlled mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with the resistance band looped under your right foot and held in your right hand extended toward the ceiling.
2. Brace your core and roll onto your left forearm while keeping the band arm straight overhead.
3. Push through the left foot and press your hips up into a partial bridge while keeping the band arm locked.
4. Reverse the movement slowly to return to lying and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Move slowly exhaling during transitions and keep shoulder packed over ribs

Health benefit: Builds lower-body strength and improves balance during transitions
Steps to perform:
1. Stand on the center of a looped resistance band with feet hip-width apart and hold the ends at your shoulders.
2. Sit back into a squat keeping chest up and knees tracking over toes.
3. Drive through one foot to stand tall and lift the other foot into a single-leg stance with band tension.
4. Lower the lifted foot back to a squat and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Sit back into squat keeping knees tracking toes then shift weight with control

Health benefit: Promotes chest activation and unilateral shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band at chest height and stand perpendicular to the anchor holding the far end in your outside hand.
2. Step away to create light tension and adopt a split stance for stability.
3. With a slight bend in the elbow, open the arm out to the side to feel the band pull.
4. Squeeze the chest and bring the hand across your body in a controlled arc, then return slowly.
Safety cue: Hinge slightly with braced core and keep shoulder blade stable against torso

Health benefit: Develops eccentric hamstring strength and knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a long resistance band to a low, sturdy point and loop the free end around your torso just below the armpits.
2. Kneel on a pad with your ankles secured under a stable object and keep your body stiff from knees to shoulders.
3. Slowly lean forward from the knees, resisting the descent with your hamstrings and the band.
4. Use the band to assist you back to the upright kneeling start if needed.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked over knees and descend slowly with control

Health benefit: Improves explosive lower-body power and sprint acceleration
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band low behind you and loop the other end snugly around your hips or waist.
2. Set up in a sprinter start with one foot forward, the back knee bent, and hands on the ground for balance.
3. Explode forward into the sprint position by driving through the front leg and pumping the arms while the band provides rearward resistance.
Safety cue: Maintain neutral spine and drive through hips with controlled acceleration
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, Hyperthyroidism, Metabolic Syndrome, Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD)

Health benefit: Improves core endurance and trunk stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Attach a light resistance band to a low anchor and loop the free end around the arches of your feet.
2. Lie on your back, press your lower back into the floor, lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches, and hold a hollow body shape.
3. Rock gently back and forth using your abs while maintaining band tension and a flat lower back.
Safety cue: Press lower back into the floor and breathe evenly throughout

Health benefit: Increases rotational power and oblique muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor the band low to your right and grasp the handle with both hands, arms extended toward the anchor.
2. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hinge slightly at the hips, and rotate your torso away from the anchor.
3. Explosively pull the band diagonally upward and across your body in a chopping motion, driving the rotation with your hips.
4. Control the return to the start and repeat quickly for the desired reps, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Rotate from the torso with a braced core and controlled speed
